2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - ENGIE and BASF sign power purchase agreement for renewable energy in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">ENGIE and BASF have signed a 25-year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) for renewable energy in Europe. Under the PPA, effective as of January 1, 2022, ENGIE will provide BASF with up to 20.7 terawatt hours of renewable electricity in total throughout the term of the agreement.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-396.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-383" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-383.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF bundles renewable energy activities in new subsidiary  BASF Renewable Energy GmbH||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/BREn_Team-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 25, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF bundles renewable energy activities in new subsidiary  BASF Renewable Energy GmbH</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is bundling its activities in renewable energies under the umbrella of BASF Renewable Energy GmbH as of January 1, 2022. The wholly owned subsidiary’s business activities will focus on supplying the BASF Group in Europe with electricity from renewable energies, electricity trading activities in Europe and global consulting for BASF and its Group companies in the field of renewable energies. The company is based in Ludwigshafen and will be managed by Horatio Evers, who was previously responsible for the development of renewable energies at BASF SE.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-384" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-384.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF is accelerating the implementation of its CO2 reduction targets ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-384.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P384_Lars_Kissau_Teaser:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 24, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is accelerating the implementation of its CO2 reduction targets </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With a new project organization, BASF is bundling and accelerating its extensive cross-company activities to reduce its CO<sub>2 </sub>emissions by 25 percent by 2030 compared with 2018 and become climate neutral by 2050. The unit, called “Net Zero Accelerator”, focuses on implementing and accelerating projects relating to low-CO<sub>2 </sub>production technologies, circular economy and renewable energies. “With the new project organization, we are continuing to accelerate and create more powerful structures within BASF to achieve our ambitious goals,” said Dr. Martin Brudermüller, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE. “This further step demonstrates the determination to drive forward our transformation to a climate-neutral company.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 22, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Air Liquide and BASF welcome support from European Innovation Fund for joint CCS project</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Air Liquide and BASF are planning to develop the world’s largest cross-border Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) value chain. The goal is to significantly reduce CO<sub>2</sub> emissions at the industrial cluster in the port of Antwerp. The joint project “Kairos@C” has been selected for funding by the European Commission through its Innovation Fund, as one of the seven large-scale projects out of more than 300 applications.</div><div business to KaMin</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 18, 2021 – BASF and KaMin LLC. / CADAM S.A. (KaMin) have signed an agreement to sell BASF’s kaolin minerals business to KaMin, a global performance minerals company headquartered in Macon, Georgia, United States. Currently, the kaolin minerals business is part of BASF’s Performance Chemicals division. Pending approval by the relevant merger control authorities, closing of the transaction is expected in the second half of 2022.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a consumer needs with natural solutions for the personal care industry </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At this year’s SCS Formulate on November 16 and 17 in Coventry, BASF’s Care Creations® will focus on the consumer need for natural, more sustainable cosmetics. “Consumer demand for natural cosmetics is growing rapidly, prompting the personal care industry to find eco-friendly alternatives to traditional ingredients. We have a large portfolio of biodegradable solutions from renewable resources and are continuously expanding our offering with new innovations to help our customers meet this consumer trend,” said Samantha Cole, Business Manager UK &amp; Nordics. It is a constant driving force to improve our range of more sustainable products and production methods. At BASF we have set ourselves far-reaching goals to work on new concepts and technologies for net zero CO<sub>2</sub> emissions by 2050. close sale of Solenis to Platinum Equity</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Wilmington, Delaware, USA, November 9, 2021 – Following the approval by all relevant authorities, BASF and Clayton, Dubilier &amp; Rice closed the sale of Solenis to Platinum Equity. The transaction implies an enterprise value for Solenis of $5.25 billion, which includes net debt of around $2.5 billion.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-372.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-374" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-374.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||From solids to liquids: trinamiX expands NIR spectroscopy portfolio by transmission solution||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 9, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">From solids to liquids: trinamiX expands NIR spectroscopy portfolio by transmission solution</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><i>Ludwigshafen, 09/11/2021</i> - trinamiX GmbH, a wholly owned subsidiary of BASF SE, is presenting the latest addition to their pioneering portfolio: A portable solution to grant institutions and companies immediate insights into the molecular composition of liquids. trinamiX has once more successfully transformed the established method of near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy into an accessible, affordable, and easy-to-use solution for broad usage beyond common lab applications. By opening up the world of what is naturally hidden from the eyes, the solution enables customers across various markets to make informed decisions – right on the spot, anywhere they are.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 4, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Styropor® Ccycled™ for Stressless® packaging: proven material with reduced carbon footprint for high-end design furniture</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen, Germany and Vartdal/Ikornnes, Norway, 04 November 2021</b> – As of November 2021, Ekornes, a Norwegian manufacturer of high-end design furniture uses EPS (expandable polystyrene) protective packaging that has a lower carbon footprint than virgin material by safeguarding the same properties. This is achieved by replacing fossil resources with recycled raw materials at the beginning of production. BASF supplies Styropor<sup>®</sup> Ccycled™ to VARTDAL PLAST, who converts the material into moulded packaging parts for Stressless<sup>®</sup> furniture made by Ekornes.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/11/p-21-367.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-364" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-364.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Personnel Changes at BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-364.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P364_Teaser_alle4_neu:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 29, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Personnel Changes at BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is reorganizing its global research activities. In the course of the second quarter of 2022, they will be bundled in a central research unit based in Ludwigshafen. <b>Detlef Kratz</b> (59), President, will lead the new central division, which will have around 3,500 employees. Kratz currently heads BASF’s Process Research &amp; Chemical Engineering division in Ludwigshafen. At the same time, around 1,800 researchers will move to operating divisions – and thus work even more closely with the business units. This will further strengthen the customer focus of research and development. Details on the future global structure of BASF’s research will be announced by the company at a later date.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-364.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">50 years of BASF’s gas treatment in industrial scale</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The purification of gases has a long tradition at BASF since the development of the Haber-Bosch process. Fifty years ago – in 1971 – the company started up an ammonia plant at its Ludwigshafen site using a new gas scrubbing technology that has revolutionized industrial gas purification ever since.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-355.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-356" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-356.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||As blue as the sky: new Neopolen color grade for transport boxes, toys and leisure products||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-356.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P356e_Pressefoto_Neopolen_hellblau_14988:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 28, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">As blue as the sky: new Neopolen color grade for transport boxes, toys and leisure products</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now extending the color range of its expanded polypropylene foam (EPP) Neopolen®. The new color grade is characterized by a deep light blue and complements the existing range of four bright colors signal red, azure blue, dark green and sunny yellow, in which BASF's EPP has been available to date. Neopolen® P 9435 LB (LB: light blue) offers the excellent material properties of the Neopolen® family. It is particularly suitable for toys and leisure products, transport containers in the catering and gastronomy sectors, dunnage trays in automotive production, and high-quality reusable packaging.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-356.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-348" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-348.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF with continued strong performance in Q3 2021||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-348.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Auswahl_Fahnen_D16_002_Fahnen_2016:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 27, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF with continued strong performance in Q3 2021</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group’s strong business development continued in the third quarter of 2021. Demand for BASF’s products remained solid over the summer months. “This enabled us to continue to grow profitably,” said BASF’s Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors, Dr.&nbsp;Martin Brudermüller, who presented the results of the third quarter together with Chief Financial Officer Dr.&nbsp;Hans-Ulrich Engel.&nbsp;“Compared with the third quarter of the previous year, we increased prices by 36 percent and volumes by 6 percent,” Brudermüller said.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-348.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-363" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-363.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint Press Release - BASF and Entegris sign agreement on the sale of Precision Microchemicals business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-363.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 27, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint Press Release - BASF and Entegris sign agreement on the sale of Precision Microchemicals business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Entegris have signed an agreement on the sale of the Precision Microchemicals business to Entegris for US$90 million. BASF and Sport Group start global cooperation in the field of sports and outdoor flooring systems</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><i>Ludwigshafen, Germany, October 25, 2021</i>: BASF and Sport Group, Burgheim, have started their cooperation for the distribution and installation of the new, sustainable flooring system with Infinergy®.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-354.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-357" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-357.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release - BASF and SVOLT form partnership to advance battery materials development and battery recycling solutions globally</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and SVOLT have entered into an agreement in which both parties will partner throughout their global operations with regards to cathode active materials (CAM) development, raw materials supply and battery recycling for SVOLT’s battery cells.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-357.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-336" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-336.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives Pierre Potier Award for its EcoSun Pass®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 21, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives Pierre Potier Award for its EcoSun Pass®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Paris, France – October 21, 2021 </b>– BASF’s Care Creations<sup>®</sup> has been honored with the Pierre Potier Award for its EcoSun Pass<sup>®</sup>, a methodology especially developed for sun protection products to evaluate the environmental compatibility of UV filter systems in sunscreens. The company won second prize in the category of processes or systems that are respectful of the environment. Created in 2006 by the French Ministry of Economy, Finance and Industry and supported by the “Fondation de la Maison de la Chimie” and “France Chimie”, the Pierre Potier Prize appreciates innovations in the area of chemistry that are particularly sustainable and promotes the development of sustainable solutions for consumers’ everyday lives.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-343" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-343.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release - BASF and Vipergen accelerate targeted research and development of sustainable crop protection products ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-343.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P343e_Cooperation_BASF_Vipergen:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 21, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - BASF and Vipergen accelerate targeted research and development of sustainable crop protection products </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany, and Copenhagen, Denmark – Farmers worldwide are facing the challenge of feeding a growing population while reducing the impact of agriculture on the environment. BASF partners with Vipergen, a global leader in research services, to apply their &nbsp;technology to discover new active ingredients for sustainable crop protection products more efficiently and quickly.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-343.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-335" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-335.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Cosmetorium 2021: BASF showcases minimalistic and effective solutions for the personal care industry ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P335e_BASF_Minimalist10:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 20, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cosmetorium 2021: BASF showcases minimalistic and effective solutions for the personal care industry </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At this year’s Cosmetorium in Barcelona on October 20 and 21, BASF’s Care Creations® will focus on the clean beauty trend which is an important driver for the personal care industry. “There is an increasing number of consumers embracing minimalism as a way of life, looking for simplicity in their beauty routines and versatile, effective products to reduce excessive consumerism”, said Esther Prat, Senior Operative Marketing Manager Iberia/North Africa. Together with its European distribution organization BTC Europe, BASF will share stand 294 and present its latest solutions for the personal care industry to meet this consumer demand.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-347" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-347.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2021, Conference Call on October 27, 2021, at 8.00 a.m. (CEST)||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-347.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Auswahl_Fahnen_D16_002_Fahnen_2016:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Ludwigshafen, Germany</b> – BASF Animal Nutrition and trinamiX GmbH, a wholly owned subsidiary of BASF SE, join forces to introduce trinamiX’ Mobile Near Infrared (NIR) Spectroscopy Solution to the feed industry. With today’s launch, the portable NIR solution provides customers across the entire value chain with a fast and reliable on-site analysis of animal feed and ingredients.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-340.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-338" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-338.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces Enable™ FCC additive for superior performance in emissions and regenerator afterburn control||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-338.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P338_Enable_Social_Media_Image-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 6, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces Enable™ FCC additive for superior performance in emissions and regenerator afterburn control</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Today BASF announced the commercial launch of Enable™, its next-generation Carbon Monoxide (CO) promoter additive. Enable significantly enhances activity and delivers superior performance for refiners with more efficient use of precious metal. Enable optimizes durability via support surface morphology modification and the combination of differentiating design features offers customers significant performance improvement in controlling regenerator afterburn.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-338.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-325" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-325.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Decorative marbling for injection-molded parts made of Ultrason®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-325.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P325e_Pressefoto_Ultrason_marbled:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 5, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Decorative marbling for injection-molded parts made of Ultrason®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With a patent pending BASF technology it is now possible to produce marbled serial components made of Ultrason® using a standard injection molding process. The coloring technique opens up virtually unlimited possibilities for designers to use BASF's polyarylethersulfone to color household appliances, catering bowls and containers as well as visible components. For the first time, surface effects such as color shades, color streaks and patterns can be reproduced.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/10/p-21-325.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/09/p-21-323" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/09/p-21-323.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||NAS® battery system starts up at BASF’s Antwerp Verbund site||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/09/p-21-323.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P323_Teaser_IMG_3976_:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">NAS® battery system starts up at BASF’s Antwerp Verbund site</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Antwerp, Belgium, and Ludwigshafen, Germany – BASF New Business GmbH (BNB) has successfully started up a system comprising four NAS<sup>®</sup> battery containers, which have been integrated into the electricity grid at BASF’s Verbund site in Antwerp, Belgium. With this long-term project in Antwerp, the BASF team wants to test various operating scenarios and further explore the potential of NAS<sup>®</sup> batteries. NAS<sup>®</sup> batteries are sodium-sulfur batteries with high energy content that are designed for stationary electricity storage.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Plastics are an essential part of modern life. At the same time, they have become one of the most discussed topics. The public is debating more than ever about how plastics are used and why. Together with customers and partners, BASF has set itself the goal to contribute to a circular economy in which raw materials are conserved, plastic waste is reduced and materials can develop their full potential during use. surfactants</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 21, 2021 –</b> Effective October 1, 2021, or as contractual obligations allow, BASF will class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF's Coatings division employs Covestro's Ultra line of coating hardeners </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF's Coatings division, a leading global supplier of premium-quality, durable and sustainable refinish coatings, is using a broad range of hardeners, including Covestro Desmodur<sup>®</sup> Ultra activators. This allows BASF to upgrade its refinish coatings portfolio to meet higher occupational safety standards on the use of isocyanates. The hardeners contain very low residual amounts of monomeric diisocyanates of less than 0.1 percent by weight, setting an entirely new standard in occupational hygiene.&nbsp;</div><div This is the first FLNG reference worldwide for BASF’s OASE Gas Treatment technology. Together with PETRONAS and the Japanese engineering partner JGC Corporation, PFLNG DUA has been successfully started up in February 2021 and completed its Performance Test Run in May 2021. The floating LNG facility opens a new source of supply for cleaner energy as it is designed to extract natural gas from deepwater gas reservoirs in depths up to 1,500 meters.</div><div class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Bayer supports easyconnect closed transfer system</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany, September 1, 2021 – In a move consistent with the CropLife Europe commitment to make closed transfer systems (CTS) universally available to European farmers and operators by 2030, Bayer has joined the cross-industry group developing the easyconnect closed transfer system. Together with ADAMA, BASF, Belchim Crop Protection, Certis Europe, Corteva Agriscience, FMC Corporation, Nufarm, Rovensa Group and Syngenta, Bayer will bring the easyconnect system to the market, providing a compelling solution that is fast, safe and convenient for farmers and operators in Europe. At the same time, Bayer will continue to support implementation of closed transfer systems via commercially available solutions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes purchase of 49.5% of the offshore wind farm Hollandse Kust Zuid from Vattenfall</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Following the approval of all relevant authorities, BASF has today successfully completed the purchase of 49.5% of the offshore wind farm Hollandse Kust Zuid from Vattenfall. The closing of the transaction, originally expected for the fourth quarter of 2021, was completed earlier than planned.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/09/p-21-297.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-288" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-288.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Lightweight and emission reduction – roof frames made with Ultradur® High Speed||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-288.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P288_Auto-Dachhimmel_Collage:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 31, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lightweight and emission reduction – roof frames made with Ultradur® High Speed</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The trend to panoramic roofs is ever increasing in the automotive industry. The actual sunroof opening in the headliner is supported by a structural bracket. Traditionally this is made of heavy steel. In close cooperation, Grupo Antolin and BASF have developed a plastic frame made of Ultradur<sup>®</sup> High Speed that can be used for open panorama headliners. The novel and newly design of these parts allow a weight reduction up to 60% compared to other traditional solutions. Besides a high dimensional stability, the Engineering Plastic convinces with excellent mechanical properties.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-288.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-294" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-294.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Shanshan form battery materials joint venture in China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/08/p-21-294.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P294_Da%20_Chang_Sha_Site_Hunan_China_-_2nd_phase_already_under_construction:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 31, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Shanshan form battery materials joint venture in China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Germany and Shanghai/China, August 31, 2021 – Following the approval of all relevant authorities, BASF and Shanshan have formed the joint venture “BASF Shanshan Battery Materials Co., Ltd.”. The new facilities will enable <i>in vivo</i> sensory and performance testing of ethnic skin and hair care formulations on volunteers, helping customers to develop finished products with high relevance and consumer acceptance in the sub-Saharan African market. “To develop successful formulations and ingredients for ethnic personal care products, a deep understanding of African consumers’ preferences and pain points, their skin and hair characteristics, as well as how ingredients affect them is indispensable,” said Tosin Dania, Technical Manager Personal Care sub-Saharan Africa. “The BASF ‘Care Evaluation Salon’ combines market empathy, science excellence and formulation expertise, allowing us to share this understanding and benefit with our customers across the region.”</div><div Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 13, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Venture Capital invests in Indian hydroponics pioneer UrbanKisaan</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Hyderabad, India, and Ludwigshafen, Germany, July 13, 2021 – </b>BASF Venture Capital GmbH (BVC) is investing in the Indian startup UrbanKisaan, which specializes in hydroponic cultivation of various types of vegetables, greens and herbs in tropical urban environments. This is BVC’s first investment in an early stage business focusing on India. Conceptualized in 2017, UrbanKisaan operates several suburban greenhouses and vertical indoor farms in Hyderabad and Bangalore. The company sells the fresh produce, some of which is grown directly in the shops, in its franchise-owned brick-and-mortar stores and via an app and website. Both parties agreed not to disclose financial details of the investment.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-259.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-260" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-260.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group releases preliminary figures for the second quarter of 2021 and increases forecast for full year 2021||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-260.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 9, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group releases preliminary figures for the second quarter of 2021 and increases forecast for full year 2021</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – July 9, 2021 – BASF Group has released preliminary figures for the second quarter of 2021. <b>Sales </b>increased by 55.8&nbsp;percent in the second quarter of 2021 to €19,753&nbsp;million (Q2&nbsp;2020: €12,680&nbsp;million). This was driven by higher prices (+35 percent) and volumes (+28 percent); negative currency effects (–7 percent) had an offsetting effect. The average analyst estimates for BASF Group’s sales in the second quarter of 2021 amount to €17,157 million.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-260.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-253" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-253.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Clayton, Dubilier &amp; Rice to sell Solenis to Platinum Equity||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-253.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 6, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Clayton, Dubilier &amp; Rice to sell Solenis to Platinum Equity</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Wilmington, Delaware, USA, July 6, 2021 – BASF and Clayton, Dubilier &amp; Rice have signed an agreement to sell Solenis to Platinum Equity, a California-based private equity company founded in 1995. The transaction implies an enterprise value for Solenis of $5.25 billion, which includes net debt of around $2.5 billion, subject to adjustments at closing. Since February&nbsp;1, 2019, BASF has held 49% of the shares in Solenis and accounted for its share in the company using the equity method; 51% of the shares have been held by funds managed by Clayton, Dubilier &amp; Rice and the Solenis management. Pending approval by the relevant authorities, closing of the transaction is expected before the end of 2021.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-253.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-254" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-254.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands chemical catalyst recycling capacity and capability||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-254.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P254_BASF_expands_chemical_catalyst_recycling_capacity_and_capability:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 2, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands chemical catalyst recycling capacity and capability</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">ISELIN, NJ, July 2, 2021 — BASF has expanded its chemical catalyst recycling capacity and capability with the acquisition of Zodiac Enterprises LLC in Caldwell, Texas. The site recycles precious metals from industrial scrap, primarily chemical catalysts, and will complement BASF’s existing precious metal recycling operations in Seneca, South Carolina. It will also provide increased smelting capacity in North America. Additional personnel will be hired to expand the site’s production capabilities.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/07/p-21-254.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-242" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-242.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF closes divestiture of its global pigments business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-242.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 30, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF closes divestiture of its global pigments business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On June 30, 2021, BASF closed the divestiture of its global pigments business to the fine chemical company DIC following the fulfillment of clearance conditions. The purchase price on a cash and debt-free basis is €1.15 billion.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-242.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-243" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-243.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces VALERAS™, a new brand for its plastic additives portfolio that enables customers to achieve their sustainability goals||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-243.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P243_Dr_Thomas_Kloster:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 30, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces VALERAS™, a new brand for its plastic additives portfolio that enables customers to achieve their sustainability goals</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – June 30, 2021 – BASF has focused the sustainable solutions of its plastic additives’ portfolio under the new global brand VALERAS™. VALERAS bundles the company’s longtime experience, innovative solutions, and regulatory support with the aim to increase the sustainability of plastics along the entire polymer value chain. Later this year, the portfolio will expand to include the company’s additive packages for mechanically recycled plastics and their applications.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Belchim Crop Protection, FMC Corporation and Rovensa Group support easyconnect closed transfer system</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany, June 30, 2021 – In a move consistent with the CropLife Europe commitment to make closed transfer systems (CTS) universally available, the number of agricultural crop protection manufacturers supporting the easyconnect CTS continues to grow. From June 2021, Belchim Crop Protection, FMC Corporation and Rovensa Group join forces with ADAMA, BASF, Certis Europe, Corteva Agriscience, Nufarm and Syngenta to introduce easyconnect into the European market.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-244.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-249" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-249.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands portfolio of RSPO-certified surfactants, underlining its clear commitment for the use of sustainable palm (kernel) oil-based products||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-249.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 30, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands portfolio of RSPO-certified surfactants, underlining its clear commitment for the use of sustainable palm (kernel) oil-based products</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen, June 30, 2021 –</b> The BASF Home Care, I&amp;I and Industrial Formulators Europe business is significantly expanding its portfolio of palm-based surfactants with RSPO (Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil) certifications. As one of the first RSPO members, BASF is thus underlining its continued commitment to support the production of sustainable palm (kernel) oil in the future. 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Bosch and BASF smart farming joint venture gets global green light</h3><div class="search-result__description" now received approval by all relevant merger control authorities. The JV has been registered as Bosch BASF Smart Farming (BBSF) GmbH.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-233.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-239" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-239.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands biopolymer portfolio with COSMOS-approved rheology modifier Hydagen® Clean||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-239.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 29, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands biopolymer portfolio with COSMOS-approved rheology modifier Hydagen® Clean</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Duesseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – June 29, 2021 </b>– Consumer demand for natural cosmetics is growing rapidly, prompting personal care manufacturers to find eco-friendly alternatives to tried-and-true solutions. With the COSMOS-approved texturizing biopolymer Hydagen<sup>®</sup> Clean, BASF now offers a natural alternative to synthetic polymers. The cold processable rheology modifier, obtained from the tuber of the konjac plant native to Southwest China, is suitable for aqueous systems like gels, fluids and serums, as well as more novel formats such as patches, jellies and peel-off formulations. Its film-forming and gelation properties allow for exceptional textures.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-239.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-241" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-241.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||World's first toxicology testing strategy without animal testing  adopted by OECD||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-241.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 29, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">World's first toxicology testing strategy without animal testing  adopted by OECD</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Germany and Geneva/Switzerland, June 29, 2021 – The world’s first toxicology testing strategy without animal testing has been approved by the OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development). The testing strategy consists of three so-called alternative methods. They can be used to predict whether a substance causes allergic reactions in the skin. Unlike in the past, animal testing will no longer be necessary for this. This testing strategy was developed and validated in a joint effort by BASF and Givaudan. “For more than 10 years, we have been working towards this goal,” says Dr. Robert Landsiedel, Vice President, Special Toxicology, BASF. “We have taken a big step forward. Now we can also use alternative methods to answer more complex toxicological questions without animal testing.” Dr. Andreas Natsch, head of in vitro Molecular Screening at Givaudan adds: “This strategy has a better predictivity for human allergy risks as compared to traditional animal testing.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-241.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-238" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-238.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Vattenfall to sell 49.5% of the offshore wind farm Hollandse Kust Zuid to BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-238.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P238_Bild1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 24, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Vattenfall to sell 49.5% of the offshore wind farm Hollandse Kust Zuid to BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Vattenfall have signed a contract for the purchase of 49.5% of Vattenfall’s wind farm Hollandse Kust Zuid (HKZ) by BASF. The purchase price amounts to €0.3&nbsp;billion and takes into account the achieved status of the project. Including BASF’s contribution to fund the wind farm construction, BASF’s total commitment amounts to around €1.6 billion. Closing of the transaction is expected in the fourth quarter of 2021, subject to the approval of the relevant authorities. Offshore construction of the wind farm will start in July 2021.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-238.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-240" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-240.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to launch RefinityTM, an all-new, cloud-based digital platform for collision repair||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-240.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P240_Refinity_Platform:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 23, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to launch RefinityTM, an all-new, cloud-based digital platform for collision repair</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Coatings division launches Refinity, a new, cloud-based, digital platform for its body shop customers all over the world. The main result: Multilayer films based on PE/PA6 are certified to be recycling compatible for the PE film stream.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-237.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-234" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-234.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||First vegetable seeds grown in BASF’s new state-of-the-art production facility in Ethiopia enter the global market||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-234.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P234e_High-tech_tomato_greenhouse_Ethiopia:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 17, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">First vegetable seeds grown in BASF’s new state-of-the-art production facility in Ethiopia enter the global market</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Nunhem, The Netherlands</b> – The first seeds produced at BASF’s new <br> state-of-the-art production facility in Ethiopia enter the global vegetable seed market. Located in the country’s Amhara region, the facility offers ideal year-round production conditions for sweet pepper, tomato and cucumber. It is BASF’s first high-tech greenhouse complex in Africa. &nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-234.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-236" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-236.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||IPO of Wintershall Dea will be targeted post 2021||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-236.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 16, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">IPO of Wintershall Dea will be targeted post 2021</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With the merger of Wintershall Holding GmbH and DEA Deutsche Erdoel AG in May 2019, two successful companies with a long tradition have formed Europe’s leading independent natural gas and oil company: Wintershall Dea.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-236.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-232" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-232.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives GMP+ and ISO 22000 certifications for its glycerin production at the Dusseldorf site||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-232.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 14, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives GMP+ and ISO 22000 certifications for its glycerin production at the Dusseldorf site</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has obtained two new certifications for its crude glycerin production at the Dusseldorf-Holthausen site: GMP+ and ISO 22000. Both are important standards for the food and feed industry. GMP+ defines the requirements and conditions for setting up a feed safety management system to safeguard, for example, production, processing, storage and handling of feed; the ISO 22000 standard is a management system for ensuring food safety.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-232.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-226" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-226.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Introducing ‘xarvio™ CONNECT’ – fast, secure and seamless data exchange with machinery terminals||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-226.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P226_xarvio_CONNECT_2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 10, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Introducing ‘xarvio™ CONNECT’ – fast, secure and seamless data exchange with machinery terminals</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cologne, Germany – BASF Digital Farming GmbH introduces xarvio™ CONNECT&nbsp; The agreement also includes the associated businesses of vegetable-oil-based raw material sterols and natural vitamin E, anionic surfactants and esters produced at the Kankakee site. All relevant authorities have approved the transaction. Branded as Kensing, the newly formed company has around 190 employees. Both parties agreed not to disclose financial details of the agreement.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/06/p-21-211.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-227" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-227.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Uzin Utz and BASF cooperate on climate protection||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-227.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P227_UU_Group_und_BASF_kooperiern_beim_Klimaschutz:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 27, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Uzin Utz and BASF cooperate on climate protection</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ulm / Ludwigshafen, May 26, 2021 – Saving CO<sub>2</sub> together – this is the motto of the cooperation between the Uzin Utz Group, a full-range supplier of flooring systems, and the chemical company BASF SE. The driver for more climate protection and sustainability is BASF's biomass balance approach. This is because the Ulm-based construction chemicals manufacturer purchases basic products from BASF that have been produced using renewable raw materials according to the certified biomass balance approach. In this way, the proportion of raw materials binders with biomass-based raw materials origin in the laying systems of Uzin Utz is successively increased, which preserves fossil resources and reduces greenhouse gas emissions. By using renewables instead of fossil resources alone, CO<sub>2</sub> emissions at Uzin Utz can be reduced by nearly 3,000 tons per year in terms of raw materials.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-227.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-221" 21, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and RWE plan to cooperate on new technologies for climate protection</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><br> Today in Ludwigshafen, Germany, Dr. Martin Brudermüller (BASF) and Dr. Markus Krebber (RWE), accompanied by Chairman of the Mining, Chemical and Energy Industries Union (IG BCE) Michael Vassiliadis, presented a project idea that shows how industrial production can become sustainable and future-proof. The project envisions an additional offshore wind farm with a capacity of 2 gigawatts (GW) to provide the Ludwigshafen chemical site with green electricity and enable CO<sub>2</sub>-free production of hydrogen. The aim is to electrify the production processes for basic chemicals, which are currently based on fossil fuels.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-217.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-215" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-215.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Shanshan to form a joint venture serving the largest battery materials market, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-215.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P215_Da_Changsha_Site_Hunan_China:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp;
