Closing of the transaction is targeted for later this summer following the approval of the relevant authorities.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-215.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-201" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-201.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s Care Creations® invites customers to exclusive virtual site tours in Lyon and Pulnoy ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-201.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 19, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Care Creations® invites customers to exclusive virtual site tours in Lyon and Pulnoy </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Pulnoy, France – May 19, 2021 </b>– BASF’s Care Creations<sup>®</sup> is introducing a new tool that will allow customers to take part in an exclusive virtual tour through its French laboratory and production sites for cosmetic active ingredients in Pulnoy and Lyon – anywhere, anytime. May 18, 2021</b> - BASF received the German Innovation Award 2021 in the category “Excellence in Business to Business - Chemical Industry” for its innovative project involving the use of smart Intermediate Bulk Containers (IBCs). The award is presented by the German Design Council to recognize aspects of product innovation within different industries that offer additional benefits compared with previous solutions. The Supply Chain Customer Collaboration project is a joint effort between BASF, the lacquer and stain producer Hesse Lignal and Germany-based technology start-up Packwise.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-214.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-210" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-210.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands global PGM refining capacity, further driving circular economy business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-210.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 12, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands global PGM refining capacity, further driving circular economy business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announced today the expansion of its Seneca, South Carolina, USA, Platinum Group Metals <b>(</b>PGM<b>)</b> refining facility. The company will invest double-digit millions in capital improvements to increase refining capacity to recycle precious metals from spent catalysts such as automotive catalytic converters. Recycled metal has as much as 90% lower CO2 emissions than metal from primary mines. By recovering the precious metals for reuse in fresh catalysts BASF closes the loop with circular economy solutions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-210.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-206" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-206.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||LanzaTech and BASF achieve first milestone in utilizing industrial off-gases for chemical production||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-206.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 11, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">LanzaTech and BASF achieve first milestone in utilizing industrial off-gases for chemical production</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Germany and Chicago/USA, May 11, 2021 – Transforming the carbon contained in industrial off-gases into valuable chemicals is the aim of a partnership between LanzaTech and BASF. Now the partners have achieved a key first success: With the help of special bacteria, they have been able to produce n-octanol at laboratory scale from carbon monoxide and hydrogen, the main components of emissions, e.g. from the steel industry. n-octanol is an important molecule that is used in cosmetics, among other uses.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a The polyphenylsulfone (PPSU) meets Zoom T’s strict requirements for its curved baby bottles that are safe and easy to handle. Ultrason<sup>®</sup> P 3010 is approved for food contact and features excellent strength, chemical resistance and resistance to superheated steam up to 180°C (356°F). The BASF PPSU allows for designing complex shapes like the Bétta baby bottles as it is also suitable for extrusion blow molding.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-198.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-207" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-207.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Frank Naber new head of Automotive OEM Coatings Solutions EMEA business unit||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-207.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Frank%20Naber:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 5, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Frank Naber new head of Automotive OEM Coatings Solutions EMEA business unit</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Frank Naber took over the position as head of the Automotive OEM Coatings Solutions EMEA business unit at BASF’s Coatings division effective May 1, 2021. This agreement enables BASF to further develop its production footprint for enzymes and biotechnology products.</p>
<p>Both parties agreed not to disclose financial details of the agreement.</p>

Using nature as a role model, the aviation industry has been intensively researching ways to reduce aerodynamic drag for many years. Now Lufthansa Technik and BASF have succeeded in making the breakthrough as part of a joint project. AeroSHARK, a surface film that mimics the fine structure of a shark’s skin, is to be rolled out on Lufthansa Cargo’s entire freighter fleet from the beginning of 2022, making the aircraft more economical and reducing emissions.&nbsp; &nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/05/p-21-204.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-184" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-184.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF with strong start to 2021 business year||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-184.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">From idea to independence: BASF incubator Chemovator spins off first employee startup</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Mannheim, April 22, 2021 – BOXLAB Services GmbH is the first startup to celebrate its spin-off from Chemovator in April 2021. There, promising ideas outside of the core business of BASF are developed and build into scalable business models and companies. With the right resources, the necessary freedom and respective flexibility, as well as with the help of external startup experts, BASF employees themselves turn into entrepreneurs. Now, first success is becoming visible: BOXLAB Services will from now on operate as an independent startup on the open market. Through BASF Venture Capital GmbH, BASF will be holding minority shares in the newly founded startup.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-194.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-195" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-195.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Three first places: BASF receives BSB innovation awards for Emollient Jockey, Lamesoft® Balance and PeptAIde™ 4.0||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-195.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 22, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Three first places: BASF receives BSB innovation awards for Emollient Jockey, Lamesoft® Balance and PeptAIde™ 4.0</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Duesseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – April 22, 2021 –</b> BASF’s Care Creations<sup>®</sup> has received the first prize of the BSB Innovation Award 2021 in three categories. Emollient Jockey, a digital tool that provides comprehensive data on an emollient’s characteristics and performance, achieved first place in the “Concepts” category. BASF’s readily biodegradable Lamesoft<sup>®</sup> Balance, a product for the stabilization of ingredients in skin and hair cleansing formulations, achieved first place in the “Functionals and Recipients” sub-category of “Cosmetics”. Finally, the active ingredient PeptAIde™ 4.0, a plant-based product derived from rice proteins, was awarded first place in the section “Pigmentation, Brightness, Silent Inflammation” of the “Actives” sub-category.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-195.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-192" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-192.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF, Quantafuel and REMONDIS want to cooperate on chemical recycling of plastic waste||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-192.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/ChemCycling_EN_grafik1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 21, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF, Quantafuel and REMONDIS want to cooperate on chemical recycling of plastic waste</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF, Quantafuel and REMONDIS have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to jointly evaluate a cooperation in chemical recycling including a joint investment into a pyrolysis plant for plastic waste. It is intended that REMONDIS, one of the world’s leading waste and water management companies, supplies suitable plastic waste to the plant, and BASF uses the resulting pyrolysis oil as feedstock in its production Verbund as part of its ChemCycling<sup>TM</sup> project. Quantafuel intends to provide the technology and to operate the plant. The company is a specialist for the pyrolysis of mixed plastic waste and the purification of the resulting pyrolysis oil; the technology is jointly developed and being held with BASF. The location of the pyrolysis plant will be evaluated together.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-192.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-189" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-189.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Omya and BASF continue partnership for Pilot Coating Center for Paper &amp; Board||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-189.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P189_BASF_Paper_Pilot_Coating_Center-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 19, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Omya and BASF continue partnership for Pilot Coating Center for Paper &amp; Board</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany / Oftringen, Switzerland, April 19, 2021. Omya and BASF are the two market leaders in terms of raw materials for the formulation of coating colors used in the paper &amp; board industry. Omya offers mineral filler solutions and innovative coating concepts based on Calcium Carbonate, complementary pigments, and additives, for the production of paper and board. BASF supplies a comprehensive and innovative product range of binders and coating additives for the formulation of paper and board coatings.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-189.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-183" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-183.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Virtual Annual Shareholders’ Meeting and Quarterly Statement - Q1 2021 on April 29, 2021||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-183.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Auswahl_Fahnen_D16_002_Fahnen_2016:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 15, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice - Virtual Annual Shareholders’ Meeting and Quarterly Statement - Q1 2021 on April 29, 2021</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The virtual Annual Shareholders’ Meeting of BASF SE takes place on April&nbsp;29,&nbsp;2021 as of 10.00 a.m. (CEST). For this purpose, either renewable or chemically recycled feedstock is used at the beginning of the value chain instead of fossil resources. The alternative feedstock is allocated to the sales products according to a mass balance approach.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-187.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-188" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-188.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands EcoBalanced portfolio for detergents and cleaners industry and industrial formulators ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-188.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 15, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands EcoBalanced portfolio for detergents and cleaners industry and industrial formulators </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Customers of BASF from the detergents and cleaners industry and many other technical applications will be able to formulate their products even more sustainably in future. BASF Home Care, I&amp;I and Industrial Formulators' expanded EcoBalanced portfolio is designed to help customers in Europe formulate solutions that differentiate them in the marketplace while meeting consumer demand for environmentally friendly products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-188.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-179" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-179.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Sacred Patch®: BASF launches new skin care active ingredient that helps boost emotional well-being||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-179.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 7, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Sacred Patch®: BASF launches new skin care active ingredient that helps boost emotional well-being</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Pulnoy, France, April 7 2021 </b>– In an increasingly hectic world, promoting mental health has become the top priority for many consumers. With its innovative Sacred Patch<sup>®</sup>, BASF can help manufacturers to develop effective skin care products that promote emotional well-being while addressing common signs of sensitive skin. Sacred Patch is based on BASF’s MicroPatch<sup>®</sup> technology to harness the potential of the valuable algal extract sacran. Sacred Patch works in three ways: it offers an instantly perceptible uplift in mood once applied to the skin, helps to soothe sensitive skin, and provides strong moisturization properties. According to ISO 16128, Sacred Patch is 99.2% of natural origin.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/04/p-21-179.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-171" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-171.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New high-flow Ultramid® Advanced for thin-walled connectors enables higher power and data throughput in electronic applications||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-171.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P171_high_flow_Ultramid_Advanced-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 31, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New high-flow Ultramid® Advanced for thin-walled connectors enables higher power and data throughput in electronic applications</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now expanding its polyphthalamide (PPA) portfolio by a new Ultramid<sup>®</sup> Advanced N grade that is especially suited for connectors post-processed with surface mount technology (SMT). Ultramid<sup>®</sup> Advanced N2U40G7 shows the ideal balance of high flowability, toughness and flame retardancy. It thus enables miniaturization with thin-wall structures at high power and data throughput in electronic applications such as computers, laptops, servers, smart phones as well as smart household appliances and wearable devices.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and AgBiome collaborate on a new biological fungicide for Europe, Middle East and Africa</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and AgBiome have signed an agreement to bring a new biological fungicide to the market in Europe, and key countries in the Middle East and Africa. Developed by AgBiome, and marketed as Howler<sup>®</sup> in the United States, the biological fungicide with multiple modes of action provides preventive, long-lasting activity on a broad spectrum of soilborne and foliar diseases. BASF will support the further development and registration and will be the exclusive distributor in Europe, Middle East and Africa. Subject to successful registrations, first market introductions in selected countries are expected in 2024/2025.&nbsp;&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-173.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-170" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-170.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Trinseo and BASF jointly announce Business Collaboration on Circular Feedstock||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-170.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P170_The_steam_cracker_The_heart_of_the_Verbund-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 29, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trinseo and BASF jointly announce Business Collaboration on Circular Feedstock</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trinseo has procured first supplies of styrene based on two different kinds of circular feedstock from BASF for use in styrene butadiene rubber and polystyrene products. Based on the most recent progress in developing low-emission and CO<sub>2</sub>-free technologies, the company is also significantly raising its medium-term 2030 target for reductions in greenhouse gas emissions: BASF now wants to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions worldwide by 25&nbsp;percent compared with 2018 – and to achieve this despite targeted growth and the construction of a large Verbund site in South China. Excluding the effects of the planned growth, this means cutting CO<sub>2</sub> emissions in half in the current business by the end of this decade. Overall, BASF plans to invest up to €1 billion by 2025 to reach its new climate target and a further €2&nbsp;billion to €3&nbsp;billion by 2030.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-166.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-169" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-169.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in new Excellence Center for its Hygiene Business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-169.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Bild%202_D15_053_HySorb:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 25, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in new Excellence Center for its Hygiene Business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will increase innovation capabilities for its superabsorbent polymer business by building a state-of-the-art Superabsorbents Excellence Center at its Verbund site in Antwerp, Belgium. data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 25, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Distinguishing between HDPE and LDPE at the blink of an eye:  New PE applications for trinamiX's mobile NIR spectroscopy solution </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>25 March 2021 - Ludwigshafen, Germany</b> – In view of rising prices for polyethylene (PE), the production of single-grade PE recyclates has become increasingly attractive in recent months. By launching two applications for its mobile NIR spectroscopy solution, trinamiX is improving on-the-spot sorting of the sought-after plastic. In addition to quickly distinguishing between HDPE and LDPE, the ratio of PE to PP in mixed plastics can be precisely determined as easy as pushing a button. Thanks to the flexibility of a handy measuring device, the process for obtaining high-quality PE and PE/PP recyclates is now significantly enhanced.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-175.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-165" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-165.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF, SABIC and Linde join forces to realize the world’s first electrically heated steam cracker furnace ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-165.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P165_Steamcracker_at_BASF_Ludwigshafen_site-3:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 24, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF, SABIC and Linde join forces to realize the world’s first electrically heated steam cracker furnace </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>March 24, 2021</b> – BASF, SABIC and Linde have signed a joint agreement to develop and demonstrate solutions for electrically heated steam cracker furnaces. The partners have already jointly worked on concepts to use renewable electricity instead of the fossil fuel gas typically used for the heating process. With this innovative approach focusing on one of the petrochemical industries’ core processes, the parties strive to offer a promising solution to significantly contribute to the reduction of CO<sub>2</sub> emissions within the chemical industry.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" (Bota Bio), an industrial synthetic biotech company based in Hangzhou, China. At the Injection Moulding &amp; Extrusion Pilot Plant of BASF in Ludwigshafen, Germany, the newest all-electric fully-automated injection moulding cell from Sumitomo (SHI) Demag is delivering pioneering and repeatable results on over 4,000 test settings a year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-153.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-148" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-148.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF strengthens its position in bio-surfactants for Personal Care, Home Care and Industrial Formulators with two distinct partnerships||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-148.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 10, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF strengthens its position in bio-surfactants for Personal Care, Home Care and Industrial Formulators with two distinct partnerships</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany<b> </b>- BASF has recently signed two distinct partnerships agreements to expand its global leading position in the bio-based surfactants and actives market. The strategic alliance with ACS includes an equity stake and makes BASF the single largest shareholder. It further entails an exclusive technology cooperation, commercial agreement and product development for sophorolipids, one class of glycolipids, to address the ever-increasing needs of consumers for sustainable, natural and bio-degradable ingredients and actives. The partners have agreed not to disclose financial details regarding the investment.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-148.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-149" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-149.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF marks 15th anniversary of Deoxo™ converter helping airlines to improve passenger safety and comfort ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-149.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/15%20years%20deoxo-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 10, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF marks 15th anniversary of Deoxo™ converter helping airlines to improve passenger safety and comfort </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF celebrates the 15<sup>th</sup> anniversary of the Deoxo converter helping airlines remove harmful ozone and VOCs from cabin air and to improve passenger safety and comfort during air travel. Since its introduction, Deoxo has been proven on numerous platforms including Airbus A320, across thousands of aircrafts, over millions of flight hours, and remains the only converter in commercial service that can remove both harmful ozone and odor causing VOCs from aircraft cabin air. The dual effectiveness of Deoxo can be used by airlines to attract health-conscious customers.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-149.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-150" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-150.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF becomes global paint accessories supplier for leading OEM brand Fit4Paint||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-150.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fit4Paint_1-3:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 10, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF becomes global paint accessories supplier for leading OEM brand Fit4Paint</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has become the exclusive global supplier to Fit4Paint, BMW's private label paint-related products (PRP) offering. class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF strengthens innovation pipeline for sustainable agriculture</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany, March 4, 2021 – BASF strengthens its activities in research and development (R&amp;D) for sustainable agricultural innovations, helping farmers to overcome environmental and economic challenges as well as meeting consumers’ demand for more sustainably produced food. With solutions launching throughout the next decade, the pipeline supports the company’s aim to annually increase its sales share of agricultural solutions with substantial contribution to sustainability by 7%. By 2030, more than 30 major R&amp;D projects will complement BASF’s connected offer of seeds and seed treatment products, chemical and biological solutions, as well as digital services.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-135.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-137" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-137.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF achieved its 2020 Palm Commitment ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-137.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P137_2020_Palm_Selbstverpflichtung-3:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 4, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF achieved its 2020 Palm Commitment </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, March 4, 2021 – BASF reached an important milestone on its path toward sustainable palm. The company achieved its commitment to procure palm (kernel) oils exclusively from sources certified by the RSPO by 2020. Last year, BASF purchased 227,213 metric tons of certified sustainable palm (kernel) oil representing 100 percent of BASF’s total volume as RSPO certified. In addition, BASF also made further progress in developing transparent supply chains: The company was able to trace almost 95 percent of its global palm footprint – totaling 441,107 metric tons – back to oil mill level.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-137.html" 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Distinguishing PA6 from PA66 at the push of a button: trinamiX adds new application for plastic sorting to its Mobile NIR Spectroscopy Solution </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>04 March 2021 - Ludwigshafen, Germany</b> - trinamiX, a wholly owned subsidiary of BASF SE, now supports the reliable differentiation between polyamide 6 (PA6) and polyamide 6.6 (PA66) with its Mobile Near-Infrared Spectroscopy Solution. Within seconds, plastic waste from the two polyamides can be sorted using a handy measuring device as part of trinamiX’s solution. With this new application, trinamiX is responding to customer wishes and expands its broad offering for plastic sorting.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-145.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-134" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-134.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||“Green” box with double the benefits||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/03/p-21-134.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P134_eps-box-cooling-elements-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 3, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“Green” box with double the benefits</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen, Reilingen and Berlin, March 3, 2021</b> - Hospitals, care homes, and vaccination centres throughout the German state of Brandenburg have been eagerly awaiting deliveries from Unitax in recent weeks. The events are held as an alternative to BASF’s contribution to the Interpack 2021, which cannot take place due to the coronavirus pandemic. BASF had therefore released its preliminary figures already on January&nbsp;20, 2021.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-131.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-138" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-138.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New Ultramid® Advanced grades with carbon-fiber reinforcement for low-weight and high-performance parts||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-138.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P138_Ultramid_Advanced_CF_grades-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 25, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New Ultramid® Advanced grades with carbon-fiber reinforcement for low-weight and high-performance parts</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now expanding its polyphthalamide (PPA) portfolio of Ultramid<sup>®</sup> Advanced with carbon-fiber reinforced grades. The benefits of these new materials: They make for extremely lightweight parts, safely replace aluminum and magnesium without loss in stiffness and strength and are electrically conductive. They can be used to manufacture automotive structural parts for body, chassis and powertrain, for pumps, fans, gears and compressors in industrial applications as well as for stable and ultra-lightweight components in consumer electronics.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-138.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-118" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-118.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Farmers to access more precise long-range, seasonal weather forecasts via BASF and Salient Predictions agreement||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-118.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 22, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Farmers to access more precise long-range, seasonal weather forecasts via BASF and Salient Predictions agreement</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Research Triangle Park, North Carolina, and Falmouth, Massachusetts – <br> February 22, 2021</b> – BASF has signed a global commercial agreement with <a href="https://www.salientpredictions.com/">Salient Predictions, Inc. (Salient)</a> to provide customers with access to the world’s most accurate long-range, seasonal weather forecasting data to further enable precise agronomic decisions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-118.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read Legal requirements for pollutant emissions, downsizing of internal combustion engines, alternative powertrains such as electric, hybrid or fuel cell have accelerated further development rapidly. These changes lead to increasing demands as well as new technical boundary conditions on products in use. Glass fiber reinforced plastics, such as BASF's Ultramid<sup>®</sup>, make a significant contribution to further development. Engineering plastics must not only withstand high temperatures over a long period of time, but also prevent galvanic corrosion of electrical components.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-122.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-126" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-126.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||“Minus 20°C is sometimes trickier than minus 70°C”||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/02/p-21-126.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P126_THERMOCON_Box_Classic-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 17, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“Minus 20°C is sometimes trickier than minus 70°C”</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen and Reilingen, Germany, February 17, 2021</b> – As the range of coronavirus vaccines grows, so do the requirements for their distribution. The different vaccines need to be stored and transported at different temperature ranges—often together in the same vehicle or cold store. Handling complex processes like this is routine for leading logistics companies such as DHL. But they depend on the skills of packaging providers and raw materials suppliers like Schaumaplast and BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a Several pilot projects at its Ludwigshafen site are under discussion. data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - BASF signs a global, exclusive supply agreement with Caregen for synthetic peptides</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Hong Kong, Seoul, Korea – January 22, 2021 </b>– <a name="_Hlk62052232" id="_Hlk62052232"></a>BASF has signed a global, exclusive supply agreement with Caregen, for four cosmetic peptides. With this expansion in its portfolio, BASF plans to launch four peptides with anti-aging and anti-pigmentation properties, for prone-atopic and prone-acneic skins, in the course of 2021.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-113.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-114" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-114.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF begins implementing realignment of its Global Business Services unit||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-114.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 21, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF begins implementing realignment of its Global Business Services unit</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now entering the implementation stage for the realignment of its services unit announced in September 2020: A large share of the services provided by employees of Global Business Services to BASF’s business units are being bundled in hubs. These hubs will be located at the existing BASF shared service centers in Berlin, Germany; Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and Montevideo, Uruguay.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-114.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-111" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-111.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group releases preliminary figures for fourth quarter of 2020 and full year 2020||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-111.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 20, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group releases preliminary figures for fourth quarter of 2020 and full year 2020</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – January 20, 2021 – BASF has released preliminary figures for the fourth quarter of 2020 and the full year 2020. <b>Sales </b>increased by 8&nbsp;percent in the fourth quarter of 2020 to €15,905&nbsp;million (Q4&nbsp;2019: €14,686&nbsp;million). This was mainly driven by higher volumes and prices; negative currency effects had an offsetting effect. Full year 2020 sales declined by €167 million to €59,149 million (2019: €59,316 million) and were thus above the €57&nbsp;billion to €58&nbsp;billion range forecast in October 2020.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-111.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-108" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-108.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BTC Europe is the new distributor in Europe for BASF aromatic isocyanates and polyols for polyurethane applications||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-108.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 18, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BTC Europe is the new distributor in Europe for BASF aromatic isocyanates and polyols for polyurethane applications</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has chosen BTC Europe GmbH (BTC) to be the new distributor for aromatic isocyanates and polyols for polyurethane applications in Europe. The collaboration will commence on February 1, 2021 and comprises the polyurethane basic products Lupranat<sup>®</sup>, Lupranol<sup>®</sup> and Lupraphen<sup>®</sup>.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-108.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-103" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-103.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||As a co-founder of CELAB, BASF works towards a circular economy for adhesive labels||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-103.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 12, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">As a co-founder of CELAB, BASF works towards a circular economy for adhesive labels</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is a founding member of a new global network dedicated to building a circular economy in the self-adhesive labeling industry. CELAB (Toward a Circular Economy for Labels) is a cross-industry coalition open to all companies in the self-adhesive label supply chain, promoting sustainability through encouraging collaboration, kick-starting regional initiatives, and developing best practices.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF starts global registration for new and environmentally friendly insecticide active ingredient</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany – BASF has started the global registration for a new insecticide active ingredient. The company submitted the regulatory dossiers for the Axalion<sup>™</sup> insecticide in Australia and Korea. This step marks a key milestone in further expanding BASF’s global insecticide portfolio and the company’s position in providing sustainable innovations for agriculture. Further regulatory dossier submissions are planned for the European Union, Brazil and India in 2021 as well as other key markets in the coming years.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-104.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-101" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-101.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Wider range of colors rolled off the world’s assembly lines in 2020||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-101.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P101_21_Lit_NationTide_ColorReport-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 7, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Wider range of colors rolled off the world’s assembly lines in 2020</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The BASF Color Report 2020 for Automotive OEM Coatings shows the automotive color palette shifting in unconventional ways, unveiling a wider range of chromatic colors rolling off the world’s assembly lines. Diverse shades like blue and yellow are making gains in some regions, while red and violet are slowly cutting the lead held by the achromatic colors in other parts of the world. The expanding color spaces made the overall spectrum broader than 2019 and added a flash of brilliance.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-101.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-100" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-100.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||VIB acquires CropDesign site from BASF and launches its first agricultural biotechnology incubator||/global/en/media/news-releases/2021/01/p-21-100.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P100_21_CropDesign_Nevele:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 5, 2021</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">VIB acquires CropDesign site from BASF and launches its first agricultural biotechnology incubator</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Nevele, Belgium, January 5, 2021</b> – VIB, a leading life sciences institute in Flanders, has signed an agreement with BASF to acquire its CropDesign site in Nevele, Belgium. VIB and CropDesign have had a close scientific relationship for more than 15 years. CropDesign, currently part of BASF’s Agricultural Solutions division, was established in 1998 as a VIB spinoff and has grown into a biotech company specializing in plant phenotyping technology. The divesture includes site infrastructure and intellectual property. All former CropDesign employees found new jobs within or outside BASF. Financial details of the transaction are not being disclosed.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 17, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF reaches agreement to sell site in Kankakee, Illinois to One Rock Capital Partners</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has reached an agreement to sell its manufacturing site in Kankakee, Illinois and the associated businesses of vegetable-oil-based raw material sterols and natural vitamin E, anionic surfactants and esters produced there to an affiliate of One Rock Capital Partners, LLC, a U.S.-based private equity firm. The businesses have around 160 employees including business management and commercial personnel across the U.S. The transaction is expected to close in the first half of 2021, subject to the approval of the relevant authorities. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-396.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-397" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-397.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Changes in the Board of Executive Directors of BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-397.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P397e_Maas_Brunner_Melanie:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 17, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Changes in the Board of Executive Directors of BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 17, 2020 – The Supervisory Board of BASF SE today appointed Dr. Melanie Maas-Brunner (52) as a member of the Board of Executive Directors effective February 1, 2021. Maas-Brunner has been with BASF since 1997 and has headed BASF’s Nutrition &amp; Health division since 2017. In her new role as of February 1, 2021, she will also take over the position as Chief Technology Officer from Dr. Martin Brudermüller, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF. She will assume responsibility for the three research divisions Advanced Materials &amp; Systems Research, Bioscience Research, Process Research &amp; Chemical Engineering as well as BASF New Business at that time.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-397.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-389" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-389.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF announces new MRO station in Shanghai for Deoxo™ aircraft ozone and ozone/VOC converters||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-389.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 16, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announces new MRO station in Shanghai for Deoxo™ aircraft ozone and ozone/VOC converters</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announced today that it plans to build an MRO station in Shanghai, China to service Deoxo™ aircraft ozone and ozone/VOC converters. The Shanghai MRO will complement BASF’s existing MRO in Huntsville, Alabama in the US. Startup is planned for the fourth quarter in 2021 and will mainly support customers in the Asia Pacific region. The MRO station will ensure maintenance is performed according to the Abbreviated Component Maintenance Manuals (ACMMs) for the Deoxo™ ozone converters and ozone/VOC converters. The updated ACMMs define in more detail the test procedures and service methods for maintaining the converters, to ensure continued industry-leading performance and regulatory compliance.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-389.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-395" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-395.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF reaches milestone of MDI capacity expansion project at Geismar site||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P395e_BASF_Geismar_CM_MDI_068:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 16, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF reaches milestone of MDI capacity expansion project at Geismar site</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The implementation of the methylene diphenyl diisocyanate (MDI) capacity increase program for production facilities at BASF’s Verbund site in Geismar, Louisiana, is progressing on schedule. Over time, BASF targets to double the capacity from 300,000 metric tons per year to approximately 600,000 metric tons per year. With this stepwise capacity addition, BASF will support the ongoing growth of its North American MDI customers.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-388" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-388.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Eramet partner to assess the development of a nickel-cobalt refining complex to supply growing electric vehicle market||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-388.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 15, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Eramet partner to assess the development of a nickel-cobalt refining complex to supply growing electric vehicle market</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Paris, France<b> </b>– BASF and Eramet have signed an agreement to jointly assess the development of a state-of-the-art nickel and cobalt hydrometallurgical refining complex. Such a development would include a High-Pressure Acid Leaching (HPAL) plant and a Base Metal Refinery (BMR). The HPAL would be located in Weda Bay, Indonesia, while the location of the BMR will be determined during the feasibility study.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a economy ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P383_Battery_recycling_1-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113"
