data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 10, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Batteries, plastics, renewable raw materials: new ideas for the circular economy </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In a circular economy, the aim is to avoid waste, reuse products and recover resources. “Companies that can provide solutions for the transformation to a circular economy will have a crucial competitive advantage,” said Dr. Martin Brudermüller, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors and Chief Technology Officer of BASF, speaking about the circular economy, a key issue of the future in society and in politics. BASF has therefore launched a new Circular Economy Program. By the year 2030, the company aims to double its sales generated with solutions for the circular economy to €17&nbsp;billion. To achieve this, the company is concentrating on three action areas: circular feedstocks, new material cycles and new business models. As of 2025, BASF aims to process 250,000 metric tons of recycled and waste-based raw materials annually, replacing fossil raw materials. “The path to a circular economy will require enormous efforts on our part. But we have taken on this challenge with commitment and creativity and we can build on our innovative strength,” said Brudermüller. The Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors and scientists presented examples from BASF’s research pipeline today at the first digital Research Press Conference.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-393" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-393.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Adifo Software partner on optimizing feed formulation, supporting more sustainable animal protein production||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 10, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Adifo Software partner on optimizing feed formulation, supporting more sustainable animal protein production</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Adifo Software will launch a new digital solution for the animal agriculture value chain by integrating sustainability analytics powered by BASF’s AgBalance<sup>®</sup> Live­stock project into Adifo’s BESTMIX<sup>®</sup> feed formulation software. BASF’s sustainability analytics enable the industry to dynamically assess the life cycle environmental impacts to make animal protein production more sustainable. Adifo’s BESTMIX<sup>®</sup> software allows nutritionists and formulators to manage and optimize nutrition and cost attributes of feed and ration formulation. By integrating BASF’s sustainability analytics into BESTMIX<sup>®</sup>, customers along the animal agriculture value chain will be able to strategically manage and optimize feed formulation based on nutrition and cost while taking environmental sustainability aspects into account.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“Fair For Life”: BASF’s active ingredient Lipofructyl™ Argan re-awarded Fair Trade label by Ecocert</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Pulnoy, France – December 8, 2020 </b>– For the fourth time in a row, BASF Beauty Care Solutions has been awarded the “Fair For Life” (FFL) label by Ecocert for its active ingredient Lipofructyl™ Argan. Under this Fair Trade standard, the organic certification organization evaluates the social, environmental and local impact of supply chains. Derived from the hand-picked fruit of the argan tree, the moisturizing oil Lipofructyl™ Argan is part of BASF’s sustainable Argan Program, which was established in 2005. The original aim of the program was to study the argan tree and valorizes the oil and its byproducts while diversifying the revenue of the cooperatives and fostering preservation of argan forests by local populations.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-387.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-391" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-391.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF leading in water management, forest and climate protection according to CDP||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-391.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P391_CDP2020_Verbund_site_Ludwigshafen-3:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 8, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF leading in water management, forest and climate protection according to CDP</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The non-profit organization CDP (formerly “Carbon Disclosure Project”) has once again rated BASF as one of the world’s leading companies for its water management and climate protection measures. BASF achieved the best rating of “A” in the “CDP Water Security” list. On the CDP’s climate list, BASF achieved the grade “A-.” For its efforts to protect the forests, BASF was rated by CDP for the first time and also received the grade “A-.” These ratings assess BASF’s environmental management and transparent reporting on it.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" BASF and BillerudKorsnäs cooperate to develop unique home-compostable paper laminate for flexible packaging||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-384.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P384e_Press_photo_ecovio_Epotal_Billerud-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 3, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - BASF and BillerudKorsnäs cooperate to develop unique home-compostable paper laminate for flexible packaging</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany/Solna, Sweden, December 3, 2020: BASF and the Swedish packaging manufacturer BillerudKorsnäs have cooperated to develop a unique home-compostable paper laminate for flexible packaging. The multi-layer film consists of three basic components: BillerudKorsnäs‘ paper ConFlex® Silk, a sealing layer made of BASF’s certified home compostable and partly bio-based biopolymer ecovio® and BASF’s water-based adhesive Epotal® Eco 3675 X which joins the film to the paper.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Shell qualifies BASF Durasorb™ Cryo-HRU technology for removal of heavy hydrocarbons and water from natural gas||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-382.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P382_shell-durasorb:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 2, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shell qualifies BASF Durasorb™ Cryo-HRU technology for removal of heavy hydrocarbons and water from natural gas</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Leveraging the extensive know-how and experience of BASF adsorption experts, Shell has qualified BASF Durasorb™ Cryo-HRU technology for deployment in Shell gas processing plants with lean feed gas streams. Use of Durasorb Cryo-HRU technology, in the pre-treatment section of an LNG production plant offers an effective solution for the removal of trace HHCs, BTEX (benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, xylene), and water to cryogenic specifications in a single unit. HHCs and BTEX impurities are known to cause freezing in the coldbox resulting in plant downtime and are especially challenging due to the need to remove deeply even from lean feed gas streams. Durasorb Cryo-HRU effectively removes these impurities while also removing water to cryogenic specifications. Implementing Durasorb Cryo-HRU in the LNG pre-treatment section ensures reliable operation and provides operational flexibility to the plant.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/12/p-20-382.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div applications. It is readily biodegradable and stands out due to its excellent ecological and toxicological profile. Complexing agents are used in cosmetic products to form very stable complexes with metal ions, thereby inactivating their negative influences on the final formulation.</div><div class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF partners with Heatworks to support the development of the Tetra Countertop Dishwasher</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Heatworks, a US-based tech firm, partner to support the further development of the award-winning Tetra countertop dishwasher regarding its cleaning performance. While Heatworks is using its patented Ohmic Array Technology, BASF is supporting the development with its leading portfolio of sustainable products for the cleaning industry. This is to enable the Tetra self-contained countertop dishwasher to wash up to three full place settings with just three liters of water. Tetra will clean 50 percent more dishes using 40 percent less water in 55 percent of the time than the leading countertop dishwasher and is set to release in 2021.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-378.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-374" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-374.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces portfolio for protective wood grain enhancement||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P374_Joncryl_953X_portfolio-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 23, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces portfolio for protective wood grain enhancement</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Natural materials like wood enjoy growing popularity in the furnishing sector – a trend, that is reflected by furniture and floorings showing clearly visible, contrasting wood grains. Traditionally, this effect is supported by solvent-based wood coatings, which are very effective in terms of performance. EU legislation and changing consumer expectations have led the value chain to look for more sustainable alternatives. BASF has developed the new Joncryl 953X portfolio for water-based 1K systems to protect and highlight the beauty of wood while meeting sustainability needs.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-366" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-366.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Ultradur® RX – more clarity for radar sensors||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-366.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P366_Ultradur_RX_Sensor-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 19, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ultradur® RX – more clarity for radar sensors</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The development of new technologies for the automotive industry focuses on comfort and the safety of passengers. Chemistry has already made a decisive contribution to this and will also play an important role in future mobility challenges. In addition to electromobility, automated driving is a crucial building block for the mobility of tomorrow. Closely linked to this development is the increased use of sensors.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-366.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-368" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-368.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF PETRONAS Chemicals realigns its portfolio for growth||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-368.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 18, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF PETRONAS Chemicals realigns its portfolio for growth</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Kuantan, Malaysia – November 18, 2020<b> </b>– BASF PETRONAS Chemicals Sdn Bhd (BPC) a joint venture between BASF and PETRONAS Chemicals Group Berhad (PCG) is realigning its product portfolio focusing on long term growth.&nbsp;<span style="">As part of BASF’s and PCG’s ongoing review of their product portfolio and a result of the realignment, BPC will be closing its Butanediol (“BDO”) and derivatives plant at Kuantan, Malaysia in March 2021. This decision will not impact other plants within the facility.</span></div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-368.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-369" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-369.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF, Boortmalt and SAI Platform collaborate for sustainable barley production||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-369.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P369_Barley:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 18, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF, Boortmalt and SAI Platform collaborate for sustainable barley production</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany; Athy, Ireland; Brussels, Belgium; November 18, 2020 – Modern food production is about reducing its impact on the environment while maintaining productivity. This holds true not only for farming but also for every player in the food value chain up to the retailer. That is why Boortmalt, the world’s leading barley malt provider for the brewing and distilling industries working with more than 800 barley growers in Ireland, is implementing BASF’s sustainability assessment tool AgBalance<sup>®</sup>. A new collaboration between BASF and the Sustainable Agriculture Initiative Platform (SAI Platform) will also make it easier and faster for the farmers to achieve independent verification for the sustainability of their crop production.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-369.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-365" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-365.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF commits to targets for boosting sustainable agriculture||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-365.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P365_Sustainability-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 16, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF commits to targets for boosting sustainable agriculture</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has committed to clear and measurable targets to boost sustainable agriculture by 2030. Focusing on the biggest levers that will make agriculture more sustainable and contribute to the most pressing needs of society, the company will help farmers achieve a 30% reduction in CO<sub>2</sub> emissions per ton of crop produced. BASF’s Agricultural Solutions division will also annually increase its sales share of solutions with a substantial sustainability contribution in the value chain by 7%. In addition, BASF will bring digital technologies to more than 400 million hectares of farmland and continue to ensure the safe use of its products with the right stewardship. The new commitments are further strengthening the implementation of BASF’s strategy in agriculture that was launched in 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-365.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-359" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-359.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Groundbreaking for cathode active materials production plant in Schwarzheide, Germany ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-359.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P359_Key_visual-spade-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 13, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Groundbreaking for cathode active materials production plant in Schwarzheide, Germany </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has broken ground for its new cathode active materials production plant in Schwarzheide, Germany. In an online event, the company celebrated this milestone together with customers, politicians and partners. The new plant is part of BASF’s multi-step investment plan in the European battery materials market and will use precursors from the company’s previously announced plant in Harjavalta, Finland. Construction has already started in August in Schwarzheide and the plant is scheduled for a 2022 start-up.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-359.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-361" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-361.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Bosch and BASF establish joint venture for digital technologies in the agricultural sector||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-361.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 12, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Bosch and BASF establish joint venture for digital technologies in the agricultural sector</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Stuttgart / Cologne, Germany</b> – Bosch and BASF Digital Farming have signed a 50:50 joint venture (JV) agreement to globally market and sell smart farming solutions from a single source in the future. The JV agreement was signed on November 10, 2020 and will be followed by the founding of a new company based in Cologne, which will be established in the first quarter of 2021. The foundation is subject to the approval of the relevant antitrust authorities. class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint Feasibility Study for a chemical complex in India completed, project put on hold due to COVID-19 pandemic</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>November 5, 2020</b> – As part of a four-party Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), signed on October 4, 2019, Abu Dhabi National Oil Company India. The project study comprised a world-scale propane dehydrogenation (PDH) plant, a polypropylene (PP) production and an acrylics value chain complex. data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-353" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-353.html" class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 4, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF markets anode binders for lithium-ion batteries made in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Electric mobility is one of the most promising solutions to today’s climate and energy challenges. Especially in the European Union this issue has made it to the top of the public agenda. The key to successful electric vehicles and their mass adoption lies within lithium-ion battery technology.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/11/p-20-353.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-350" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-350.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||“Cobalt for Development” project started trainings for mining cooperatives in Kolwezi, Democratic Republic of Congo ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-350.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P350_VAN_4584-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 30, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“Cobalt for Development” project started trainings for mining cooperatives in Kolwezi, Democratic Republic of Congo </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Kolwezi, Democratic Republic of Congo – The cross-industry initiative “Cobalt for Development” has started trainings for twelve artisanal mining cooperatives in October in Kolwezi, Democratic Republic of Congo (DR Congo). The trainings cover major environmental, social and governance aspects for responsible mining practices. This includes mine site management and legal compliance, human rights, health and safety as well as environmental management. The initiative intends to train more than 1,500 artisanal cobalt miners by mid-2021. BMW, BASF, Samsung SDI and Samsung Electronics had initiated the project “Cobalt for Development” to better understand and address challenges for responsible artisanal mining in the region. Since January 2019, the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH is commissioned to implement the project together with non-governmental organizations. Volkswagen recently joined the initiative as new partner.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-350.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-343" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-343.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to acquire innovative melon breeding company ASL||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-343.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P343_20_Melon-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 29, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to acquire innovative melon breeding company ASL</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><i>Nunhem, the Netherlands – </i>On Wednesday, October 28, 2020 BASF has formally agreed to acquire ASL, one of the most innovative melon breeding companies in the world, to continue expanding its position as a preferred partner in<i> </i>the fruit and vegetable value chain. The transaction with the privately-owned French company based near Avignon, covers all assets, including seed production, intellectual property rights, germplasm, research and development facilities as well as staff.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-343.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-349" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-349.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release - A 40-year-old catalyst unveils its secrets||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-349.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P349e_Zeolite_image:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 29, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - A 40-year-old catalyst unveils its secrets</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen, Zurich, Cologne, Berlin, October 29, 2020 – </b>“Titanium silicalite-1” (TS-1) is not a new catalyst: It has been almost 40 years since its development and the discovery of its ability to convert propylene into propylene oxide, an important basic chemical in the chemical industry. Now, by combining various methods, a team of scientists from ETH Zurich, the University of Cologne, the Fritz Haber Institute and BASF has unveiled the surprising mechanism of action of this catalyst. These findings will help catalyst research take an important step forward.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-349.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-351" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-351.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF wins “Best Catalyst Technology” for Fourtune™ at the 2020 HP Awards||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-351.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P351e_BASF_wins_HP_Award_LinkedIn:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 29, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF wins “Best Catalyst Technology” for Fourtune™ at the 2020 HP Awards</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF was awarded “Best Catalyst Technology” at the 2020 Hydrocarbon Processing (HP) Awards for its Fourtune™ FCC catalyst. Fourtune is the latest product based on BASF’s Multiple Framework Topology (MFT) technology. It has been optimized to deliver superior butylene over propylene selectivity while maintaining catalyst activity and performance.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a With Infinergy‘s superior elastic, shock-absorbing and high-rebound properties, the running deck delivers an unmatched experience for indoor runners.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-345.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-342" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-342.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release - easyconnect closed transfer system pilot group expands||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-342.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P342e_BASF_easyconnect_system_2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 26, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - easyconnect closed transfer system pilot group expands</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a name="_Hlk54334370" id="_Hlk54334370"></a>Limburgerhof, Germany, October 26, 2020 – The number of agricultural industry leaders committed to provide access to closed transfer systems (CTS) continues to grow. From September 2020, Certis Europe joins ADAMA, BASF, Corteva Agriscience, Nufarm and Syngenta to introduce easyconnect CTS in the European market from 2021/22. The growing number of supporters of the easyconnect system steadily increases the number of products equipped with the easyconnect cap, giving farmers a broad choice.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-342.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-346" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-346.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives “CIIF New Materials Award”||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-346.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P346_CIIF_Award_Certificate:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 23, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives “CIIF New Materials Award”</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – October 23, 2020 – BASF has received the 2020 “CIIF New Materials Award” focusing on innovation and granted by the China International Industry Fair (CIIF) in September, 2020 at the National Exhibition and Convention Center in Shanghai, China. The CIIF judging panel applauded BASF for its novel modification of BASF’s PolyTHF<sup>®</sup> which is used to produce elastic spandex textile fibers, as well as synthetic films and leather. This year a total of 20 companies competed for ten awards in the “New Materials” category. BASF was the only awardee in the textile segment.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-346.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-334" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-334.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||PeptAIde™ 4.0 – A new naturally derived active ingredient from BASF that protects skin and hair against silent inflammation||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-334.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 22, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">PeptAIde™ 4.0 – A new naturally derived active ingredient from BASF that protects skin and hair against silent inflammation</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Düsseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – October 22, 2020 </b>– PeptAIde™&nbsp;4.0, a new active ingredient from BASF, offers a safe and nature-based remedy for hair and skin damage caused by silent inflammation. To develop this plant-based product, BASF researchers used the power of Artificial Intelligence: numerous peptides, short chains of amino-acids linked by peptide bonds, were screened for their ability to help prevent the release of inflammatory mediators such as TNFa. With the help of a controlled enzymatic hydrolysis process, these peptides were then unlocked from organic rice proteins (Oryza sativa).&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-334.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-333" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-333.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF experts to share research insights at the first ever virtual IFSCC Congress 2020 ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-333.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 21, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF experts to share research insights at the first ever virtual IFSCC Congress 2020 </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Yokohama, Japan – October 21, 2020 </b>– <a name="_Hlk53996197" id="_Hlk53996197"></a>Experts from BASF will share insights into their recent innovative research activities at the thirty-first Congress of the International Federation of Societies of Cosmetic Chemists (IFSCC) from 21 to 30 October 2020. For the first time ever, the event will be held virtually to protect the safety and health of the scientific community during the Covid-19 outbreak. Instead of holding live presentations, video recordings and supporting material will be made available for participants to download on-demand for the duration of the congress. Representatives from BASF and its research partners will hold four podium presentations and lead six poster sessions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-333.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-337" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-337.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2020 Conference Call on October 28, 2020, at 9.00 a.m. (CET)||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-337.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Auswahl_Fahnen_D16_002_Fahnen_2016:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 21, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2020 Conference Call on October 28, 2020, at 9.00 a.m. (CET)</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">We will publish BASF’s Quarterly Statement 3<sup>rd</sup> Quarter 2020 on October&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2020, at 7.00&nbsp;a.m. (CET). data-v-5db4dc0c="">The American manufacturer of heavy-duty, zero-emission engines Nuvera Fuel Cells, Billerica, Massachusetts is now using BASF’s polyphthalamide (PPA) Ultramid® Advanced N to 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Household appliance manufacturer De'Longhi uses polyethersulfone by BASF in its new coffee machine</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The Italian household appliance company De'Longhi, Treviso, now uses Ultrason® E 3010 MR to manufacture the upper piston of the brewing unit in its new coffee machine Magnifica Ecam 22. The polyethersulfone (PESU) by BASF contributes to the durability of the coffee maker by showing high heat and steam resistance up to 180°C, good mechanical properties as well as excellent dimensional stability at varying temperatures over a long period of time. Karp, CEO Palantir Technologies Inc., resigned from the Supervisory Board at the end of July 2020 for professional reasons.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-329.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-323" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-323.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to concentrate glufosinate-ammonium production||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-323.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 12, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to concentrate glufosinate-ammonium production</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will close its site in Muskegon, Michigan (USA), and one out of three production plants at its site in Knapsack (Germany). These sites produce glufosinate-ammonium (GA), a non-selective herbicide, and its intermediates. The closures are expected to be finalized by 2022 at the latest; in total, they will affect around 100 employees. In future, production will be concentrated at the remaining plants and sites in Germany, the United States, as well as Canada.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-323.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-309" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-309.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||A new level of puncture resistance thanks to Elastollan®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-309.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P309_Elastollan_Schwalbe_Pressebild_1-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 9, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">A new level of puncture resistance thanks to Elastollan®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With the market launch of its new Aerothan bicycle tube on October 8, 2020, Schwalbe presents a new generation of bicycle tubes based on BASF's thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU) Elastollan<sup>®</sup>. This innovation scores top marks in terms of weight, puncture resistance, handling characteristics, ease of assembly and packing size. Aerothan bicycle tubes are the result of unique developmental work between the market leader for bicycle tires and tubes in Europe and BASF's Performance Material Division.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-309.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-328" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-328.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group releases preliminary figures for third quarter of 2020 and publishes outlook for full year 2020||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-328.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 9, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group releases preliminary figures for third quarter of 2020 and publishes outlook for full year 2020</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – October&nbsp;9, 2020 – BASF has released preliminary figures for the third quarter of 2020. <b>Sales </b>declined by 5% in the third quarter of 2020 to €13,812&nbsp;million (Q3&nbsp;2019: €14,556&nbsp;million). This was mainly driven by negative currency effects.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-328.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-324" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-324.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s 2020-2021 Automotive Color Trends collection shows new optimism and a positive mood||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-324.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P324_BASF_Automotive_Color_Trends_2020_2021-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 8, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s 2020-2021 Automotive Color Trends collection shows new optimism and a positive mood</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><p>BASF has released its 2020-2021 Automotive Color Trends collection with a variety of shades and effects that show the way of modern automotive coatings.</p>
<p>Designers of BASF’s Coatings division around the globe created the collection, called CODE-X, with everything from new, reimagined whites, to the darkest of jet blacks, and a variety of vibrant color spaces in-between. The colors serve as inspiration to automotive designers for vehicles that will be on the road in three to five years. Many have effects or textures, making them truly a tactile experience as well as a visual and emotional experience.</p>
</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-324.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-325" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-325.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Hartwig Michels new President of the European Petrochemical Association||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-325.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 8, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hartwig Michels new President of the European Petrochemical Association</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The European Petrochemical Association (EPCA) announced yesterday that Hartwig Michels, President Petrochemicals BASF, will be the new president of the association. ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 2, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Elastollan® 1598 A 10 FC – The best of two worlds: BASF combines the advantages of ether and ester TPU in one new product</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With Elastollan<sup>®</sup> 1598 A 10 FC, BASF presents at its virtual booth on the occasion of the International Trade Fair for Plastics Processing (Fakuma) starting October°13<sup>th</sup>, 2020, a novel TPU plastic with food contact (FC) approval that combines the highly effective hydrolysis and microbial resistance of ether-based thermoplastic polyurethanes with the excellent mechanical properties of ester TPU. Elastollan<sup>®</sup> 1598 A 10 FC is an aromatic thermoplastic polyether polyurethane that BASF has developed specifically to meet its customers’ requirements for pneumatic hose applications.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/10/p-20-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-312" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-312.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF closes divestiture of its Construction Chemicals business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF closes divestiture of its Construction Chemicals business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On September 30, 2020, effective at midnight, BASF closed the divestiture of its Construction Chemicals business to an affiliate of Lone Star, a global private equity firm. The purchase price on a cash and debt-free basis is €3.17 billion. The Construction Chemicals business now forms the newly founded MBCC Group, headquartered in Mannheim, Germany.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-320" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-320.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF develops new approach for skin protection against environmental pollution||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-320.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF develops new approach for skin protection against environmental pollution</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Today’s increasing urbanization goes hand in hand with the growing threat of potentially harmful effects that pollution can have on the skin. Being the first line of defense against particulate pollutants, the skin needs special protection. In response, BASF has developed a comprehensive approach to test typical cosmetic formulation components for their anti-pollution efficacy.</div><div class="search-result__actions" class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announces series of new product innovations in its selective hydrogenation catalysts portfolio</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">A new series of commercially proven alumina catalysts is now available with new performance features that can benefit selective hydrogenation applications such as first stage PYGAS or selective hydrogenation of dienes in C4 olefin streams. This new series of Pd on spherically shaped E15x catalysts replaces the E14x series of Pd alumina catalysts which have been used commercially for over thirty years in selective hydrogenation applications.&nbsp;&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-319.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-305" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-305.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens its own virtual platform for Fakuma 2020 ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-305.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P305_virtual_Platform-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 23, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens its own virtual platform for Fakuma 2020 </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Fakuma, one of the world's most important trade fairs for plastics processing, will not take place this year as usual. BASF offers customers and interested parties a great alternative: a dedicated virtual platform that will be online from October 13 to 20, offering more than 20 theme stands on 3D printing, processing technologies, electromobility and more. "We want to give our customers, whom we would of course have been very happy to welcome personally at the trade show, the opportunity to interact with our experts," says Jürgen Becky, head of the Performance Materials business unit in Europe. This is precisely where the virtual platform comes in: Flexible from home, on the train or from the office – the exchange with BASF experts is still guaranteed.</div><div 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Casio Computer Company cooperate to reach next level of robustness and performance for digital fitness watches</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Casio Computer Company, Tokyo, now uses BASF’s high-performance plastic Ultramid<sup>®</sup> Advanced N in its latest digital watch G-Shock GBD-H1000. The new flame retardant polyphthalamide (PPA) is used to manufacture the terminal header which sits on the terminal block and contributes to power charging and data synchronization. The high heat resistance as well as the exceptional mechanical and dimensional stability of the BASF material enhance the robustness, functionality and performance for which the G-shock watches are renowned.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-306.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-313" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-313.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and SINOPEC expand capacity for Neopentylglycol in Nanjing, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 22, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and SINOPEC expand capacity for Neopentylglycol in Nanjing, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Nanjing, China – September 22, 2020 – BASF-YPC Co., Ltd. (BYC), a 50-50 joint venture between BASF and SINOPEC, has expanded the production capacity of neopentylglycol (NPG) at the state-of-the-art Verbund site in Nanjing, China. The plant was established in 2015 with an annual capacity of 40,000 metric tons. With the completion of the expansion in August 2020, the annual capacity will reach 80,000 metric tons.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-314" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-314.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF plans realignment of Global Business Services unit||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-314.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 22, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF plans realignment of Global Business Services unit</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Global Business Services unit is being further developed. The division was established as of January 1, 2020, as part of the implementation of BASF’s corporate strategy. As of that date, around 8,400 employees worldwide transferred to Global Business Services and since then have been providing services for BASF’s business units, ranging from financial and logistical processes to services in the areas of communication, human resources, environment, health and safety.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-314.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-311" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-311.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests into Pyrum as part of its ChemCyclingTM project: Pyrolysis oil from waste tires as additional raw material source next to oil from mixed plastic waste ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P311_BASF%20investiert%20in%20Pyrum-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 21, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests into Pyrum as part of its ChemCyclingTM project: Pyrolysis oil from waste tires as additional raw material source next to oil from mixed plastic waste </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF SE is to invest €16 million into Pyrum Innovations AG, a technology company specialized in the pyrolysis of waste tires, headquartered in Dillingen/Saar, Germany. With the investment, BASF will support the expansion of Pyrum’s pyrolysis plant in Dillingen and the further roll out of the technology.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-298" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-298.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Ultrasim®: Simulation now for elastomers||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-298.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P298_Elastolan_Kabeltuelle_016-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 16, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ultrasim®: Simulation now for elastomers</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands the application range of its simulation tool Ultrasim<sup>®</sup>: as of now, the CAE tool also calculates component concepts based on elastomers, especially Elastollan<sup>®</sup>, BASF’s thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU). The simulation covers the entire process chain from initial processing to the mechanical properties of the final product. Among the special features of the simulation with Ultrasim<sup>®</sup> are options to simulate both the initial load and cyclic loads of a component. The calculation of component concepts based on elastomers with Ultrasim<sup>®</sup> is now available.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-298.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF New Business and G-Philos sign MoU for cooperation in power-to-gas (P2G) business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Yongin, South Korea, and Ludwigshafen, Germany, September 10, 2020</b> – BASF New Business GmbH (BNB), a wholly owned subsidiary of the German chemical company BASF SE, and the leading Korean P2G system company G-Philos have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to cooperate in P2G projects globally. Up to 2022, BNB will supply NAS<sup>®</sup> batteries that can provide a total of 19.2 MWh of energy to G-Philos for P2G projects. BNB will support G-Philos in further P2G projects and in the development of business with Power Conversion Systems (PCS) for NAS<sup>®</sup> batteries in South Korea as well as in the global market. Through the collaboration, the two companies expect synergy effects in the field of P2G systems for green hydrogen production.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-299.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-292" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-292.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches “Empowering Movement” brand strategy for Infinergy||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/09/p-20-292.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P292_01_Infinergy_is_Empowering_Movement-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 8, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches “Empowering Movement” brand strategy for Infinergy</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF today launched a new brand strategy, “Empowering Movement,” that presents Infinergy<sup>®</sup> – its expanded thermoplastic polyurethane (E-TPU) – with a refreshed brand identity portraying the power of movement. By increasing the efficiency and significantly lowering the environmental impact, the products meet the highest expectations of modern body shops. During the development of the waterborne basecoat line, the focus was put on sustainable aspects: The innovative formulation optimizes the processing properties for fast and efficient application and enables spray painters to produce highly efficient and at the same time environmentally friendly refinishing results. Besides reducing CO<sub>2</sub> emissions due to shorter process times in the body shop, the value of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) is consistently below 250g/l and thus the lowest on the market, making the new product line the eco-friendliest automotive refinish coatings available.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more 2020 – Ludwigshafen, Germany – trinamiX, a wholly owned subsidiary of BASF, now enables coffee roasters to better monitor and control the purchasing and refining process of coffee beans. Many factors influence the roasting result and contribute to the coffee experience. These include, among others, variety, cultivation area, quality class, storage, transport and numerous processing steps.
