This was mainly driven by a 4&nbsp;percent increase in volumes. Income from operations (EBIT) before special items was €1.6&nbsp;billion, down by 6&nbsp;percent compared with the first quarter of 2019. The decline in EBIT before special items was mainly attributable to significantly lower contributions from the Chemicals and Materials segments and from Other.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-191.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-188" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-188.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group withdraws outlook for 2020 business year||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-188.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 29, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group withdraws outlook for 2020 business year</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – April 29, 2020 – The sales and earnings forecast for the 2020 business year provided by BASF on February&nbsp;28, 2020, will not be able to be met. The company is therefore withdrawing its outlook. It is currently impossible to reliably estimate both the length and the further spread of the coronavirus pandemic, as well as future measures to contain it. Consequently, concrete statements on the future development of sales and earnings cannot be made at present.&nbsp;The Board of Executive Directors and Supervisory Board decided in today’s Supervisory Board meeting to propose a dividend of €3.30 per share for resolution by the Annual Shareholders’ Meeting of BASF&nbsp;SE, which will be held June&nbsp;18, 2020. The company is therefore confirming its proposed dividend for the 2019 business year, as announced in the BASF&nbsp;Report 2019.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-188.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-187" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-187.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF appoints BTC Europe distribution partner for the entire personal care portfolio in the UK and Ireland||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-187.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 28, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF appoints BTC Europe distribution partner for the entire personal care portfolio in the UK and Ireland</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is pleased to announce that it has appointed BTC Europe as its distribution partner for the personal care portfolio in the UK and Ireland with effect from 1st June 2020. With a recent Eco-Efficiency Analysis (EEA) for different mineral oil based hydraulic fluids, jointly executed by FUCHS and BASF’s global business unit Fuel and Lubricant Solutions, the two partners have now established a strong case for a holistic real fact-based sustainability assessment of lubricants-hydraulic fluids.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-186.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-190" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-190.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 1st Quarter 2020 Conference Call on April 30, 2020, at 9:00 a.m. (CEST)||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-190.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Plastics, with unique characteristics and when used properly, contribute to a more sustainable and resource efficient future. However, to move towards a circular economy, more plastic waste needs to be recovered and reused.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-183.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-182" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-182.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Scalposine™: new detox ritual promotes a healthy scalp and microbial diversity||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-182.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 15, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Scalposine™: new detox ritual promotes a healthy scalp and microbial diversity</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Duesseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – April 15, 2020 </b>– Today’s hectic lifestyle as well as environmental influences such as dust and pollution negatively modify the physiological parameters of the scalp, making hair and scalp concerns more prevalent around the world. An unhealthy scalp is often oily, covered with dandruff and can become sensitive. In response, BASF has created Scalposine™ – a true scalp detox that can restore beauty and health. The new active ingredient is proven to soothe and purify the scalp by decreasing the production of sebum and replenishing scalp microbiota.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-182.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-180" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-180.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF donates over 100 million protective masks ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-180.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Auswahl_Fahnen_D16_002_Fahnen_2016:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 14, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF donates over 100 million protective masks </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">As part of BASF’s “Helping Hands” campaign in the fight against the corona pandemic, BASF is donating 100 million protective masks to the Federal Republic of Germany. The company is also donating 1 million masks to the State of Rhineland-Palatinate. BASF’s corporate headquarters are located in Ludwigshafen, Rhineland-Palatinate. With around 35,000 employees, it is BASF’s largest production site worldwide. The masks will be purchased in China and prepared for shipment to Germany.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-180.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-178" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-178.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives innovation awards for EcoSun Pass, Texapon® SFA and Inolixir™||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-178.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 9, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives innovation awards for EcoSun Pass, Texapon® SFA and Inolixir™</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Duesseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – April 9, 2020 –</b> BASF’s Care Creations<sup>®</sup> has thrice been awarded the BSB Innovation Prize 2020: The EcoSun Pass, a new methodology that provides environmental evaluation of UV filter systems, achieved first place in the category “Concepts”. BASF’s 100 percent naturally derived, anionic surfactant Texapon<sup>®</sup> SFA achieved second place in the “Functionals and Recipients” sub-category of “Cosmetics”. The bioactive ingredient Inolixir™, a 100 percent natural extract from the chaga mushroom,<b> </b>was awarded with the third place in the “Naturals and Actives” sub-category of “Cosmetics”.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-178.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-179" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-179.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF plans virtual Annual Shareholders’ Meeting on June 18, 2020||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-179.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 9, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF plans virtual Annual Shareholders’ Meeting on June 18, 2020</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – April 9, 2020 – Due to the spread of the coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) in Germany, BASF SE plans to conduct the company’s Annual Shareholders’ Meeting on June 18, 2020 as an entirely virtual shareholders’ meeting without the presence of shareholders. The health of employees, shareholders and the service providers involved takes priority. The virtual format, which has been made possible for this year by German legislation, will allow BASF’s Annual Shareholders’ Meeting to take place within the statutory period of six months after the end of the fiscal year, as required by law for companies with the legal form of a Societas Europaea (SE); in the case of BASF, the fiscal year corresponds to the calendar year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-179.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-176" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-176.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Personal Care donates hand sanitizers at European sites||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-176.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P176_IMG_0258-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 7, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Personal Care donates hand sanitizers at European sites</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Düsseldorf, Germany – April 7, 2020 – BASF Personal Care has started the production of hand sanitizers at different production sites in Europe. The products are being provided free of charge to hospitals, care facilities and other institutions in regions surrounding production plants. The company wants to help overcome the current bottleneck for hand sanitizer that resulted from significantly increased demand.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-176.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-174" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-174.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Glycosyn leverage IP to successfully remove Glycom’s HMO products for IBS management from Amazon.com||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-174.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 2, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Glycosyn leverage IP to successfully remove Glycom’s HMO products for IBS management from Amazon.com</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 2, 2020 – BASF and Glycosyn announced its recent success in delisting Human Milk Oligosaccharide (HMO) products for Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) applications from Amazon.com in the United States. BASF filed the infringements using the Amazon Utility Patent Neutral Evaluation Procedure based on BASF’s in-licensed US Patent No. 10,098,903.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/04/p-20-174.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-159" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-159.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces Fourtune™ Fluidized Catalytic Cracking (FCC) catalyst to deliver more butylene for refiners ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-159.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P159_Fourtune_New_FCC_Catalyst_by_BASF-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 23, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces Fourtune™ Fluidized Catalytic Cracking (FCC) catalyst to deliver more butylene for refiners </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announced today the commercial launch of Fourtune™ which is a new Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) catalyst product for gasoil feedstock. Fourtune is the latest product based on BASF’s Multiple Framework Topology (MFT) technology. It has been optimized to deliver superior butylene over propylene selectivity while maintaining catalyst activity and performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-159.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-169" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-169.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||trinamiX launches mobile near infrared spectroscopy solution||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-169.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P169_trinamiX_mobile-NIR-spectroscopy-solutions-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 23, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">trinamiX launches mobile near infrared spectroscopy solution</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 23, 2020 – Ludwigshafen, Germany<b> –</b> trinamiX GmbH (Ludwigshafen, Germany), a wholly-owned subsidiary of BASF SE, today announced the launch of a mobile near infrared (NIR) spectroscopy solution. Spectroscopy is a well-proven analysis method that trinamiX now makes affordable and accessible beyond factory and laboratory applications. trinamiX offers all the needed competences in a single, handheld device: mobile and robust hardware, precise data and material analytics and excellent molecular and chemical expertise.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Delair and BASF collaborate to accelerate research for agricultural solutions </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Limburgerhof, Germany, and Toulouse, France, March 17, 2020</b> – BASF and Delair, a global provider of end-to-end visual data management solutions for enterprises, today announced their collaboration to scale up BASF’s research and development projects for seeds, traits and crop protection. The agreement will enable BASF’s agricultural research stations worldwide to use the delair.ai cloud platform to streamline and standardize the information gained through drone-based field studies. data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New Neopolen® grade with improved surface properties and optimized filling behavior||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-157.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P157_Neopolen_P9235Plus-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 11, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New Neopolen® grade with improved surface properties and optimized filling behavior</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF further extends the product range of its expanded polypropylene foam (EPP) Neopolen®. Compared to the available grades, the new material Neopolen® P 9235+ offers improved surface properties, a color impression deepened by 20% and optimized filling behavior in manufacturing. Parts made of Neopolen® P 9235+ generate considerably less friction noise. The black particle foam is suitable for automotive parts and dunnage trays subject to impact stress as well as for constructive and protective applications in heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems. Neopolen® P 9235+ is listed in the automotive industry’s material data system IMDS and available in Europe from now on. The new standard grade will gradually replace the well-established Neopolen® P 9235 and is to evolve into a new product family including specialty grades in the medium term.</div><div </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Jens Liebermann has been appointed Vice President for the global Semiconductor business under the business unit Electronic Materials of BASF’s Dispersions &amp; Pigments division effective March 1, 2020. Jens succeeds Dominic Yang, who led the Semiconductor business in the past years and will retire from his current position. Jens will be based in Seoul, South Korea.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-152.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-135" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-135.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Finnish battery industry intensifies cooperation: Fortum, BASF, and Nornickel sign cooperation agreement on battery recycling ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-135.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P135e_ProcessGraphic2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 6, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Finnish battery industry intensifies cooperation: Fortum, BASF, and Nornickel sign cooperation agreement on battery recycling </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Harjavalta, Finland<b> </b>– Fortum, BASF, and Nornickel have signed a letter of intent to plan a battery recycling cluster in Harjavalta, Finland, serving the electric vehicle market. This would enable a successful “closed loop” cycle to re-use the critical metals present in used batteries.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Hengst develop reusable spin-on oil filter made of engineering plastic Ultramid® Structure LFX ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-145.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P145_Teaser:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 4, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Hengst develop reusable spin-on oil filter made of engineering plastic Ultramid® Structure LFX </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Hengst have developed the world’s first reusable plastic spin-on oil filter module for cars. Blue.on is the sustainable alternative to conventional spin-on modules made from metal, since it does not need to be replaced during filter change. It is made from Ultramid<sup>®</sup> Structure LFX, a long glass fiber-reinforced high-performance plastic from BASF whose specific properties provide new opportunities for metal substitution. Blue.on offers a solution to a key problem of the automotive industry when it comes to oil filter change: each year, about two billion oil filters are replaced and disposed. During oil change, the entire filter unit is exchanged, and the residual oil is disposed as hazardous waste. Moreover, a big amount of additional litter is generated.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-145.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-137" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-137.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s plastic additives help to improve the durability of highways in India||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-137.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P137_geotextile_for_road_construction-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 3, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s plastic additives help to improve the durability of highways in India</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hong Kong SAR, China – March 3, 2020 – BASF’s light stabilizers from the Chimassorb<sup>®</sup> range have been used by M/s Megaplast India Pvt Ltd (Megaplast), a leading polyethylene products manufacturer in India, to produce nonwoven geotextile used in the construction of national highways. The additive package used plays a crucial role in stabilizing the production process and extending the service lifespan of the geotextiles.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-137.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-150" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-150.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Graines Voltz to acquire HILD Samen business from BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/03/p-20-150.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 3, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Graines Voltz to acquire HILD Samen business from BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><i>Colmar, France and Nunhem, The Netherlands, March 3, 2020</i> – ­­Graines Voltz, a leading French floral and vegetable seeds distributor, signed an agreement with BASF to buy its HILD Samen business in Marbach, Germany. Currently, it is part of the vegetable seeds business of BASF’s Agricultural Solutions division. The HILD portfolio divestiture includes its seeds business and also intangible assets, particularly customer lists, intellectual property, breeding activities, and the HILD brand. The local infrastructure, however, will remain with BASF. Financial details of the transaction are not being disclosed.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF showcases solutions for the entire packaging life cycle at interpack 2020</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At interpack&nbsp;2020, which is being held in Düsseldorf from May&nbsp;7 to 13, BASF experts and specialists from BTC Europe, BASF’s European distribution organization, will present a wide range of plastics, dispersions for adhesives as well as resins and additives for printing inks and barrier coatings in hall&nbsp;10, booth B43. By 2029, the company will launch more than 30 key projects, including novel seeds and traits, chemical and biological crop protection, digital products and new formulations broadening its offer. In line with its strategy in agriculture, the company increases focus on connected solutions for farmers to enable balancing agricultural productivity, environmental protection and society’s needs. BASF will build on its research and development (R&amp;D) investment for agricultural solutions over recent years with a planned expenditure in 2020 around the prior-year level. In 2019 alone, the company spent €879 million in research and development in the Agricultural Solutions division; representing around 11% of sales for the segment.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-136.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-141" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-141.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group: EBIT before special items declines despite better development in all downstream segments||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-141.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; the slight decline in sales compared with the previous year resulted from lower volumes and prices. At the end of 2019, the proportion of female managers was 23.0&nbsp;percent (2018: 21.7&nbsp;percent). In 2015, BASF had set itself the target of increasing the proportion of women in leadership roles to 22&nbsp;to 24&nbsp;percent as of 2021, which it achieved ahead of schedule at the end of 2019.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-132.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-140" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-140.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Annual Press Conference on February 28, 2020, at 10:30 a.m. ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-140.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 20, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice - Annual Press Conference on February 28, 2020, at 10:30 a.m. </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On Friday, February&nbsp;28, 2020, the Annual Press Conference of BASF&nbsp;SE will be held in Ludwigshafen, Germany. At 10:30&nbsp;a.m.&nbsp;(CET) BASF’s Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors Dr.&nbsp;Martin Brudermüller and CFO Dr.&nbsp;Hans-Ulrich&nbsp;Engel will present the 2019 financial results. The conference will be transmitted via the internet.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-140.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-128" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-128.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||xarvio™ introduces new FIELD MANAGER features for 2020||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-128.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P128_xarvio_Field_Manager-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 19, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">xarvio™ introduces new FIELD MANAGER features for 2020</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s digital farming product xarvio™ FIELD MANAGER saw a robust 2019, supporting the crop production of over two million hectares of farmed fields of more than 17,000 farmers globally. Based on extensive customer feedback, xarvio is now introducing new features for 2020. These include field-zone specific nutrient management including timing and dosing, application maps with automatically integrated buffer zones as well as wireless machine connectivity. Furthermore, new functions were launched to allow farmers and their advisors to better collaborate directly in xarvio FIELD MANAGER. All new features are available on mobile devices for farmers worldwide.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-128.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-131" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-131.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF will use all legal remedies available to appeal the jury’s decision in the Dicamba case||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-131.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 17, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will use all legal remedies available to appeal the jury’s decision in the Dicamba case</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is surprised by the jury’s decision in the Bader case and disagrees with the verdict. The company will use all legal remedies available and will appeal the decision.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-131.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-127" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-127.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF further invests in Europe to strengthen global leadership position for battery materials for electric vehicles||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-127.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P127_BASF-Schwarzheide_and_CHP_plant-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 12, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF further invests in Europe to strengthen global leadership position for battery materials for electric vehicles</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is announcing a new battery materials production site in Schwarzheide, Germany, as part of its multi-step investment plan to support the European electric vehicle (EV) value chain. This state-of-the art plant will produce cathode active materials (CAM) with an initial capacity enabling the supply of around 400,000 full electric vehicles per year with BASF battery materials. Innovative cathode materials by BASF increase the performance of batteries, promoting the success of climate-friendly mobility.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-127.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-129" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-129.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF at Simac – sustainable and high-tech solutions for footwear ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-129.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P129_SIMAC_Wedges_from_Roberto_Guzzonato-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 12, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF at Simac – sustainable and high-tech solutions for footwear </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">A virtual concept shoe made entirely of innovative BASF materials, a 3D printed shoe made from TPU, breathtaking creations by young designers - this and other product-related innovations will be presented by BASF at SIMAC, the international machine and technology fair for shoes in Milan. From February 19 to 21, visitors to Hall 14, Stand G 40, will be given an insight into sustainable, high-performance materials, pioneering shoe concepts and BASF's wide-ranging shoe expertise.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-129.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-125" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-125.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||JenaBatteries and BASF cooperate in the development of innovative power storage technology ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-125.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P125_BASF_JenaBatteries_RFB-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 6, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">JenaBatteries and BASF cooperate in the development of innovative power storage technology </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Jena, Febuary 06, 2020 - JenaBatteries GmbH and BASF are cooperating in the production of an electrolyte for a battery technology that is particularly suitable for stationary storage of electricity from renewable energy sources and for stabilizing conventional transmission grids. JenaBatteries, which has developed this technology based on a so-called redox flow battery (RFB) with organic materials, thus has the world's first commercially available technology of this kind. Two liquid organic electrolytes separated by a membrane and stored in separate tanks store the current. BASF will supply one of the two electrolytes as part of the collaboration. This battery material is based on an amine, a chemical intermediate that the company can produce on an industrial scale. JenaBatteries plans to market the first RFB in 2020.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-125.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-123" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-123.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Fabbri Group develop certified compostable cling film for fresh-food packaging||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-123.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P123_Fabbri_Group-NatureFresh-0114-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 5, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Fabbri Group develop certified compostable cling film for fresh-food packaging</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Vignola, February 5th, 2020 - BASF and Fabbri Group have developed a sustainable solution for cling film used in fresh-food packaging: Based on BASF’s certified compostable ecovio®, Fabbri Group produces the highly transparent stretch film Nature Fresh. Meat, seafood as well as fruit and vegetables can be wrapped manually or with automatic packaging equipment. Industrial stretch packaging is also possible. It is the first certified compostable cling film that combines optimal breathability for an extended shelf life of fresh food with high transparency and excellent mechanical properties for automatic packaging. Nature Fresh is food-contact approved according to US and European standards.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/02/p-20-123.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-114" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-114.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF closes acquisition of polyamide business from Solvay||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-114.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P114_Polyamide_production-3:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 31, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF closes acquisition of polyamide business from Solvay</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On January 31, 2020, BASF closed the acquisition of Solvay’s polyamide (PA 6.6) business. The transaction broadens BASF’s polyamide capabilities with innovative and well-known products such as Technyl<sup>®</sup>. This will allow BASF to support its customers with even better engineering plastics solutions, e.g., for autonomous driving and e-mobility. The transaction also enhances the company’s access to growth markets in Asia as well as in North and South America. Through the backward integration into the key raw material adiponitrile (ADN), BASF will now be present along the entire value chain for polyamide 6.6 and improve its supply reliability. The purchase price for the polyamide business acquired by BASF on a cash and debt-free basis amounts to €1.3 billion; sales generated in 2018 were about €1.0 billion. The business will be integrated into the Performance Materials and Monomers divisions of BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-114.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-117" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-117.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||For the windows of the future: New Ultradur® grade improves the properties of PVC-window profiles||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-117.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P117_Teaser:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 24, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">For the windows of the future: New Ultradur® grade improves the properties of PVC-window profiles</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Modern insulation is a key to effective climate protection, and this also applies to window profiles in new and renovated buildings. BASF has developed an Ultradur® (Ultradur® B4040 G11 HMG HP green 75074) that can be used for co-extrusion with PVC and is now available with a significantly improved property profile. With this new Ultradur® grade, PVC window profiles can be mechanically stiffened in the co-extrusion process. Compared with steel stiffening, the profile is lighter and can be produced at lower cost without compromising on stability and with improved insulation. Slimmer geometries are also potentially possible.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-117.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-116" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-116.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in the expansion of polyurethane dispersion business in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-116.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P116_Site_Castellbisbal_web-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 23, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in the expansion of polyurethane dispersion business in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announced a single-digit million-euro investment in the capacity expansion of water-based polyurethane dispersions at its Castellbisbal site in Spain. The expansion will allow BASF to increase its production capacity by 30 percent. “We want to continue to provide our customers with high-quality polyurethane dispersions and help them grow by ensuring supply reliability. Considering the rising demand for polyurethane dispersions in Europe, this investment underlines our intention to assume a leading position in the business of polyurethane dispersions,” says Frank Hezel, Vice President Resins &amp; Additives EMEA at BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-116.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-108" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-108.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Groundbreaking ceremony marks start of a new BASF production hub for crop protection in Singapore||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-108.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P108_photo1-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 22, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Groundbreaking ceremony marks start of a new BASF production hub for crop protection in Singapore</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Singapore – Today, BASF broke ground on a new regional production hub for its Agricultural Solutions business in Asia Pacific. Scheduled for completion in Q3 2021, the multipurpose facility has been designed to handle six different formulation technologies and will supply the company’s patented crop protection products to farmers across the fast-growing Asia Pacific region. When fully operational, the plant will have a production capacity of 7 million liters per year – enough to cover 20 million hectares of farmland – and employ a staff of more than 25 employees.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-108.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-115" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-115.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in capacity expansion for methane sulfonic acid||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-115.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 20, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in capacity expansion for methane sulfonic acid</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">As already announced at the end of 2018, BASF will proceed with expanding global capacities for methane sulfonic acid (MSA) to 50,000 metric tons per year. This involves a higher double-digit million euro investment in constructing a new methane sulfonic acid plant at the Ludwigshafen site. The construction works started recently. The volumes from the additional capacity are expected to be available from the end of 2021 and are dedicated to mainly serve European customers as well as the rapidly growing Asian market.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-115.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-107" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-107.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||World’s first registration for BASF insecticide Broflanilide in Australia||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-107.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P107e_Pest_Controller:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 16, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">World’s first registration for BASF insecticide Broflanilide in Australia</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Melbourne, Australia – BASF’s latest insecticide Broflanilide received the first registration worldwide by the Australian Pesticides and Veterinary Medicines Authority (APVMA). Co-developed with Mitsui Chemicals Agro, Inc. (MCAG), the active ingredient is a powerful and versatile insecticide for use in crop production as well as to control urban and rural pests. Pest management professionals in Australia will be the first to benefit from this innovative solution, with products marketed under the Vedira™ brand. Further registrations, for uses in crop production, are anticipated in the U.S., Canada, Mexico and India, with additional registration submissions planned in upcoming years for key markets.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-107.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-104" 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands production capacity for Irganox® 1520L in Pontecchio Marconi, Italy</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 15, 2020 – BASF plans to increase the production capacity for its antioxidant Irganox<sup>®</sup> 1520L by 20% at the site in Pontecchio Marconi, Italy. Irganox<sup>®</sup> 1520L is a key product in BASF’s antioxidant portfolio. The company is a leading global supplier for plastic additives. With this expansion, BASF responds to an increasing market demand and aims to better serve its global customers.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-104.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-112" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-112.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||White still dominates BASF’s analysis of the 2019 automotive color distribution||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P112_Teaser_AEM-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 15, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">White still dominates BASF’s analysis of the 2019 automotive color distribution</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Whether driving the Interstate highways of America, the Autobahn in Europe, or the Asian Highway Network, chances are, one will see more white cars than any other color on the road. This is one of the central results of the BASF Color Report 2019 for Automotive OEM Coatings. About 39% of all cars built around the globe were painted white. Behind that number is an interesting shift: Although white is the most popular color in every region, there are remarkable differences in the regional distribution. While in Asia Pacific almost every second car is painted white, only every third car in North America and EMEA is coated in this color.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div data-v-5db4dc0c="">CosmetAgora 2020: BASF focuses on millennials and back-to-nature trend </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Paris, France – January 14, 2020 </b>– At this year’s Cosmet’Agora from January 14–15 in Paris, BASF’s Care Creations<sup>®</sup> will present its “Being Millennials” concept and showcase a range of solutions with natural-based ingredients at booths 158-159-160. “The personal care sector is a fast-changing industry with an impact that goes far beyond daily beauty routines”, said Marine Belthé, Marketing Manager at BASF Personal Care Europe. “Millennials see the beauty sector as a way of celebrating diversity, and the choice of products can be an expression of one’s emotional attachment and sense of responsibility for nature. With our broad portfolio and expertise, we support our customers in developing tailor-made solutions that meet the growing demands of consumers.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" Visually attractive surfaces require superior concrete quality. This is where Master Builders Solutions<sup>®</sup> concrete admixtures come in: They ensure void-free, smooth and sharp-edged concrete surfaces that meet the highest requirements on esthetics and design and, at the same time, increase the profitability and ecology of precast-element production. The broad portfolio offers solutions across the entire production process, from plasticizers and hardening accelerators to release agents to formwork cleaners. The experts from Master Builders Solutions will assist in selecting the right combination of products to find the ideal solution for every challenge.</div><div class="search-result__actions" applications </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><b>Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 9, 2020 –</b> With a single-digit million-euro investment, BASF has enhanced the flexibility of its water-soluble polyacrylate production plant at the company's Ludwigshafen site, Germany, and slightly expanded capacity. The upgraded plant is now operational, enabling customers in the household and commercial cleaning products, as well as for chemical and formulator industries to benefit from the expanded capacity in specialty chemicals.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-102.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-100" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-100.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes the divestiture of its ultrafiltration membrane business to DuPont||/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-100.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 2, 2020</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes the divestiture of its ultrafiltration membrane business to DuPont</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has closed the previously announced transaction to divest its ultrafiltration membrane business to DuPont Safety &amp; Construction (DuPont). The divestiture includes the shares of inge GmbH, the business’ headquarters and production site in Greifenberg, Germany, including all employees, its international sales force, and certain intellectual property previously owned by BASF SE. Financial details of the transaction are not being disclosed.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2020/01/p-20-100.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-421" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-421.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Lone Star Funds to acquire BASF’s Construction Chemicals business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-421.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 21, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lone Star Funds to acquire BASF’s Construction Chemicals business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Today, BASF and an affiliate of Lone Star, a global private equity firm, signed a purchase agreement for the acquisition of BASF’s Construction Chemicals business. The purchase price on a cash and debt-free basis is €3.17 billion. The transaction is expected to close in the third quarter of 2020, subject to the approval of the relevant competition authorities.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-421.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-422" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-422.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF pushes UV filter production capacities||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-422.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 19, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF pushes UV filter production capacities</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 19, 2019 – BASF as market leader for UV filters and ingredients used in sun care products, performs a range of production expansion activities for UV filters, so as to continue to support the global market demand and its global customer growth. Debottlenecking activities at the production sites Grenzach and Ludwigshafen were a first step and will lead to double digit percent increase of production capacities, e.g. for the value chains of Tinosorb<sup>®</sup> S, Uvinul<sup>®</sup> A Plus and Uvinul<sup>®</sup> T150.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled"
