data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||MasterTop 1912 – the innovative, low-emission flooring system for durable esthetics across industrial areas||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-411.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P411_MasterTop_1912_Linked_Post_EN:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 17, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">MasterTop 1912 – the innovative, low-emission flooring system for durable esthetics across industrial areas</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The MasterTop 1900 range, from the broad Master Builders Solutions<sup>® </sup>portfolio of advanced flooring solutions, provides esthetic flooring systems that are particularly suitable for industrial areas. Part of the 1900 range, the innovative MasterTop 1912 system, meets the highest requirements regarding wear resistance, durability and visual appearance, and scores with low emission values. The unique high performance of the 1912 system is given by Master Builders Solutions’ Xolutec<sup>TM</sup> technology. Xolutec<sup>TM</sup> is the result of intensive research efforts and was developed for special construction materials used in areas characterized by high mechanical and thermal stress. The innovative technology ensures exceptional scratch, wear resistance and low dirt pick-up. MasterTop 1912 thus provides a resilient as well as visually attractive flooring solution particularly suitable for use in industrial areas such as production facilities, laboratories or warehouses.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-411.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-419" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-419.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF inaugurates the second phase of its new antioxidants manufacturing plant in Shanghai||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-419.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P419_INR0855:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 17, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF inaugurates the second phase of its new antioxidants manufacturing plant in Shanghai</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hong Kong SAR, China – December 17, 2019 – BASF today inaugurated the second phase of its new, world-scale antioxidants manufacturing plant at its Caojing site in Shanghai, China. The second phase comprises a synthesis plant to produce the antioxidants Irgafos<sup>®</sup> 168 and Irganox<sup>®</sup> 1076. With the completion of the second phase, the plant will have an annual capacity of 42,000 tons, mainly serving customers in China.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-419.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-420" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-420.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Linde win ICIS Award for Best Process Innovation||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-420.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P420_Winners_Best_Process_Innovation:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 17, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Linde win ICIS Award for Best Process Innovation</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Linde’s DRYREF™ syngas process in combination with BASF’s SYNSPIRE™ catalyst enable steam reforming of methane in dryer conditions and the use of CO<sub>2 </sub>as feedstock, contributing to energy savings and improved CO<sub>2</sub> footprint. For this new technology, BASF and Linde Engineering have now received the ICIS Award 2019 for Best Process Innovation. ICIS (Independent Commodity Information Service)<i> </i>is the world’s largest petrochemical market information provider and each year an expert jury selects the winners of the prestigious Innovation Awards.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-420.html" class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New foam grade Basotect® UF+ with improved emission profile</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now expanding its range of the melamine resin foam Basotect®: The new grade Basotect® UF+ with improved emission properties replaces the successful Basotect® UF and opens up additional fields of application. The exceptionally lightweight and flexible foam is ideally suited for the insulation of rail vehicles as well as of heating, ventilation and air-conditioning (HVAC) technology in buildings. Equinom's computerized breeding technology provides optimized seeds for the food industry to help it meet growing demand for plant-based products used as ingredients, clean label packed goods and healthier lifestyle cuisine. With this investment, BASF Venture Capital promotes BASF’s strategy of applying innovative solutions in agriculture. Existing investors who also joined this round include, among others, Fortissimo Capital, a leading Israeli private equity fund that invests primarily in the technology, AgTech and industrial sectors, as well as Roquette, a global leader in plant-based ingredients for food, nutrition and health markets and a pioneer in new vegetal proteins.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-415.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-417" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-417.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Personnel changes in Corporate Communications &amp; Government Relations at BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-417.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Personnel changes in Corporate Communications &amp; Government Relations at BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Effective January 1, 2020, Christian Schubert (56), currently Vice President, Head of Berlin Office, will assume the newly created role Vice President, Corporate Government Relations, based in Berlin. data-tracking-value="news||Market-ready and certified: insulation raw material Neopor® from BASF with significantly greater CO2 savings||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-414.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P414_neopor_12:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 10, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Market-ready and certified: insulation raw material Neopor® from BASF with significantly greater CO2 savings</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now offering its graphitic expandable polystyrene (EPS) granulate Neopor<sup>®</sup> in a biomass-balance version, Neopor<sup>®</sup>&nbsp;BMB. In accordance with the balancing method certified by REDcert, 100 percent of fossil raw materials are replaced by renewable raw materials - bio naphtha or biogas. Thus, the carbon footprint of Neopor<sup>®</sup>&nbsp;BMB improves by 90 percent compared to conventionally produced Neopor<sup>®</sup>. Detailed information on the environmental impacts of an insulation board made of Neopor<sup>®</sup>&nbsp;BMB can be found in an environmental product declaration (EPD) drawn up by the German association of building product manufacturers, Institut Bauen und Umwelt e.V. (IBU), specifically for insulation materials made of Neopor<sup>®</sup>&nbsp;BMB.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-414.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-413" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-413.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New Ultrason® P with improved flowability||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-413.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P413_Ultrason_P2010:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New Ultrason® P with improved flowability</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now expanding its Ultrason<sup>®</sup> P product range with a particularly low-viscosity grade. The new polyphenylsulfone (PPSU) Ultrason<sup>®</sup> P 2010 is characterized by improved flow behavior in injection molding while maintaining the excellent mechanical properties of Ultrason<sup>®</sup> P. Thus it is possible to manufacture larger, complex-shaped components, e.g. catering dishes and heat-resistant containers with sophisticated, thin-walled geometries, for catering and aircraft applications. This means that in processing raw material use, energy consumption and component weight can be reduced: the tool also fills up at lower injection pressures and processing temperatures. Ultrason<sup>®</sup> P 2010 is now available globally in transparent and opaque.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF designfabrik® presents ‘Material Selection N°1’</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In its trend book, BASF designfabrik<sup>®</sup>, which is part of the new Creation Centers, presents the results of an international study that combines current social trends with innovative new materials and How do ‘circular economy’ and exclusivity, improvisational art and innovation fit together and which materials can combine these characteristics? The designfabrik<sup>®</sup> teams from the Creation Centers in Shanghai, Mumbai, Yokohama and Ludwigshafen have found answers and solutions to these questions, which they present in the ‘Material Selection N°1’.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/12/p-19-410.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-406" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-406.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF's light stabilizer protects playground slides from UV light||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-406.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P406_slide:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 27, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF's light stabilizer protects playground slides from UV light</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hong Kong SAR, China – November 27, 2019 – BASF’s light stabilizer Tinuvin® has been adopted by Suiko Co. Ltd., Japan, to make rotationally-molded low-density polyethylene (LDPE) slides, complete with UV stabilized and antistatic properties, for children’s playgrounds.&nbsp;<b></b></div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-406.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-399" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-399.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Hot, hotter, Elastocoat® C for pultrusion||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-399.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 26, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hot, hotter, Elastocoat® C for pultrusion</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Elastocoat® C is BASF’s renowned polyurethane (PU) resin, which is used in pultrusion technology for high performance profiles. In contrast to other resins, these PU systems exhibit significant advantages not only for pultrusion speeds at low pull forces and a very high interlaminar shear strength (ILSS) and no emission at the profile.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-399.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-403" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-403.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF commences its smart Verbund project in Zhanjiang, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-403.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P403_ZJ_Verbund_Commencement:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 23, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF commences its smart Verbund project in Zhanjiang, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Today, BASF officially launched its smart Verbund project in Zhanjiang, Guangdong province, China, and commenced building its first plants. Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests US$ 4 million in AgVentures II fund managed by SP Ventures</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">São Paulo, Brazil, and Ludwigshafen, Germany, November 18, 2019 – BASF Venture Capital is one of the main investors in the first closing of the Brazilian fund AgVentures II having committed US$ 4 million. The fund is managed by São Paulo-based SP Ventures and focuses on startups from the Latin American agricultural and food (AgFood) sector. The fund aims to support 20 to 25 new companies founded and headquartered in Latin America. Besides BASF, other investors include multinational companies as strategic investors as well as financial investors, international development finance institutions and local family offices. For BASF Venture Capital, this represents the first investment in Brazil.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-310.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-398" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-398.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Acquires 3D Printing Service Provider Sculpteo||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-398.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P398_sculpteo-teaser:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Acquires 3D Printing Service Provider Sculpteo</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">To continue to expand its position as a leading service provider in the additive manufacturing sector, BASF New Business GmbH has formally agreed to acquire the online 3D printing service provider Sculpteo. The agreement was signed on November 14, 2019 and is expected to become effective in the next few weeks pending regulatory approval by the relevant authorities. The acquisition of the French 3D printing specialist based in Paris and San Francisco will enable BASF 3D Printing Solutions GmbH, a wholly-owned subsidiary of BASF New Business GmbH, to market and establish new industrial 3D printing materials more quickly. Sculpteo’s management team fully supports the acquisition and will remain in place to provide customers and partners with this expanded service spectrum.</div><div class="search-result__actions" Heldt was honored for his achievements in the agricultural industry after a career spanning almost 40 years. The award recognizes exceptional individuals with a consistent history of service above and beyond the call of duty.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-397" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-397.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Volkswagen and BASF honour battery researcher Dr. Kimberly See||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-397.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P397_electro_chemistry_award_2019:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 13, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Volkswagen and BASF honour battery researcher Dr. Kimberly See</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Wolfsburg / Ludwigshafen (Germany), November 13, 2019 – This year’s international Science Award Electrochemistry was presented to Dr Kimberly See of the California Institute of Technology (Pasadena, California, USA). She was honoured yesterday evening at the Science Award Electrochemistry &amp; Science Dialogue held in Wolfsburg’s Autostadt. The award has been presented seven times as a joint initiative of Volkswagen and BASF and is aimed at young scientists of excellence. Prizes total €70,000, of which €50,000 is awarded to the overall winner.&nbsp;</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-397.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-385" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-385.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF 3D Printing Solutions Exhibits Industrial Additive Manufacturing Solutions at Formnext 2019 under New Brand Name||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-385.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P385_ForwardAM_Logo_Claim_White-LightBlue:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 12, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF 3D Printing Solutions Exhibits Industrial Additive Manufacturing Solutions at Formnext 2019 under New Brand Name</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF 3D Printing Solutions (B3DPS) will be exhibiting at Formnext 2019, the leading sector show for additive-based manufacturing, with an expanded product range and a new brand presence. Sector specialists are warmly invited to meet B3DPS specialists in person from November 19 through 22 at Booth D21, Hall 12.1 at the Frankfurt Trade Fair. With the introduction of its new Forward AM corporate brand, B3DPS continues to pursue its goal of driving industrial scalability as the next phase of additive-based manufacturing. “Forward” stands for future-oriented, leading-edge materials and technology, while “AM” stands for “additive manufacturing”. The new arrow-symbol brand logo and “Innovating Additive Manufacturing” baseline emphasize the company’s dynamic approach to this exciting industrial manufacturing sector.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-385.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-393" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-393.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||SCS Formulate 2019: BASF presents eco-friendly solutions for the personal care market||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/11/p-19-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/IMGL8720:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 12, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">SCS Formulate 2019: BASF presents eco-friendly solutions for the personal care market</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Coventry, United Kingdom – November 12, 2019 – At SCS Formulate on November 12th and 13th in Coventry, BASF will share stand 500 with its European distribution organization BTC Europe and BASF Colors and Effects. class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Bosch and BASF expand their cooperation for digital agriculture</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Stuttgart / Cologne, Germany, November 7, 2019 – Bosch and xarvio™ Digital Farming Solutions of BASF are further intensifying their successful cooperation in the development of digital solutions for farming. The companies have now established a project center that enables them to undertake their joint research and development activities at the same location. Since 2016, employees of the two companies have already been working together on the smart spraying project, a technology for precise herbicide application that significantly reduces the total amount of herbicides used. The market launch of Smart Spraying is planned for 2021. The high-performance material solution enables Mizuno’s ‘Center of Balance’ (COB) technology that accurately transmits information to the soles of the feet through activation bumps molded into the surface of the midsole. research projects. This was mainly attributable to lower prices in the Materials and Chemicals segments. The uncertainties in the market and cautious ordering by customers also played a role. Demand from key customer sectors did not recover. Nevertheless, BASF was able to keep its sales volumes at the level of the prior-year quarter thanks mainly to higher volumes in the Agricultural Solutions and Surface Technologies segments.</div><div Directors from  seven to six members</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 21, 2019 – The Supervisory Board of BASF SE today decided to reduce the size of the company’s Board of Executive Directors from seven to six members effective January 1, 2020, as part of ongoing efficiency measures. Board member Sanjeev Gandhi will leave the company at his own request. He was appointed to the Board in December 2014.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-371.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-335" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-335.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||ADNOC, Adani, BASF and Borealis sign Memorandum of Understanding to further evaluate collaboration for a chemical production complex in Mundra, India||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P335_Mundra_port_Adani-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 17, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">ADNOC, Adani, BASF and Borealis sign Memorandum of Understanding to further evaluate collaboration for a chemical production complex in Mundra, India</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 17, 2019 – Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (“ADNOC”), Adani Group (“Adani”), BASF SE (“BASF”) and Borealis AG (“Borealis”) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to engage in a joint feasibility study to further evaluate a collaboration for the establishment of a chemical complex in Mundra, Gujarat, India. This is the next step of BASF’s and Adani’s investment plans as announced in January 2019. With the inclusion of ADNOC and Borealis as potential partners, the parties are examining various structuring options for the chemical complex that will leverage the technical, financial and operational strengths of each company. The total investment is estimated to be up to $4 billion.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-366" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-366.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2019 Conference Call on October 24, 2019, at 9:00 a.m.||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-366.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 17, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2019 Conference Call on October 24, 2019, at 9:00 a.m.</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">We will publish BASF’s Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2019 at 7:00 a.m. (CEST). 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF develops Ultramid® particle foam for a wide range of applications</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">For the first time, BASF introduces a particle foam based on a combination of several polyamide 6 grades. The particle foam excels with a wide range of unique characteristics: high temperature-resistance, outstanding stiffness and strength as well as an excellent chemical resistance, e.g. in contact with fuels, oils and lubricants. Additionally, the closed cell foam structure offers an exceptional compressive strength.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-360.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-361" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-361.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release - BASF partners with EMDE Development of Light to bring innovative LED Sunvue® technology to the European market ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-361.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P361e_BASF_EMDE_300dpi:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 14, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release - BASF partners with EMDE Development of Light to bring innovative LED Sunvue® technology to the European market </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 17, 2019 – BASF signed a distribution agreement with EMDE Development of Light (EMDE), one of the most innovative lighting design companies in Europe. Under the agreement, EMDE will distribute BASF’s innovative LED Sunvue® lighting products in Europe. In addition, the lighting company will adopt BASF’s color conversion technology to design new lighting products and solutions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-361.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-358" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-358.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Energy-efficient construction elements: Elastopir® Blue permits forward-looking construction with better insulation value||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P358_Elastopir_Nut_Feder_01_ret_web.-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Energy-efficient construction elements: Elastopir® Blue permits forward-looking construction with better insulation value</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advanced insulation is a key to effective climate protection. This also applies to industrial buildings, cold stores, deep-freeze warehouses and other commercial buildings. At K 2019 in Düsseldorf, BASF will unveil Elastopir® Blue, a new PU rigid foam solution with a low lambda value (down to λD = 19 mW/m ∙K) that achieves exceptional standards of energy efficiency while at the same time setting new standards for sandwich panels.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-350" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/10/p-19-350.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release - The investment will be facilitated via the subscription of new shares and via the grant of a convertible loan. Together, the partners aim to further develop Quantafuel’s technology for chemical recycling, consisting of an integrated process of pyrolysis and purification, towards optimizing the output for the use as feedstock in chemical production. In a second step, Quantafuel also plans to license the jointly developed technology to other parties.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In line with its customer-focused corporate strategy, BASF will expand the capacity of ethylene oxide and ethylene oxide derivatives at its Verbund site in Antwerp, Belgium. The total investment adds about 400,000 metric tons per year to BASF’s production capacity for the corresponding products with an expected investment amount exceeding €500 million.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-343" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-343.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF presents new findings and products of innovation platforms for actives at IFSCC Conference 2019||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-343.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF presents new findings and products of innovation platforms for actives at IFSCC Conference 2019</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Milan, Italy – September 30, 2019 – At this year’s International Federation of Societies of Cosmetic Chemists (IFSCC) Conference in Milan, Italy, BASF experts will share insights into their scientific research and present a range of innovative solutions. They will be available for discussions in booth B01 on October 1 and 2, take part in speaking sessions and present posters. There will be a strong focus on bioactive ingredients stemming from the development platforms for epigenetics, microbiome and extraction methods.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-343.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-344" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-344.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Inolixir™: the wellness elixir for healthy skin||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-344.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Inolixir™: the wellness elixir for healthy skin</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Extracted from the chaga mushroom (Inonotus obliquus), native to the Northern Canadian forest, Inolixir™ is the most recent addition to BASF’s portfolio of bioactive ingredients. With its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, it fortifies the skin’s natural protection system by strengthening barrier function and the microvascular network – working on all fronts to return skin to a healthier condition, with visible results on fine lines, dark-circles and redness.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-344.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-352" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-352.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF acquires majority share of Belgian internet platform UBench||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-352.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P352_BASF_Ubench_web:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF acquires majority share of Belgian internet platform UBench</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On September 30, BASF acquired a majority share of the internet platform UBench with offices in Turnhout and Geel, Belgium. Regulatory approvals are not required.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-352.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-330" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-330.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s strategy in agriculture aims for innovation-driven growth in specific markets||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-330.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P330_BASF_strategy_in_agriculture-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 27, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s strategy in agriculture aims for innovation-driven growth in specific markets</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Agricultural Solutions is targeting increased market share and growth of one percentage point above the agricultural market. By 2030, the division aims for a 50% increase in sales. It will contribute significantly to BASF Group’s target of €22 billion in sales by 2025 with Accelerator products that make a substantial sustainability contribution in the value chain. EBITDA before special items of BASF Agricultural Solutions is targeted to grow by on average 5% per year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-330.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-345" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-345.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands Production Capacity for Neopentylglycol||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-345.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 26, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands Production Capacity for Neopentylglycol</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has increased the capacity of its neopentyl glycol (NPG) plant at the Verbund site in Ludwigshafen, Germany, by 10,000 metric tons per year. Thus, the company has a total of 215,000 metric tons of NPG capacity with facilities in Ludwigshafen, Freeport / USA, Nanjing and Jilin / China. In addition, BASF is currently expanding its NPG capacity at the Nanjing site by a further 40,000 tons available from 2020, as announced in December 2017.</div><div class="search-result__actions" Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 19, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Project for responsible artisanal cobalt mining in Kolwezi,  DR Congo: launching on-site activities</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Kolwezi, Democratic Republic of Congo – With the pilot project “Cobalt for Development”, the BMW Group, BASF SE, Samsung SDI and Samsung Electronics yesterday kicked off their cross-industrial initiative aimed at improving working conditions of the people working at an artisanal cobalt mine site in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DR Congo). Cobalt is a key component in the production of batteries for electronic devices and electrified vehicles. Most of the global cobalt reserves and production are located in the south of the DR Congo.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-337.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-321" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-321.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Light, thin and extremely robust – Elastolit® makes it possible to use thin lightweight components in vehicles||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-321.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P321_Elastolit_STR-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Light, thin and extremely robust – Elastolit® makes it possible to use thin lightweight components in vehicles</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In a joint project, BASF and STR Automotive have brought components for premium vehicles into serial production for the first time using the new material Elastolit® R 8819 Lightweight. In comparison to conventional processing with PU-RRIM materials, the new process convinces due to significant weight reduction. The usual component thickness of 3.0 mm can be reduced to less than 2.5 mm, without detrimental effects on processing, quality or mechanical properties.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-321.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-333" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-333.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Young automotive spray painters exhibit outstanding performance at the WorldSkills Competition 2019 in Kazan, Russia||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-333.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Winners_Sustainable_Practice_Award:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Young automotive spray painters exhibit outstanding performance at the WorldSkills Competition 2019 in Kazan, Russia</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">After an exciting competition, the world champions in the “Car Painting” category have been determined at WorldSkills Kazan 2019. More than 1,300 competitors from 63 countries and regions competed in the world championship of skills, and the most prestigious international vocational skills competition. The gold medal was clinched by Ting-Yu Yang. The young woman from Taipei, China, proved to be the best among 27 young spray painters. The silver medal was awarded to Conor McKevitt from the United Kingdom, with the bronze medal going to Maxine Colligan from Australia.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-333.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-325" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-325.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Eramet, BASF and SUEZ partner to develop an innovative closed-loop process for the recycling of lithium-ion batteries, responding to the strong growth of the market in the coming years||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-325.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P325_BASF-ReLieVe:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Eramet, BASF and SUEZ partner to develop an innovative closed-loop process for the recycling of lithium-ion batteries, responding to the strong growth of the market in the coming years</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany; Paris, France – The “Recycling Li-ion batteries for electric Vehicle” (ReLieVe) project, founded by Eramet, BASF and SUEZ, will receive a substantial funding of €4.7 million by EIT Raw Materials, a consortium initiated and funded by the European Union, and the three members. The objective is to develop an innovative closed-loop process to recycle lithium-ion batteries from electric vehicles and to enable the production of new lithium-ion batteries in Europe.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-325.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-327" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-327.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s Bix’Activ® boosts African skin ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-327.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P327_Bix_Activ-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Bix’Activ® boosts African skin </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Duesseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – September 11, 2019 – While 35 percent of people worldwide grapple with oily skin, the topical solutions available are often not suitable for African type of skin. This skin type not only tends to produce more sebum, it also has a different composition of sebum and skin lipids, and shininess can be more pronounced. Therefore, personal care products need to be customized to its unique requirements. A clinical study in Mauritius has confirmed that BASF’s Bix’Activ® is especially effective on oily African skin.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-327.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 10, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and BNP Brinkmann acting as project partners to support current DLR research on the future of mobility</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">As the second largest, institutionally funded transport research institution in Europe, the German Aerospace Center (Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- and Raumfahrt/DLR) uses its transport program to address the big questions involving the future of mobility. BASF and its partner BNP Brinkmann are supporting the current research project “Next Generation Car” with a tailormade, light-weight composite based on natural fiber. “By using our Acrodur binder we were able, together with our partner BNP Brinkmann, to produce a composite material from renewable resources that meets the German Aerospace Center’s particularly high requirements for stability and weight”, explains Thorsten Habeck, Head of Business Management Fiber Bonding – Europe, Middle East &amp; Africa at BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-328.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-319" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-319.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Novel process developed to recover high value products from natural gas||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-319.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P147_Linde_Membranes_18x24:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Novel process developed to recover high value products from natural gas</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Pullach, Germany, September 9, 2019 – Linde developed a novel process to recover high value products from natural gas successfully combining leading technologies of BASF and Linde. The process simultaneously recovers valuable helium, liquid hydrocarbons, and purified CO2 in addition to conditioning natural gas for pipeline transportation adjusting the water and heavy hydrocarbon dew point, as well as the CO2 concentration.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-319.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-313" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-313.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF publishes 3rd Palm Progress Report||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 5, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF publishes 3rd Palm Progress Report</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 5, 2019 – BASF today launched the third edition of its palm progress report (PPR) featuring figures for 2018. One of BASF’s key renewable raw materials is palm kernel oil and its primary derivatives which are mainly used for the production of ingredients for the cosmetics, detergent and cleaner industries, as well as in human nutrition. During the past year, the company purchased 127,000 metric tons of certified sustainable palm kernel oil. This represents around 70 percent of the company’s total volume.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-317" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-317.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Master Builders Solutions® concrete admixtures meet highest esthetic demands for new theater building in Strasbourg||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/09/p-19-317.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P317_Maillon01:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 5, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® concrete admixtures meet highest esthetic demands for new theater building in Strasbourg</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The newly constructed Maillon Theater in Strasbourg, France, is set to open its doors in autumn this year. Aim of the conference is to exchange ideas and experience about the development, testing, and applications of cement-based and other building materials with their specific rheological properties.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-312" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-312.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||DIC to acquire BASF’s global pigments business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 29, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">DIC to acquire BASF’s global pigments business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and the fine chemical company DIC have reached an agreement on the acquisition of BASF’s global pigments business. The purchase price on a cash and debt-free basis is €1.15 billion. The transaction is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2020. The divestiture is subject to the approval of the relevant competition authorities.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-308" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-308.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Better soil, higher yield and more taste for tomatoes||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P308_ecovio_Mulchfolie_2-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 22, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Better soil, higher yield and more taste for tomatoes</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With ecovio® M 2351, BASF offers a certified soil-biodegradable plastic for mulch films to be used in growing tomatoes. It consists of the biodegradable co-polyester polybutylene adipate terephthalate (PBAT) ecoflex® and other biodegradable polymers made from renewable raw materials. Mulch films made of ecovio® M 2351 can be ploughed into the soil after mechanical harvest as naturally occurring micro-organisms in the soil recognize the structure of the film as food they can metabolize – the mulch films are biologically degraded.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-302" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-302.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF at Foam Expo Europe for the first time||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-302.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P302_Teaser_Pressefoto_Foam_Expo:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 19, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF at Foam Expo Europe for the first time</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">For the first time BASF is presenting a broad foam portfolio at the Foam Expo Europe, which takes place from 10 to 12 September in Stuttgart, Germany. At Europe’s largest trade fair for the technical foam industry, visitors can learn at the BASF stand in hall 10 about materials and know-how regarding polyurethane systems (PU), melamine resin and polypropylene foams as well as the latest foam innovations. The BASF materials are used in numerous industries: from household, sports and the automotive industry to aviation and construction.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-302.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-304" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-304.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF is founding member of “value balancing alliance e.V.”||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-304.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P304_Dubourg:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 19, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is founding member of “value balancing alliance e.V.”</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Which values do companies create for society – in environmental, human, social, and financial terms? And how can these contributions be measured and compared? Together with seven international companies of the recently founded “value balancing alliance e.V.”, based in Frankfurt am Main, Germany, BASF strives to create a standard that makes this holistic value creation transparent in monetary terms. The alliance is supported by the accounting firms Deloitte, EY, KPMG, PwC and by the OECD amongst others. Founding members of the nonprofit organization are, next to BASF, the companies Bosch, Deutsche Bank, LafargeHolcim, Novartis, Philip Morris International, SAP, and SK.</div><div 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Admixtures from Master Builders Solutions® optimize construction of the tallest seafront residential tower in the Mediterranean</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The tallest seafront residential tower in the Mediterranean has been built in Limassol in Cyprus: At a height of 170 meters, the ONE-Tower features 37 floors and is scheduled to become the island’s new landmark. Experts from Master Builders Solutions® supported the contractor in every stage of construction, providing admixtures MasterGlenium SKY, MasterSet, MasterLife, MasterRoc and MasterMatrix. They made a substantial contribution to the success of this project and enabled a 30% faster concrete placing compared to conventional products, a cost reduction by 30% and a 100% longer corrosion protection. “Our customers benefit of our wide range of admixtures for the most specific challenges,” points out Dr. Michael Fischer, responsible at Master Builders Solutions for regional market management for concrete additives in Europe. “In case of the ONE-Tower, the contractor was able to deal with the height of the building, the challenging marine environment and the tight time schedule.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-297.html" class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 14, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and TU Berlin launch artificial intelligence cooperation</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Germany and Berlin/Germany, August 14, 2019 – BASF and Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin) have signed an agreement to cooperate closely in the area of machine learning. The aim of the collaboration, Berlin-based Joint Lab for Machine Learning (BASLEARN), is to develop workable new mathematical models and algorithms for fundamental questions relating to chemistry, for example, from process or quantum chemistry. Both partners are jointly committed to this aim in the coming years. As essential part of the cooperation, BASF supports the research work of Prof. Dr. Klaus Robert Müller, professor for machine learning and spokesperson of the “Berlin Center for Machine Learning” at the TU Berlin, with a total of over €2.5 million over the coming five years.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" The innovative fibers can partially, or completely, replace the conventional steel reinforcement of concrete.
