2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Ontera collaborate on precision diagnostics to support farmers with in-field disease monitoring</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Santa Cruz, California and Limburgerhof, Germany – August 7, 2019 – Ontera Inc. and BASF have announced a research collaboration to detect diseases and resistances in plants leveraging Ontera’s molecular diagnostic platform. The platform analyzes and quantifies multiple characteristics in less than 20 minutes, enabling farmers to address potential yield issues and threats to their harvest before they take hold. The collaboration between BASF and Ontera has the potential to provide farmers with easy-to-use, laboratory-quality molecular information in the field to enable early, more precise treatment of plant diseases and ensure healthy, high-quality yields.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Christophe Cazabeau appointed to head of the Surface Treatment global business unit of BASF’s Coatings division </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Christophe Cazabeau, Senior Vice President, has been appointed head of the global business unit Surface Treatment of BASF’s Coatings division, which operates under the Chemetall brand. Effective August 1, he succeeds Dr. Martin Jung, who led the Chemetall business since 2017. Martin Jung has joined BASF’s Performance Materials division in Belgium.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/08/p-19-289.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-07-29-nanjing" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-07-29-nanjing.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in second tert-Butylamine plant in Nanjing, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-07-29-nanjing.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/p-19-07-29-nanjing-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 29, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in second tert-Butylamine plant in Nanjing, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Nanjing, China – July 29, 2019 – BASF plans to invest in a second production plant for tert-Butylamine (tBA) at BASF Specialty Chemicals Co. Ltd (BSNJ) in Nanjing, China. With this expansion, BASF’s global annual production capacity of tBA will increase by more than 30%. The plant is planned to start up in 2022 and will adopt advanced BASF technology which generates a minimal amount of by-products in an advanced production process.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-07-29-nanjing.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-285" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-285.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF received Global Purchasing Excellence Award by Jaguar Land Rover (JLR)||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-285.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P285_JLR_Supplier_Award_BASF-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 26, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF received Global Purchasing Excellence Award by Jaguar Land Rover (JLR)</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Coatings division has received the highest distinction at Jaguar Land Rover’s (JLR) Global Purchasing Excellence Award event. data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-273.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Now available: Trilon® M Max based on renewable resources ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-273.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 23, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Now available: Trilon® M Max based on renewable resources </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – July 23, 2019 – BASF has launched Trilon® M Max EcoBalanced, the first renewables-based Trilon® M grade produced according to the biomass balance approach. This approach replaces fossil feedstock with renewable feedstock such as bio-naphtha or biogas at the very beginning of production. The renewable feedstock is then allocated to Trilon M Max EcoBalanced, using a TÜV Nord-certified method. This allows BASF to fully replace fossil feedstock by renewables, not only saving scarce fossil resources, but also reducing damaging greenhouse gas emissions. The Trilon M Max EcoBalanced is 100 percent renewables-based, thus helping to protect the environment and the climate without compromising on the high quality BASF customers expect. Trilon M Max EcoBalanced has now been awarded certification based on the global REDcert2 scheme.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-273.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-279" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-279.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s Supervisory Board extends appointment of three Board members||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-279.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 23, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Supervisory Board extends appointment of three Board members</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany - July 23, 2019 - The Supervisory Board of BASF SE today extended the appointments of BASF Board members Saori Dubourg (47), Markus Kamieth (48) and Wayne T. Smith (59). The appointments of Dubourg and Kamieth have been extended until the end of the Annual Shareholder’s Meeting in 2025. Smith’s appointment has been extended until the end of the Annual Shareholders’ Meeting in 2022. All appointments were originally scheduled to expire in 2020.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-279.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-278" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-278.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Joint News Release -  BASF joins the International Wheat Genome  Sequencing Consortium||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-278.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P278_BASF_joins_IWGSC_high_res_web:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 22, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Joint News Release -  BASF joins the International Wheat Genome  Sequencing Consortium</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lee’s Summit, Missouri, U.S. and Limburgerhof, Germany, July 22, 2019 – The International Wheat Genome Sequencing Consortium (IWGSC) is pleased to announce that BASF has joined the organization as a sponsoring partner. The IWGSC is an international, collaborative consortium of wheat growers, plant scientists, and public and private breeders dedicated to the development of genomic resources for wheat scientists and breeders.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-278.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-272" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-272.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||The current photo||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-272.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P272_D19_001_WEF_Gruppe-2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 19, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The current photo</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Representatives from 20 international chemical companies, including scientific experts and Chief Technology Officers, attended a collaborative innovation workshop yesterday at BASF in Ludwigshafen at the joint invitation of BASF CEO Martin Brudermüller and the World Economic Forum. The results will be presented in a conference call that will be transmitted via the internet from 09:00 a.m.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-280.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-257" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-257.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Ideal solutions for future mobility||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-257.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P257_future_mobility-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 12, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ideal solutions for future mobility</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Megatrends in the automotive industry are facing new challenges for the materials used, yet at the same time opening up new opportunities. Electromobility and autonomous driving are set to revolutionize cars and put established vehicle concepts to the test. Automobile trends, such as reduced emissions, electrification and automated driving, will only become a reality with constant innovation. Modern vehicles already rely heavily on material solutions from the chemicals industry; however, in future, chemistry will play an even greater role, making a significant contribution to solving tomorrow’s mobility challenges.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-257.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-256" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-256.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Safe, reliable and brilliant performance: At K 2019, new Colors &amp; Effects® pigments meet emerging industry requirements||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-256.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Safe, reliable and brilliant performance: At K 2019, new Colors &amp; Effects® pigments meet emerging industry requirements</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will present innovation highlights from its broad range of Colors &amp; Effects® pigments for plastic applications at the K trade fair in Dusseldorf, Germany, from October 16th to 23th, in hall 5 at booth C41. The new product launches include two new Lumina® Royal effect pigments, Microlen® Piano Black, and a black and red addition to the Sicopal® product line, which are especially recommended for recycling materials and demanding applications.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-256.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-271" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-271.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF increases capacity for Higher Carboxylic Acids||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-271.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF increases capacity for Higher Carboxylic Acids</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has increased its global production capacity for the Higher Carboxylic Acids (HCA) Isononanoic Acid (INA) and 2-Ethylhexanoic Acid (2-EHA) from 55,000 metric tons to 68,000 metric tons per year. With world-scale and highly flexible production facilities at its Verbund sites in Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Kuantan, Malaysia, BASF is among the leading producers of HCA worldwide.</div><div data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">K 2019 – New products from plastic waste:  BASF customers showcase prototypes made from chemically recycled material </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">More and more companies from the plastics industry are working on improving the recyclability of plastics and thus helping to create a circular economy. One way that BASF is contributing is the ChemCycling project: At the end of 2018, the company first used pilot volumes of a pyrolysis oil derived from plastic waste as a feedstock in its own production. At a press conference in advance of K 2019, the world’s largest trade show for the plastics and rubber industry, four partners have showcased the first prototypes that were created during the pilot phase of the project.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-254.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-262" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-262.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Multilayer packaging: innovative and sustainable||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-262.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Multilayer packaging: innovative and sustainable</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Multilayer packaging reliably ensures high-quality and fresh food products thanks to its properties. It protects the products and keeps them hygienic, thereby extending the shelf life of food. This is of particular importance in light of global food supply – one third of all food produced worldwide is spoiled before it reaches consumers’ plates. Smart solutions with multilayer packaging can play a part in reducing this unnecessary waste.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-262.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-270" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-270.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF focuses its optical brightener portfolio by divesting the stilbene type technology of BASF India Limited in Ankleshwar, India||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-270.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF focuses its optical brightener portfolio by divesting the stilbene type technology of BASF India Limited in Ankleshwar, India</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Ankleshwar, India – July 9, 2019 – BASF India Limited has entered into an agreement to divest its stilbene-based Optical Brightening Agents (OBA) business for paper and powder detergent applications to Archroma India Private Limited. The transaction includes the stilbene-based OBA product portfolio and the manufacturing unit at Ankleshwar, India. The transaction is expected to be completed in the fourth quarter of 2019 subject to applicable regulatory approvals.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-270.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-253" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-253.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||How ecovio® contributes to closing the nutrient cycle towards a Circular Economy||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-253.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P253_Pressefoto_ecovio_8960-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 8, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">How ecovio® contributes to closing the nutrient cycle towards a Circular Economy</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In the face of climate change and a growing human population the concept of a Circular Economy is becoming more and more important for the food and nutrient cycle. With the certified compostable plastic ecovio®, BASF has developed a material portfolio for a variety of applications which can be used throughout the entire food cycle. Now numerous studies by independent research institutions confirm the advantages of ecovio® for the production, packaging and transport as well as waste collection of food, based on the material’s certified biodegradability in industrial and home composting as well as in soil.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF starts up plant for functionalizing foils at the Münster site </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In the presence of the Minister of Economics, Innovation, Digitalization and Energy of the German federal state of North Rhine-Westphalia, Professor Andreas Pinkwart, and Münster’s Lord Mayor Markus Lewe, a plant for coating foils was started up on the BASF company premises in Münster. Innovative materials applied layer by layer in an ultra-thin coat give foils additional properties, thus “functionalizing” them. BASF developed the innovative coating technology and the first product – a barrier foil – within a very short time.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-264.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-268" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-268.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group: EBIT before special items in Q2 2019 considerably below expectations; outlook for full year 2019 lowered||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-268.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 8, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group: EBIT before special items in Q2 2019 considerably below expectations; outlook for full year 2019 lowered</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – July 8, 2019 – Significantly weaker-than-expected industrial production negatively impacted volumes and margin development at BASF. At around 1.5% according to current estimates, growth in industrial production in the first half of 2019 was much slower than expected. The downturn in growth in the global automotive industry was particularly strong: Globally, production declined by around 6% in the first half of 2019. In China, the world’s largest automotive market, the decrease was more than twice as high, at around 13%.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-268.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-252" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-252.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF at K 2019 – Super-Slim High-Performance Insulation Creates Extra Space in Construction and Transportation||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-252.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P252_P1_Slentite-Beton-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 5, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF at K 2019 – Super-Slim High-Performance Insulation Creates Extra Space in Construction and Transportation</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is showing its innovative, super-slim high-performance insulation materials in new applications at the world’s largest plastics trade show in Düsseldorf from October 16-23, 2019. The innovative high-performance products SLENTITE® and SLENTEX® are a new generation of energy-efficient aerogel-based insulation materials with outstanding material properties. BASF is presenting new examples of applications in carbon concrete facade elements and motorhomes.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-252.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-251" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-251.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Empowering customers to innovate with the Ultramid® Advanced portfolio||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-251.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P251_Ultramid_Advanced_8863_3-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 4, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Empowering customers to innovate with the Ultramid® Advanced portfolio</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s engineering plastics of the Ultramid® family have a long and very successful history in metal replacement. The BASF polyamides (PA) have allowed lightweight and high-performance parts to be used in many different applications, from the automotive and the E&amp;E industries to mechanical engineering and consumer goods. In recent years, the challenges for plastic parts in these fields have increased drastically by trends such as further miniaturization of parts and systems, e-mobility and accelerated electronics, increased contact with chemicals and sophisticated flame-retardant systems - all leading to higher functional integration.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-251.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-250" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-250.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Ultradur® – one fits all ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-250.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/p250_pressefoto_1_ultradur_b6551_lni_extrusion:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 3, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ultradur® – one fits all </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On the occasion of this year’s K fair, BASF will launch and present its new product Ultradur® B6551 LNI for extrusion and the worldwide first thermoformable PBT Ultradur® B6560 M2 FC TF. An interdisciplinary team of chemists, physicists, and engineers developed the products from lab to reality.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-250.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-263" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-263.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s ultra-light polyurethane utility pole strengthens power grids and secures electricity supply after disasters||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/07/p-19-263.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P263-press_photo_Boldur_Utility_Pole_240-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 3, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s ultra-light polyurethane utility pole strengthens power grids and secures electricity supply after disasters</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Singapore – July 2, 2019 – Boldur™ utility poles can now help disaster-prone countries to strengthen their power grid and recover rapidly after disasters. Produced with Elastolit® polyurethane and with a unique filament winding technology, the robust, ultra-light Boldur utility poles can withstand the most severe weather conditions and maintain reliable electricity supply in disaster areas. Boldur is now being used by a major utility pole distributor in Japan.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" BASF is streamlining its administration, sharpening the roles of services and regions and simplifying procedures and processes. As a result, the company expects savings of €300 million, as part of the ongoing excellence program, which is anticipated to contribute €2 billion to earnings annually from the end of 2021 onwards.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-261.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-243" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-243.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||A commitment to actively shaping the future characterizes the Automotive Color Trends 2019-20 ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-243.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/BASF_ACT_2019-20_Overview_Collection:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 26, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">A commitment to actively shaping the future characterizes the Automotive Color Trends 2019-20 </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">ACT/9, the title of the Automotive Color Trends 2019-20, is a demand to shape the future with an active attitude. By analyzing technological trends and societal changes, the designers at BASF’s Coatings division translated this drive into a collection of future color inspirations for automotive surfaces. Four design studios from North America, Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific worked within this collaboration. The focus on these regions creates a profound understanding of the respective markets and its color drivers.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-243.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-244" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-244.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF enters sunflower seed market||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-244.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P244_basf_sunflower_2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 26, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF enters sunflower seed market</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany – Sunflower is an important and fast-growing crop sector, especially in Europe, the world’s largest sunflower market valued at €1.3 billion. To enter the sunflower seed market and complement its existing portfolio for sunflower, BASF has signed a distribution agreement with Euralis Semences. The goal is to evaluate and commercialize a pipeline of innovative sunflower hybrids, offering sunflower growers across the European region an even more comprehensive portfolio of agricultural solutions. The hybrid products will include BASF’s Clearfield® Plus technology, combining state-of-the-art genetics and crop protection. First market launches of sunflower hybrids are expected in 2020.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-244.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-259" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-259.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s plastic additive shields 5G base stations from UV light||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-259.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P259_5G_base_station:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 25, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s plastic additive shields 5G base stations from UV light</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hong Kong – June 25, 2019 – Shenzhen Xingshengdi New Materials Co., Ltd, a manufacturer of communication equipment, electronics and electrical appliances in China, has used BASF’s plastic additives to produce 5G base stations for major international telecommunications companies. With Tinuvin® 360, the outdoor 5G base stations can withstand weathering and degradation by intense sunlight, thus maintaining stable service with extended life span.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-259.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-258" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-258.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches Durasorb™ HG, a new product for mercury removal from Natural Gas ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-258.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P258_Better-capacity-and-kinetics:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 19, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches Durasorb™ HG, a new product for mercury removal from Natural Gas </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF continues to add new solutions to its portfolio for natural gas processing applications with the launch of Durasorb™ HG, a mercury removal adsorbent. Durasorb HG is a non-regenerable, mixed metal oxide adsorbent containing a dispersed and promoted copper sulfide phase.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-258.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-247" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-247.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and SIBUR collaborate to develop innovative polymer solutions||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-247.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P247_Signing_BASF_SIBUR:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and SIBUR collaborate to develop innovative polymer solutions</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Moscow, Russia, and Ludwigshafen, Germany, June 18, 2019 — SIBUR and BASF are collaborating to develop innovative polymer solutions at SIBUR’s PolyLab Research and Development Center located in Moscow, Russia. The signing ceremony of the Memorandum of Cooperation took place on May 30, 2019 at SIBUR’s newly inaugurated state-of-the-art PolyLab at the Skolkovo Innovation Center to seal the strong commitment from SIBUR and BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-247.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-249" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-249.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Lutianhua plan to pilot a new production process that significantly reduces CO2 emissions||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-249.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P249_BASF_Lutianhua_MoU_web:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Lutianhua plan to pilot a new production process that significantly reduces CO2 emissions</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Sichuan Lutianhua Co., Ltd. (Lutianhua) today signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to co-develop a pilot production plant, that will significantly reduce carbon emissions and increase energy efficiency in producing dimethyl ether (DME) from syngas compared to the traditional process. DME is a methanol equivalent and can be used as an intermediate to produce lower olefins like ethylene and propylene. Currently, DME is produced via methanol as an intermediate from syngas.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-249.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-245" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-245.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF recognized for its contribution to sustainable development||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-245.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P245_R-Me_Sense_PrixPierrePotier2019:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 17, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF recognized for its contribution to sustainable development</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s Coatings division was awarded the Pierre Potier prize medal in the Environmentally-friendly Process category for its R-M® eSense automotive paint line which covers all bodywork repairs. The ceremony was attended by Agnès Pannier-Runacher, French Secretary of State to the Minister of the Economy and Finance. The Pierre Potier prize honors chemical companies which innovate and constantly strive to improve their products and procedures in an effort to preserve the environment, and thus provide solutions to the challenge of the ecological transition. The Pierre Potier prize also encourages the development of eco-responsible approaches in the chemical sector.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a M1 is the highest category in terms of VOC (Volatile Organic Compounds) emissions in the Finnish “Emission Classification of Building Materials” classification system and is based on an analysis of VOC emissions. Moreover, the certification also implies an odor test, which requires that odor levels are neutral/acceptable. The M1 classification can only be achieved by products with extremely low emissions levels.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-237.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-238" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-238.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens global Agrochemical Application Research Center ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-238.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P238_AARC:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 5, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens global Agrochemical Application Research Center </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Research Triangle Park, North Carolina – BASF opened its new global Agrochemical Application Research Center (AARC) in Research Triangle Park, North Carolina, USA. The facility will help to further optimize stewardship guidelines regarding on-target application of BASF crop protection products used worldwide. Research conducted at the facility will also address application buffer zones for the company’s products as well as specific tank mix combinations.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-238.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-233" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-233.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s EcoSun Pass: eco-friendly sun protection||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-233.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 4, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s EcoSun Pass: eco-friendly sun protection</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Düsseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – June 4, 2019 – EcoSun Pass by BASF’s Care Creations® is a new methodology especially developed for sun protection products – evaluating the environmental compatibility of UV filter systems in sunscreens. The methodology supports the transparent assessment of UV filters based on internationally recognized criteria and comprises eight different parameters, from biodegradation and aquatic toxicity to endocrine disruption potential. It not only considers environmental factors for individual UV filters, but provides a comprehensive environmental evaluation of filter systems; as such, it marks a further milestone for BASF on the road to a sustainable future.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-233.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-234" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-234.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||360˚ sun care: more than just great sunscreen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-234.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 4, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">360˚ sun care: more than just great sunscreen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Düsseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – June 4, 2019 – BASF has launched a new microsite all about sun protection. Hosted by BASF’s Care Creations® team, the Global Technical Center Sun Care makes the company’s sun care expertise available to both customers and consumers. It explores UV filters, skin types, the light spectrum and solar radiation in more detail. This will extend BASF’s offerings, enabling new solutions to the industry, for example towards personalized products. The latest advanced technology will be introduced by siHealth to the technical community at the International Sun Protection Conference at the Royal College of General Practitioners in London, UK from By taking this step, the company has strengthened its position as the leading solution provider for sophisticated applications in the adhesives sector. BASF invested several tens of millions of euros to build the new facility; the additional capacity it offers is now available.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-230.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-231" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-231.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||CESIO 2019: BASF addresses customers’ needs with sustainable solutions and digital applications||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-231.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 3, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">CESIO 2019: BASF addresses customers’ needs with sustainable solutions and digital applications</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Munich, Germany – June 3, 2019 – At this year’s CESIO World Surfactant Congress taking place in Munich from June 3 to 5, BASF (booth 4) will be focusing on resource-friendly solutions and digital applications. “Sustainability and digitalization are key drivers for our customers and for BASF,” said Soeren Hildebrandt, Senior Vice President, Home Care, I&amp;I and Industrial Formulators Europe at BASF. “Our aim as a reliable partner is to support our customers in responding to these trends. We do that by investing in our production plants and capacities and by continuously exploring new uses for digital applications.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/06/p-19-231.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-05-31-BASF-YPC" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-05-31-BASF-YPC.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF-YPC starts up second production plant for propionic acid in Nanjing, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-05-31-BASF-YPC.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/p-19-05-31-PA_Expansion_Plant_BYC:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 31, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF-YPC starts up second production plant for propionic acid in Nanjing, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Nanjing, China – May 31, 2019 – BASF and SINOPEC today commenced production at the second propionic acid plant at the Verbund site, BASF-YPC Co., Ltd., a 50-50 joint venture in Nanjing, China. Commercial products are now available for sale to customers in China and the rest of Asia Pacific. The new plant has an annual production capacity of 30,000 metric tons of propionic acid. The total capacity of the two plants has thus been increased to 69,000 metric tons per year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-05-31-BASF-YPC.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-222" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-222.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Clean and safe water||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-222.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P222_Ultrason_Membrane-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 28, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Clean and safe water</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In order to ensure the production of clean and safe water throughout the whole water treatment system, the water treatment company Pentair, London, United Kingdom uses Ultrason® E 6020 P. With this high-performance polyethersulfone (PESU) by BASF, ultrafiltration (UF) membranes can be produced which are used for the purification and decontamination of drinking water. Pentair employs the high-purity PESU for a wide range of X-Flow water treatment applications covering the whole water distribution line from upstream to downstream, especially for at-the-source membranes in water distribution systems of public buildings as well as in point-of-use filters for infection control in hospitals. In contrast to other materials commonly used for UF membranes like polyvinylidene difluoride (PVDF), Ultrason® E shows the unique combination of a high flux of water and a narrow pore size distribution. This enables UF membranes which can reliably remove parasites, bacteria and even viruses to meet drinking water standards without the need to additionally super-chlorinate the drinking water after filtration.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-222.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-227" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-227.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF named a General Motors Supplier of the Year for 14th time||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-227.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/20190528_BASF_becomes_Supplier_of_the_Year-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 28, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF named a General Motors Supplier of the Year for 14th time</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF was named a 2018 General Motors (GM) Supplier of the Year for the fourteenth time since 2002. The award is presented to suppliers who distinguish themselves by meeting performance metrics for quality, execution, innovation, and total enterprise cost.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-227.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-228" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-228.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF light stabilizers protect oil spill barriers from degradation by intense sunlight||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-228.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P228_oil%20spill%20barrier-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 28, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF light stabilizers protect oil spill barriers from degradation by intense sunlight</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hong Kong – May 28, 2019 – Marine oil spill barriers, also known as oil containment booms, can last longer and keep oil spills under control even under intense sunlight, thanks to light stabilizers from BASF. Wonpoong Corporation in South Korea is now using BASF’s Tinuvin® range of plastic additives to increase the lifespan of oil containment booms, thereby reducing the maintenance costs and environmental impact.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-228.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-226" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-226.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in Longwater Advanced Materials Fund||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-226.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P226__Research_into_high-performance_battery_materials-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 27, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in Longwater Advanced Materials Fund</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China, and Ludwigshafen, Germany, May 27, 2019 – BASF Venture Capital is investing in the Longwater Advanced Materials Fund. This private equity fund is managed by Longwater Investment, a pioneer growth capital investor in advanced materials and chemistry-related technologies in China. BASF Venture Capital is one of several Limited Partners; other investors include Xiamen C &amp; D, CICC Genesis and Tsinghua Redbud.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-226.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-218" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-218.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF develops process for climate-friendly methanol||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-218.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P218_MS19_24_HTE-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 24, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF develops process for climate-friendly methanol</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The production processes of the most important basic chemicals are responsible for around 70 percent of the greenhouse gas emissions in the chemical industry. BASF experts are working intensely on new technologies to substantially reduce emissions in these processes. The company has bundled all of this work under the roof of its ambitious Carbon Management Program. One of the first visible successes in this area has been achieved by a project team which has applied to patent a process to produce methanol without any greenhouse gas emissions. If it can be successfully implemented at an industrial scale, the entire production process – from syngas production to pure methanol – will no longer release any carbon dioxide emissions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-218.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF improved supply of attapulgite-based additives to meet increasing demand in major markets </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, – May 22, 2019 – BASF has implemented process improvements to provide a reliable and stable supply of its attapulgite offerings. The enhancements at their site in Quincy, Florida include expanding of milling and product packaging capabilities for coarse gel, fine gel and granular materials, as well as improved logistics in shipping the mineral globally. This initiative is aligned with the increasing demand of attapulgite in BASF’s major markets around the world.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-223.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-224" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-224.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF collaborates with Rothamsted Research on sustainable agriculture||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-224.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P224_BASF_Rothamsted-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 22, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF collaborates with Rothamsted Research on sustainable agriculture</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany, and Harpenden, UK, May 22, 2019 – BASF and Rothamsted Research, one of the world’s oldest and most acclaimed agricultural research centers, are working together in a long-term collaboration to shape modern sustainable agriculture. The goal is to jointly address current agricultural challenges by identifying areas of R&amp;D where novel approaches to science can accelerate innovation. The first initiative, designed as a hands-on training program, is a Sustainability Challenge that enables early career scientists to discuss their ideas on the future of farming in a corporate environment. In addition, BASF and Rothamsted are launching PhD studentships focusing on soil management.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-224.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-212" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-212.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to build engineering plastics and thermoplastic polyurethanes plants at new Verbund site in Zhanjiang, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/05/p-19-212.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 21, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to build engineering plastics and thermoplastic polyurethanes plants at new Verbund site in Zhanjiang, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF plans to build an engineering plastics compounding plant and a thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU) plant at the company’s proposed integrated chemical production (“Verbund”) site in Zhanjiang, China.
