At the same time, the company strengthens its network of local expertise in marketing and sales in the region.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/02/p-19-134.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/02/p-19-123" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/02/p-19-123.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||50th anniversary of Ucrete: the world’s toughest floor since 1969 ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/02/p-19-123.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P123_50th_LinkedIn_facebook_18x34_GOLD_3_lines-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 4, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">50th anniversary of Ucrete: the world’s toughest floor since 1969 </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The world’s most resilient flooring from the Master Builders Solutions range is celebrating a major anniversary: 50 years ago, the Ucrete flooring solution was patented. Ucrete is based on a unique resin technology that provides these floors with exceptional resistance to aggressive chemicals, extreme mechanical impact, and thermal shock. Ucrete floors are particularly suitable for use in aggressive process areas as encountered in the food-and-beverage, chemical, and pharmaceutical industries, for example.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/02/p-19-123.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-111" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-111.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Solenis complete combination of their paper and water chemicals businesses||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-111.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 31, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Solenis complete combination of their paper and water chemicals businesses</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Wilmington, Delaware, USA, January 31, 2019 – Following the approval of all relevant authorities, BASF and Solenis have completed the transfer of BASF’s paper wet-end and water chemicals business to Solenis as announced in May 2018. Effective February 1, 2019, the combined business will operate under the Solenis name and offer increased sales, service and production capabilities across the globe. With pro forma sales of around €2.4 billion in 2017 and approximately 5,200 employees, the combined company is positioned to provide an expanded product portfolio and cost-effective solutions for paper and water treatment customers. BASF will hold a 49% share, 51% of the shares will be held by funds managed by Clayton, Dubilier &amp; Rice and the Solenis management.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-111.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-122" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-122.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Personnel Changes at BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-122.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 28, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Personnel Changes at BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Jeffrey Jianfeng Lou (50), Senior Vice President, Battery Materials, BASF (China) Company Ltd., Shanghai, will, as President, assume responsibility for the Division Advanced Materials &amp; Systems Research effective May 1, 2019. His predecessor Harald Lauke (60) will retire effective April 30, 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-122.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-124" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-124.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and B2B Cosmetics become partners to enable individualized personal care products||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-124.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/print_03_transparent:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 28, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and B2B Cosmetics become partners to enable individualized personal care products</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 28, 2019 – BASF and B2B Cosmetics today announced an exclusive, long-term strategic partnership in the field of personalized personal care products, including a strategic investment into B2B Cosmetics by BASF. The French company B2B Cosmetics will contribute a unique personalization system, marketed under the name Emuage technology. BASF will bring in expertise in personal care solutions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-124.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-126" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-126.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF is combining digitalization and IT expertise in a single division||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-126.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 28, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is combining digitalization and IT expertise in a single division</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Digitalization is a key element of BASF’s new corporate strategy. The company has been addressing this topic for many years with great success. Since 2015, cross-divisional teams have explored the opportunities for the intelligent use of data and digital technologies, tested them in pilot projects and rolled them out in the company. Work in research and development has also been supported by digital solutions, with the Quriosity supercomputer being a main driver in this area. In order to pool all these activities and bring the experts from digitalization and IT closer together, BASF established the new Digitalization &amp; Information Services functional division on January 1, 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-126.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-115" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-115.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF partners with Pantone® Color Institute to create a shade collection inspired by PANTONE 16-1546 Living Coral, Color of the Year 2019 ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-115.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 24, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF partners with Pantone® Color Institute to create a shade collection inspired by PANTONE 16-1546 Living Coral, Color of the Year 2019 </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In a continued collaboration with the Pantone Color Institute, BASF has created a collection of plastic designs inspired by the Pantone® Color of the Year 2019, PANTONE 16-1546, Living Coral. With an annual capacity of 42,000 tons, the plant will produce antioxidants and associated forms and blends for the plastic additives market. The units for powder blending, liquid antioxidants and formgiving are now operational as part of the plant’s first phase.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-117.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-119" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-119.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) Resource Center, offering Building Information Modeling (BIM) content and other digital services for the construction industry||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-119.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 23, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) Resource Center, offering Building Information Modeling (BIM) content and other digital services for the construction industry</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Mannheim, Germany / Las Vegas, NV, January 23, 2019 – BASF has launched its Global Virtual Design and Construction Resource Center which offers BIM digital content as well as digital construction tools to support product selection, specification and use. The VDC Resource Center brings together a global network of construction experts with architectural, engineering and contracting backgrounds who can support customers, planners and architects with consultation and access to the entire construction chemicals portfolio of BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-119.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-121" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-121.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF recognized as global leader in corporate climate action and water security||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-121.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 23, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF recognized as global leader in corporate climate action and water security</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The international organization CDP (formerly the Carbon Disclosure Project) has awarded BASF a top A rating in the 2018 Climate Change List. Each year, more than 7,000 companies disclose the environmental impacts, risks and opportunities associated with their business activities to CDP for an independent assessment. CDP represents more than 650 investors with over $87 trillion in assets and 115 major purchasing organizations with $3.3 trillion in purchasing power. BASF has participated in CDP’s program for reporting on data relevant to climate protection since 2004.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-121.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-113" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-113.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||EU Commission clears BASF’s acquisition of Solvay’s polyamide business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-113.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 18, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">EU Commission clears BASF’s acquisition of Solvay’s polyamide business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Today, the EU Commission has granted conditional clearance for BASF to acquire Solvay’s polyamide business. This would be BASF’s largest investment in India to date. The designated site would be located at Mundra port in Gujarat, India. A feasibility study will be completed by the end of 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-116.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-109" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-109.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF co-founds global Alliance to End Plastic Waste||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-109.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 16, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF co-founds global Alliance to End Plastic Waste</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF today co-founded a global alliance of nearly 30 companies to advance solutions that reduce and eliminate plastic waste in the environment, especially in the ocean. The Alliance to End Plastic Waste (AEPW) has committed over $1.0 billion with the goal of investing $1.5 billion over the next five years to help end plastic waste in the environment. New solutions will be developed and brought to scale that will minimize and manage plastic waste. This also includes the promotion of solutions for used plastics by helping to enable a circular economy.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-109.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-110" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-110.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF increases production capacity of antioxidants for lubricants ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-110.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P110_L_67_facility_RuDong_2:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 15, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF increases production capacity of antioxidants for lubricants </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Florham Park, USA, Ludwigshafen, Germany, January 15 – BASF’s global business unit Fuel and Lubricant Solutions is investing in Mexico and China to increase production of antioxidants for lubricants. ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cosmet’Agora 2019: BASF leads the way with new approach for skin care formulations and eco-friendly ingredient solutions </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Paris, France – January 15, 2018 – At this year’s Cosmet’Agora from January 15 to 16 in Paris, BASF’s Care Creations™ will present the latest ingredient solutions for the personal care industry as well as its new concept “Innovative Skincare Journey” at booths 134-137-138. With this concept, BASF offers its customers a new approach to skin care formulations, using an innovative process that allows to create efficient high-quality products in a faster, easier and more transparent way. “The personal care market has become increasingly complex, evolving at an ever-faster pace. We support our customers in developing winning products that provide all the transparency consumers wish for,” said Marine Belthé, Marketing Manager at BASF Personal Care Europe.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-114" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-114.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s new active ingredients target skin conditions’ root causes||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-114.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 15, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s new active ingredients target skin conditions’ root causes</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Paris, France – January 15, 2019 – Every day, our skin is exposed to harmful environmental influences and the negative effects of our fast-paced lifestyles. Oily skin, pigment spots, fine lines and wrinkles, or dry skin with itching and tingling sensations are common consequences. During Cosmet’Agora from January 15 to 16 in Paris, BASF’s Care Creations™ will present several new active ingredients that were derived from the research activities of the company’s innovation platforms on epigenetics, microbiome and extraction, addressing the dermatological roots of these skin conditions and helping manufacturers meet end-consumers’ needs.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-114.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-108" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-108.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to bundle development and marketing activities in the field of asphalt in one central hub||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-108.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 11, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to bundle development and marketing activities in the field of asphalt in one central hub</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Material-saving, resilient, long-lasting and easy to repair – the list of requirements to be met by the roads and streets of tomorrow is long. Hence, great future challenges lie ahead of road construction companies. In order to offer comprehensive solutions for the production of asphalt and bitumen, BASF combines, from now on, the development and marketing activities in the EMEA region in one central hub.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-108.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-103" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-103.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Innovations for a climate-friendly chemical production||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-103.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/p103_7ap3599_la_quer:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 10, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Innovations for a climate-friendly chemical production</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – January 10, 2019 – Climate protection is firmly embedded in BASF’s new corporate strategy. A central goal of this strategy is to achieve CO2-neutral growth until 2030. To accomplish this, BASF is continuously optimizing existing processes, gradually replacing fossil fuels with renewable energy sources and developing radically new low-emission production processes. The company is bundling all of this work in an ambitious Carbon Management program. Today, BASF presents the latest research findings on these new processes as well as innovative, climate-friendly products at its Research Press Conference in Ludwigshafen.</div><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is presenting its high-performance insulation materials in a new application at the world’s flagship fair for architecture, materials and systems in Munich from January 14 to 19, 2019. The innovative high-performance products SLENTITE® and SLENTEX® are a new generation of super-slim aerogel-based insulation materials with outstanding material properties. BASF is presenting its first examples of applications in carbon concrete composite facade elements in a single-family house.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-104.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-106" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-106.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF analyzes the 2018 automotive color distribution||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-106.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF analyzes the 2018 automotive color distribution</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With the “BASF Color Report for Automotive OEM Coatings”, BASF’s Coatings division provides a global analysis of the color distribution in the 2018 automotive market. The achromatic colors – white, black, gray and silver – still dominate the roads. They cover almost 80% of cars produced worldwide. White is the most popular color among them. More than every fourth car in North America and nearly every third vehicle in Europe is painted white, while in Asia Pacific it is more than every second car. Silver’s popularity decreased slightly in comparison to the previous year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-106.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-107" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-107.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Guangdong Provincial Government sign Framework Agreement to establish Verbund site in Zhanjiang, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2019/01/p-19-107.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 9, 2019</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Guangdong Provincial Government sign Framework Agreement to establish Verbund site in Zhanjiang, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Zhanjiang, China – January 9, 2019 – Today, Martin Brudermüller, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors, BASF SE, and Lin Shaochun, Vice Governor of Guangdong Province, signed a Framework Agreement in Ludwigshafen setting out further details of BASF’s plan to establish a new smart Verbund site in Guangdong, China. Following the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding in July 2018, BASF has selected the city of Zhanjiang as the location for its second Verbund site in China.</div><div With the investment the company further strengthens its position as the leading global producer of MSA. The volumes from the additional capacity are expected to be available late in 2021 for customers in all regions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-409.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-411" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-411.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in new mobile emissions catalysts production facility in Shanghai to meet customer demand in China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-411.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 19, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in new mobile emissions catalysts production facility in Shanghai to meet customer demand in China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China, December 20, 2018 – BASF is investing in a new production facility for mobile emissions catalysts at its Pudong site in Shanghai, China. The new 30,000-square-meter facility will house multiple manufacturing lines, providing a full range of emissions control technologies for heavy-duty and light-duty vehicle manufacturers. Construction is underway, with start-up planned for the end of 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-411.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-385" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-385.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF for the first time makes products with chemically recycled plastics ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-385.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 13, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF for the first time makes products with chemically recycled plastics </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is breaking new ground in plastic waste recycling with its ChemCycling project. Chemical recycling provides an innovative way to reutilize plastic waste that is currently not recycled, such as mixed or uncleaned plastics. Depending on the region, such waste is usually sent to landfill or burned with energy recovery. But chemical recycling offers another alternative: Using thermochemical processes, these plastics can be utilized to produce syngas or oils. The resulting recycled raw materials can be used as inputs in BASF’s production, thereby partially replacing fossil resources.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-385.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-405" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-405.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands its production network for certified palm products||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-405.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 13, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands its production network for certified palm products</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Pulnoy, France – December 13, 2018 – BASF further strengthens its operations network for certified palm-based products: the company now manufactures certified ingredients at 22 locations around the world for the cosmetics, detergent and cleaning agent industries. The latest site to receive the Supply Chain Certificate of the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) has been Pulnoy in France where BASF produces active ingredients for the cosmetics industry.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-405.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-406" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-406.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New responsibilities on the BASF Board of Executive Directors  as of January 1, 2019||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-406.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 13, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New responsibilities on the BASF Board of Executive Directors  as of January 1, 2019</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 13, 2018 – As of January 1, 2019, BASF will have six segments instead of four. With this new segment structure, BASF will create greater transparency regarding the management of its business activities, the importance of value chains and the role of the Verbund. Together with this organizational change, the responsibilities of the Board of Executive Directors have been reallocated.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-406.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-408" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-408.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Supervisory Board of BASF nominates its candidates for new election in May 2019||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-408.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P408_Teaser_Carell_Foto:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; The regular election will take place at the ordinary Annual Shareholders’ Meeting of BASF SE on May 3, 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a Up to 12 dynamic Venture Teams have up to 24 months to bring their innovative and chemistry related business ideas to the market. Since August 2018, all BASF employees with ambition to explore entrepreneurship find a new home in the Industriestraße 35 in Mannheim. The Chemovator complements the existing innovation landscape of BASF and grants access to new business segments and growth.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-401.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-399" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-399.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Group: Adjustment of outlook for the fiscal year 2018||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-399.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 7, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Group: Adjustment of outlook for the fiscal year 2018</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – December 7, 2018 – Based on the earnings data for November 2018, BASF now expects a considerable decrease in income from operations (EBIT) before special items for the fiscal year 2018 in the range of 15% to 20% compared with the prior year (EBIT before special items in 2017: €7,645 million). BASF previously forecast a slight decline of up to 10% compared with the prior-year figure. For EBIT of the BASF Group, the company continues to expect a considerable decline and for sales, a slight increase of up to 5%.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-399.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-398" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-398.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and VanderSat collaborate to provide  farmers with high-precision, field-specific crop optimization ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-398.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 6, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and VanderSat collaborate to provide  farmers with high-precision, field-specific crop optimization </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Haarlem, the Netherlands, December 6, 2018 – BASF and the Dutch Earth observation company VanderSat are collaborating to support farmers worldwide with even more precise, satellite data-based recommendations on application of crop inputs. VanderSat’s satellite data uses high-precision microwave technology to measure soil moisture and surface temperatures in individual field zones. The technology will be an additional data source for BASF’s xarvio™ Field Manager, a commercial product that for example calculates the risk of disease on a field-by-field basis, providing farmers with individually tailored application maps and optimized timing for crop protection measures.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF starts production of its fungicide innovation Revysol® </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hannibal, Missouri – December 5, 2018 – BASF has started production of its latest fungicide innovation Revysol® at its site in Hannibal. With this new active ingredient, BASF will provide farmers worldwide with a new tool to ensure healthy, disease-free crops for a longer period of time and will strengthen its leading position in fungicides. Revysol is the first fungicide to be produced at the site in Hannibal. Pending regulatory approval, first market introductions are expected for the 2019/2020 season.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-396" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-396.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||European Coatings Show 2019: BASF to present new solutions covering the needs of customers||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-396.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 5, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">European Coatings Show 2019: BASF to present new solutions covering the needs of customers</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At the 2019 European Coatings Show (ECS), which is going to take place in Nuremberg from March 19 to 21, BASF experts and specialists from BTC, the European distribution organization of BASF, will present new raw materials for the coatings, paint and construction industries at booth 523 in hall 7A. The broad range of products offered by BASF includes dispersions, resins, additives, light stabilizers, antioxidants, pigments, hardeners, cross-linking agents, reactive diluents and solvents.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/12/p-18-396.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-388" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-388.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF will have to stop TDI production in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-388.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 26, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will have to stop TDI production in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The water level of river Rhine is currently on an all-time low, impacting transport by ship. Despite maximum shift to alternative means of transport (pipeline, trucks and rail), not all raw materials can be supplied to BASF’s Ludwigshafen site. Therefore, BASF will have to stop the TDI production in Ludwigshafen.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-388.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-WH-181126" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-WH-181126.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Wintershall acquires stake in the largest gas and condensate fields yet to be developed in the United Arab Emirates||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-WH-181126.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/181123-COM-Concession_ME:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 26, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Wintershall acquires stake in the largest gas and condensate fields yet to be developed in the United Arab Emirates</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Abu Dhabi. Wintershall will invest in one of the world’s most important centers for oil and gas production: The company will take a ten percent stake in the Ghasha Concession alongside the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) in the United Arab Emirates. The Hail, Ghasha, Dalma and other ultra-sour gas and condensate fields such as Nasr, SARB and Mubarraz are located in the Al Dhafra region off the coast of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-WH-181126.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-380" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-380.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces innovative Cavipor® insulation material for existing buildings||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-380.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 22, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces innovative Cavipor® insulation material for existing buildings</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cavipor® FTX 1 combines the advantages of a mineral-based insulation material with the simple, safe and clean processing of a foam system. With a rated value of thermal conductivity of 0,035 W/(m*K) its insulation effects are comparable to mineral wool and EPS. Cavipor’s properties make it thus particularly suitable for the energy renovation of buildings constructed from double-wall masonry. This kind of construction is often found in Northern Europe, usually where houses are made of brick. “In Germany alone, we are looking at potentially more than one million suitable buildings to be energetically renovated,” says Frank Reuter, who is responsible for the market introduction of the new product.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-380.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-386" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-386.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||“Digital challenges”: BASF is looking for start-ups for joint projects||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-386.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 22, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“Digital challenges”: BASF is looking for start-ups for joint projects</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is breaking new ground in the field of digitalization. The opportunities are enormous. For example, digital products and services can increase the effectiveness and efficiency of processes and create additional value for customers. At the same time, however, digital change also raises completely new questions and challenges. BASF is looking for start-ups from all over the world to tackle and solve these challenges together.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-386.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-383" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-383.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Master Builders Solutions® launches digital solution-finder for the construction industry ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P383_Solunaut_211118:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 21, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® launches digital solution-finder for the construction industry </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With Solunaut, Master Builders Solutions® by BASF has developed an online solution-finder for the construction industry. The solution-finder provides users with the means to explore and find relevant solutions and products for construction projects in the food-and-beverage, chemical, and wastewater-engineering industries. The information is sorted for each industry and according to various areas of application, making it quick and easy to find the right solution. Solunaut is available in local languages in five European countries, as well as in English.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-374" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-374.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF’s new strategy aims for both profitable and  CO2-neutral growth ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 20, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s new strategy aims for both profitable and  CO2-neutral growth </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“With our new strategy, we are setting BASF on a course for growth,” said Dr. Martin Brudermüller at the presentation of BASF’s new strategy in Ludwigshafen. The Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors highlighted the positive developments in recent years: “Since 2012, our income from operations before depreciation, amortization and special items has grown on average by 8% per year, considerably faster than the 3% increase in fixed costs per year.” BASF’s earnings growth thus also outpaced the 3.7% annual increase in global chemical production. Moreover, there was strong development in free cash flow in recent years and a high return on capital employed (ROCE), most recently 15.4%. Above all, the new strategy aims to grow sales and volumes.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-382" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-382.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and GAC R&amp;D Center co-develop concept cars for future mobility  ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-382.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P382_GAC_concept_cars-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 19, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and GAC R&amp;D Center co-develop concept cars for future mobility  </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Guangzhou, China – November 17, 2018 – BASF and the Research and Development Center of Guangzhou Automobile Group Co. BMW Group said BASF achieved the best performance in CO2 emissions in the report published by the non-governmental organization CDP. BASF’s anchoring of the fight against climate change within the company were cited as another reason for the decision.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-387.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-389" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-389.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces Valor™ fluid catalytic cracking (FCC) catalyst technology to enhance FCC catalyst performance ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-389.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 15, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces Valor™ fluid catalytic cracking (FCC) catalyst technology to enhance FCC catalyst performance </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announces the launch of Valor™, a next generation Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) catalyst technology designed to enhance the performance of FCC catalysts processing heavy residuum (resid) oil feedstock. Valor™ is BASF’s latest innovation in metals passivation. It leads to superior catalyst activity maintenance and enables refinery profit maximization and increased sustainability of operations through higher and prolonged catalyst efficacy.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-389.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-379" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-379.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces new generation of Sunscreen Simulator||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-379.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 14, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces new generation of Sunscreen Simulator</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Monheim, Germany, November 14, 2018 – BASF has revised the Sunscreen Simulator, the digital lab for sun-care formulations, to make it more user-friendly and versatile. The Internet-based solution, which enables formulators to explore the performance of sunscreens under development before starting costly in-vitro and in-vivo studies, now features immediate dynamic calculations and side-by-side comparison of multiple formulations, among other enhancements. BASF’s Sunscreen Simulator supports sunscreen manufacturers all over the world in reducing their products’ time to market.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-379.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-381" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-381.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF, Materialise and Essentium join forces to advance industrial additive manufacturing||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-381.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 14, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF, Materialise and Essentium join forces to advance industrial additive manufacturing</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Germany, Leuven/Belgium, College Station/Texas, USA November 14th, 2018. BASF Venture Capital is leading the Series A investment round in Essentium, Inc., an innovative developer of disruptive, industrial additive manufacturing solutions headquartered in College Station, Texas. Materialise is one of the co-investors in the Series A investment round in Essentium, Inc. BASF and Essentium have been working together on advanced fused filament fabrication (FFF) solutions using Essentium’s proprietary FlashFuseTM technology for high mechanical strength in the build direction for extrusion printed parts. The two companies are now extending their strategic partnership to establish a consistent global materials supply chain supportive of Essentium’s new High Speed Extrusion (HSE) additive manufacturing platform. Essentium and BASF welcome Materialise to enter this strategic partnership to develop 3D printing software for the Essentium technology. This will allow users to take advantage of the speed of the HSE technology while having immediate access to the full Materialise software capabilities for professional 3D printing. The three companies combine their complementary strengths to jointly advance 3D printing technology and customer value to enable industrial additive manufacturing.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-381.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-373" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-373.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice: Strategy Press Conference on November 20, 2018, at 10:00 a.m.||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/Fahnen_A16_0008_20171:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Business &amp; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 13, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice: Strategy Press Conference on November 20, 2018, at 10:00 a.m.</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">We will publish BASF’s new strategy on November 20, 2018. new solutions for the personal care market</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Conventry, United Kingdom, November 13 – At SCS Formulate on November 13th and 14th in Coventry, BASF will share stand 500 with its European distribution organization BTC Europe and present the latest solutions to meet the demands of the personal care market.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-378.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-370" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-370.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF produces methanol according to the biomass balance approach||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-370.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 12, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF produces methanol according to the biomass balance approach</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – November 12, 2018 – BASF has started production of methanol on the basis of renewable raw materials according to the biomass balance approach. The product name is EU-REDcert-methanol. The company replaces fossil raw materials with second-generation renewable raw materials and uses waste as well as residual materials. As a result, BASF reduces emissions of climate-damaging greenhouse gases by at least 50 percent compared with conventionally produced methanol. In terms of its chemical and physical characteristics, biomass balanced methanol is identical to methanol produced from fossil resources. BASF markets the EU-REDcert-methanol to customers and also uses it itself as an intermediate for other biomass balanced products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-370.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-377" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-377.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF 3D Printing Solutions presents new products at formnext and announces pioneering strategic alliances for industrial 3D printing ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 12, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF 3D Printing Solutions presents new products at formnext and announces pioneering strategic alliances for industrial 3D printing </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New products for photopolymer and laser sinter printing methods from BASF 3D Printing Solutions GmbH (B3DPS) are on show from November 13 to 16 at Stand F20 in Hall 3.1 at this year’s formnext fair in Frankfurt. The BASF subsidiary is also announcing several new partnerships for the development and distribution of groundbreaking 3D printing solutions and products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-362" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-362.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Master Builders Solutions® at Architect@Work events||/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-362.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P362_A_at_W:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><span class="news-result__category" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Trade News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 8, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® at Architect@Work events</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® will attend two upcoming Architect@Work events in Germany: A@W Berlin on November 7-8 at Station Berlin, booth #145; Financial News</span><span data-v-5db4dc0c=""> | </span><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 8, 2018</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens global state-of-the-art breeding center for   cucumbers in Nunhem</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Nunhem, the Netherlands, November 8, 2018 – BASF has opened a new state-of-the-art breeding center for cucumbers at its site in Nunhem. At around 50 million Euro, it is the largest investment in the hundred-year history of the Nunhem vegetable seeds business. The 2.5 hectare greenhouse complex with a 17,000 m2 technical and office facility will increase BASF’s capabilities to meet the needs of consumers and the global food value chain with novel vegetable varieties.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2018/11/p-18-366.html" class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® sets a new benchmark in the workability of PCC mortars: MasterEmaco S 5500</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With MasterEmaco S 5500, Master Builders Solutions® by BASF has developed a repair mortar with superior workability as well as excellent non-sag and bonding properties for use in refurbishment work on floors, walls, and ceilings. The new low-shrinkage PCC (Polymer Cement Concrete) repair mortar provides bonding bridge and mortar in a single product.
