data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Change in leadership: BASF decides on succession</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 21, 2017 – Effective at the end of the Annual Shareholders’ Meeting on May 4, 2018, Dr. Martin Brudermüller (56), currently Vice Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors, will become Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE. The Supervisory Board appointed Brudermüller in its meeting today. Brudermüller will succeed Dr. Kurt Bock (59), who is BASF’s Chairman since 2011 and has been a member of the Board of Executive Directors since 2003. This change will allow Bock to be elected as a member and chair of BASF’s Supervisory Board in 2020 after the end of the statutory two-years cooling-off period.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-401.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-402" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-402.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New responsibilities on BASF’s Board of Executive Directors effective May 2018||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-402.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New responsibilities on BASF’s Board of Executive Directors effective May 2018</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 21, 2017 – Effective as of the end of the Annual Shareholders’ Meeting on May 4, 2018, Dr. Martin Brudermüller (56), currently Vice Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors, will become Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE. The Supervisory Board appointed Brudermüller in its meeting today. Brudermüller will succeed Dr. Kurt Bock (59), who is BASF’s Chairman since 2011 and has been a member of the Board of Executive Directors since 2003. This change will allow Bock to be elected as a member and chair of BASF’s Supervisory Board in 2020 after the end of the statutory two-year cooling-off period.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-402.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-400" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-400.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and SINOPEC expand production capacity for Neopentylglycol in Nanjing, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-400.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 20, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and SINOPEC expand production capacity for Neopentylglycol in Nanjing, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Nanjing, China – December 20, 2017 – BASF and SINOPEC will expand the production capacity of Neopentylglycol (NPG) at the state-of-the-art Verbund site, BASF-YPC Co., Ltd., a 50-50 joint venture in Nanjing, China. The plant was established in 2015 with an annual capacity of 40,000 metric tons. Following the expansion, the annual capacity will be doubled to 80,000 metric tons. The expanded capacity will come on stream in 2020.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-400.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-WH-171218" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-WH-171218.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Early start for Wintershall’s Maria field: production begins one year ahead of schedule||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-WH-171218.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 18, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Early start for Wintershall’s Maria field: production begins one year ahead of schedule</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Stavanger/Kassel. Wintershall, and its licence partners Petoro and Spirit Energy, have started production at the Maria field one year ahead of schedule. Costs have been reduced by more than 20% compared to plan. Oil production has now begun, whereas originally start-up was intended for the fourth quarter of 2018.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-WH-171218.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-393" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-393.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and TODA further strengthen their collaboration and increase investments in Cathode Materials to enable e-mobility ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 14, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and TODA further strengthen their collaboration and increase investments in Cathode Materials to enable e-mobility </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Germany and Tokyo/Japan, December 14, 2017 – BASF and TODA KOGYO CORP. (TODA) announced two significant steps to further enhance their collaboration. A strengthening of production capabilities both in the United States and Japan will help enable e-mobility and generate business opportunities for the two companies.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-391" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-391.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Conserving resources with EPS food packaging||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-391.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 13, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Conserving resources with EPS food packaging</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s customer Schaumaplast GmbH &amp; Co.KG is now offering packaging made from biomass-balanced Styropor®. The Styropor MB used is the first EPS to be produced using BASF’s biomass balance approach. Following special balancing, the certified method can be used to replace the fossil resources needed to manufacture Styropor entirely with renewable resources right at the start of the production process.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-391.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-397" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-397.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens its first automotive coatings production plant in Thailand||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-397.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 13, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens its first automotive coatings production plant in Thailand</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Bangkok, Thailand – December 13, 2017 – BASF’s Coatings division today inaugurated a new automotive coatings plant at its Bangpoo manufacturing site, Samutprakarn province, Thailand. The new plant is the first BASF automotive coatings manufacturing facility in ASEAN, and will produce solventborne and waterborne automotive coatings to meet growing market demand in the region.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-397.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-358" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-358.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to expand mobile emissions catalysts site in Ṥroda Ṥląska, Poland ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 11, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to expand mobile emissions catalysts site in Ṥroda Ṥląska, Poland </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in the expansion of its mobile emissions catalysts production site in Ṥroda Ṥląska, Poland. The expansion includes new production lines and additional infrastructure to equip light duty diesel and gasoline vehicles with BASF’s innovative catalyst and filter solutions. The investment will increase the existing production site by approximately 14,000 square meters – adding more than 50% to the current production area and creating new jobs within the Lower Silesian region.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-396" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-396.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens new automotive coatings plant in Shanghai||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-396.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 11, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens new automotive coatings plant in Shanghai</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany / Hong Kong / Shanghai, China – December 11, 2017 – BASF’s Coatings division today inaugurated a new, world-scale automotive coatings plant at the Shanghai Chemical Industry Park (SCIP) in Caojing, Shanghai, China. The €140 million project is an extension of the existing automotive coatings plant, a joint venture between BASF and Shanghai Huayi Fine Chemical Co., Ltd. This expansion will further enhance the company’s local production and better serve the growing automotive market in China and Asia Pacific.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-396.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-390" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-390.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Mitsui Chemicals Agro, Inc. (MCAG) and BASF sign commercialization agreement for new insecticide with IRAC novel mode of action||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-390.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 7, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Mitsui Chemicals Agro, Inc. (MCAG) and BASF sign commercialization agreement for new insecticide with IRAC novel mode of action</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Tokyo, Japan, and Limburgerhof, Germany, December 7, 2017 - Mitsui Chemicals Agro, Inc. (MCAG) and BASF SE announced today the signing of a long-term agreement for the commercialization of Broflanilide, a new insecticide for chewing crop pests and non-crop pests control. This commercialization agreement follows the exclusive global license and development agreement between the two companies that was announced on June 11, 2014.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-390.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-395" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-395.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and LetterOne sign letter of intent to merge their oil and gas subsidiaries Wintershall and DEA||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 7, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and LetterOne sign letter of intent to merge their oil and gas subsidiaries Wintershall and DEA</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 7, 2017 – BASF and LetterOne signed a letter of intent today to merge their respective oil and gas businesses in a joint venture, which would operate under the name Wintershall DEA. The oil and gas business of BASF is bundled in the Wintershall Group consisting of Wintershall Holding GmbH and its subsidiaries, including the gas transportation business. The oil and gas business of LetterOne comprises DEA Deutsche Erdöl AG and its subsidiaries. By combining these two German-based entities, their parent companies strive to create a basis for further profitable growth, optimize the portfolio footprint of the combined business and realize synergies. Wintershall DEA would have significant growth potential and be one of the largest independent European exploration and production companies. In the medium term, BASF and LetterOne envisage to list Wintershall DEA through an initial public offering.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-374" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-374.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in smart supply chain start-up Ahrma||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 6, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in smart supply chain start-up Ahrma</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, December 6, 2017 – The digital economy is forecasted to account for 25% of the global economy by 2025 with an estimated $100 trillion of value generated over the next decade. Recognizing the potential to strengthen its long-term competitiveness, BASF embarked on a digital transformation journey in 2015. The company now enters a strategic partnership with Dutch start-up company Ahrma Holding B.V. to jointly approach the growing market for smart logistic solutions. With an investment of €5 million in Ahrma shares, BASF is taking an important step towards a more transparent, reliable and efficient supply chain ecosystem.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-375" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-375.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Stefan Beck is new CIO of BASF, Wiebe van der Horst leads project to implement new IT architecture ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/12/p-17-375.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 6, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Stefan Beck is new CIO of BASF, Wiebe van der Horst leads project to implement new IT architecture </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 6, 2017 – Stefan Beck is the new Senior Vice President, Global Process / Enterprise Architecture &amp; Region Europe, at BASF and the new Chief Information Officer (CIO). He succeeds Wiebe van der Horst who has been leading the “New Generation Business Architecture” project since October 1, 2017. November 24, 2017 – BASF is in discussions regarding a potential merger of BASF Group’s oil and gas activities with Letter One’s oil and gas activities bundled in the DEA Group. BASF would hold the majority of the shares in the joint enterprise. An Initial Public Offering (IPO) of the joint enterprise would be an option in the medium term. With the opening of BELGEE’s new automotive production plant in Belarus on November 17/18, the cooperation between BASF and the Chinese-Belarusian joint venture has reached another milestone. At the plant near Minsk, Belarus, SUVs for the Russian, Belarusian, Ukrainian and Kazakh market will be produced. BASF’s Coatings division supplies the respective coatings products for the car body as well as for the plastic parts. BASF is single supplier for all coatings layers – comprising e-coat, primer, basecoat and clearcoat. “We are proud that we won BELGEE as new customer for our comprehensive layer portfolio and that we can further strengthen our position on the Eastern European market”, explained Monika Pander, Account Manager New Business Development, Automotive OEM Coatings, at BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-373" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-373.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF brings multiple-award-winning magazine “Corpus – Constructing Tomorrow” onto the Web||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 20, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF brings multiple-award-winning magazine “Corpus – Constructing Tomorrow” onto the Web</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has launched CORPUS, the magazine devoted to architecture, infrastructure and high-performance construction materials, in a new version for the Internet. Over the past two years, six issues of the title have been published in an app format for tablets and smartphones, receiving two prestigious awards during this period.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-372" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-372.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF presents its InkSet 2000SL and a new demonstrator at Printed Electronics USA||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-372.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 15, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF presents its InkSet 2000SL and a new demonstrator at Printed Electronics USA</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – November 15, 2017 – BASF New Business is exhibiting together with InnovationLab at Printed Electronics USA in Santa Clara, CA, November 15-16. Part of the IDTechEx Show!, Printed Electronics is one of the most important exhibitions in the USA for the printed electronics industry. BASF’s Printed Electronics Team is presenting ready-to-use inks and ink sets for printing organic thin film transistors (OTFTs) for various applications, as well as real-life and mass-producible demonstrators built in collaboration with InnovationLab, a platform for research and knowledge transfer in the field of printed electronics.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-372.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-369" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-369.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||SCS Formulate 2017: BASF showcases advanced solutions for the cosmetics industry||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-369.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 14, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">SCS Formulate 2017: BASF showcases advanced solutions for the cosmetics industry</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Coventry, UK – November 14, 2017. BASF will share booth 400 with its European sales company, BTC Europe.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-369.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-371" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-371.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||From coast to coast, BASF’s Basotect is making rail seating lighter and safer||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-371.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 14, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">From coast to coast, BASF’s Basotect is making rail seating lighter and safer</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s open cell melamine foam Basotect® has replaced alternative materials in the seat back cushions of multiple rail car programs on both coasts of the United States. The improved seating can be experienced in the rapid public transportation system serving the San Francisco Bay Area along with the commuter rail system serving Long Island in New York. These new cushion configurations are provided by Rogers Corporation, a global foam manufacturer and converter with their headquarters located in the United States, under their trademark of BISCO® MRF-400.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-371.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-359" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-359.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces Fortress™ NXT FCC catalyst to help refiners increase liquid product yields with heavy resid feeds||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-359.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 13, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces Fortress™ NXT FCC catalyst to help refiners increase liquid product yields with heavy resid feeds</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announced today the launch of Fortress™ NXT, the next generation of the industry-leading Fortress Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) catalyst for heavy residuum (resid) oil feedstock applications for the refining market. Fortress NXT has been optimized to deliver superior metals passivation and activity maintenance, while keeping hydrogen and coke production low. For refineries, this creates the opportunity for profit maximization.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-359.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-367" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-367.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF declares Force Majeure for Vitamin A and E and several Carotenoids||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-367.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF declares Force Majeure for Vitamin A and E and several Carotenoids</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, November 10, 2017 – On October 31, a fire occurred during the startup of the Citral plant in Ludwigshafen. MasterEase reduces the viscosity of the concrete, making it less sticky and therefore easier to pump and apply. This is a significant advantage for sprayed concrete applications. MasterEase UG 3904 increases the workability time and, when applied, the concrete hardens more evenly on the tunnel wall.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-362.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-365" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-365.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in innovative functional chemical company, NBD Nanotechnologies||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-365.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 7, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in innovative functional chemical company, NBD Nanotechnologies</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen and Boston, November 7, 2017 – BASF Venture Capital (BASF) is leading an $8 million Series B financing round in the U.S. functional chemistry firm, NBD Nanotechnologies (NBD Nano). data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-298" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-298.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces new sulphuric acid catalyst ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-298.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 6, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces new sulphuric acid catalyst </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has introduced the new sulphuric acid catalyst O4 115 Quattro into the market. The new, cesium-based catalyst is unique due to its geometrical shape – a combination of four strands – leading to a 30 percent greater catalytic surface area compared to conventional sulphuric acid catalysts. For sulphuric acid producers, this translates into higher conversion in the catalyst bed, reduction of SO2 emissions, and improved performance in plants with limited catalyst volumes. Additionally, the O4-115 Quattro features enhanced physical and mechanical properties. Due to its improved catalyst hardness, which is reflected in a lower sieving loss, this new catalyst offers long-term stability and cost-efficient operation.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/11/p-17-298.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-356" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-356.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||North American Center for Research on Advanced Materials to continue for another five years||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-356.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 30, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">North American Center for Research on Advanced Materials to continue for another five years</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Florham Park, NJ, October 30, 2017 – At a conference marking the five-year anniversary of the North American Center for Research on Advanced Materials (NORA), the center’s members convened to discuss the outcomes of the research alliance to date as well as future areas of focus, including bioscience and catalysis research, digitalization and working with start-up organizations. NORA was established by BASF, Harvard University, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), and the University of Massachusetts (UMass) Amherst. At the anniversary event in Cambridge, Massachusetts, the extension of NORA for another five years was officially announced.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a The sustainable use of water and worldwide conservation of natural water resources are key to BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-349.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-353" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-353.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF announces “tap issue” of US$250 million of its US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants due 2023||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-353.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announces “tap issue” of US$250 million of its US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants due 2023</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 24, 2017 – BASF launches today a tap issue of bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants, which will be issued in a nominal amount of US$250 million (the “New Bonds”). The New Bonds are to be issued on the same terms (save for the date of issue, the interest commencement date and the issue price) as the US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants due 2023 issued by BASF on March 9, 2017, and shall be fully fungible, and form a single series with these bonds.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-353.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-354" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-354.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF successfully places a “tap issue” of US$250 million of its US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants due 2023||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-354.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF successfully places a “tap issue” of US$250 million of its US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants due 2023</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 24, 2017 – BASF today successfully placed a tap issue of bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants, which will be issued in a nominal amount of US$250 million (the “New Bonds”). The New Bonds are to be issued on the same terms (save for the date of issue, the interest commencement date and the issue price) as the US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive (cash-settled) warrants due 2023 issued by BASF on March 9, 2017, and shall be fully fungible, and form a single series with these bonds.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-354.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-332" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-332.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF starts up supercomputer in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-332.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 23, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF starts up supercomputer in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 23, 2017 – BASF’s supercomputer has been put into operation and is running at full capacity. The first calculations have already been started. “This marks an important step towards the digitalization of research. We are now able to offer our researchers computing power, like no other company in the chemical industry,” said Dr. Martin Brudermüller, Vice Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors and Chief Technology Officer of BASF. The supercomputer, which is located at the company’s headquarters in Ludwigshafen, enables processing of a greater number and more complex simulations and modeling in shorter periods of time while creating more space for creativity. “These are critical success factors in global competition,” emphasized Brudermüller.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-332.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-348" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-348.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes transaction to sell electrolytes manufacturing site in Suzhou, China to Shenzhen Capchem||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-348.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 23, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes transaction to sell electrolytes manufacturing site in Suzhou, China to Shenzhen Capchem</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">LUDWIGSHAFEN, GERMANY, October 23, 2017 – BASF has closed the previously announced transaction to sell its electrolytes manufacturing site in Suzhou, China, to Shenzhen Capchem Technology Co., Ltd. This underlines our commitment to transform the market towards sustainable renewable resources and to help our customers fulfill their FONAP commitments,” said Xavier Susterac, Senior Vice President BASF Personal Care Europe. BASF is one of the leading global processors of oleochemicals: One of its key raw materials is palm kernel oil and its primary derivatives. Both are mainly used for the production of ingredients for the cosmetics, detergents and cleaners industries, as well as in human nutrition.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-341.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-346" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-346.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Force Majeure for ecoflex® and ecovio®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-346.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 18, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Force Majeure for ecoflex® and ecovio®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On October 13, 2017, BASF detected a technical defect in the ecoflex plant at its Ludwigshafen site. To fix the defect, the plant has been shut down. In addition to ecoflex®, the plant produces ecovio®. Both products are versatile and compostable bio-plastics by BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-346.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-336" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-336.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF signs agreement to acquire significant parts of Bayer’s seed and non-selective herbicide businesses||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 13, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF signs agreement to acquire significant parts of Bayer’s seed and non-selective herbicide businesses</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 13, 2017 – BASF has signed an agreement to acquire significant parts of Bayer’s seed and non-selective herbicide businesses. Bayer intends to divest these assets in the context of its planned acquisition of Monsanto. The all-cash purchase price is €5.9 billion, subject to certain adjustments at closing. The assets to be acquired include Bayer’s global glufosinate-ammonium non-selective herbicide business, commercialized under the Liberty®, Basta® and Finale® brands, as well as its seed businesses for key row crops in select markets: canola hybrids in North America under the InVigor® brand using the LibertyLink® trait technology, oilseed rape mainly in European markets, cotton in the Americas and Europe as well as soybean in the Americas. The transaction also includes Bayer’s trait research and breeding capabilities for these crops and the LibertyLink® trait and trademark.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-328" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-328.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||High glossUltramid® Deep Gloss for high gloss in automotive interiors in automotive interiors||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-328.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 12, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">High glossUltramid® Deep Gloss for high gloss in automotive interiors in automotive interiors</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has now succeeded in developing a specialty polyamide that combines the chemical resistance of semi-crystalline polyamides with the high gloss and the depth of view of amorphous plastics. Ultramid® Deep Gloss is therefore particularly suitable for components in automobile interiors which are high-gloss and at the same time resistant without the need for coating.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-328.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-338" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-338.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF does not anticipate any health hazards||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-338.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 12, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF does not anticipate any health hazards</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF experts have conducted initial tests on foams as part of a risk assessment. The results and subsequent calculations show that health hazards are not anticipated. BASF is providing the responsible authorities and the relevant associations with the details of the assessment.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-338.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-335" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-335.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Red card for oxygen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 11, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Red card for oxygen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Only three years after introducing the first PBT (polybutylene terephthalate) grade for coffee capsules, BASF expands its product line of food contact grade PBTs with a PBT superior when it comes to oxygen transmission. This material goes by the name Ultradur® Barrier (B 1520 FC). The brand-new material will be launched at Fakuma 2017 in Friedrichshafen, at BASF stand 4306 in hall B4.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-337" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-337.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to withdraw TDI in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-337.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 11, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to withdraw TDI in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany/ Hong Kong – October 12, 2017 – BASF has detected quality fluctuations in the production of TDI in Ludwigshafen. Deliveries of TDI from Ludwigshafen produced between August 25 and September 29, 2017, contain a significantly higher concentration of dichlorobenzene. This is due to a technical defect in the production, the cause is currently being eliminated. BASF has informed about 50 affected customers and stopped delivering the product.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-337.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-327" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-327.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF develops first semi-transparent polyamide||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-327.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF develops first semi-transparent polyamide</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has now succeeded in developing a semi-crystalline polyamide that allows light to pass through largely unhindered. Ultramid® Vision combines very high light transmission with low light scattering. This makes it the world’s first semi-crystalline polyamide for semi-transparent or transparent components in chemically challenging environments.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-327.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-333" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-333.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens a production site of construction chemicals in Saint Petersburg||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-333.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens a production site of construction chemicals in Saint Petersburg</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Saint Petersburg, October 10, 2017 – BASF, a leading manufacturer of construction chemicals, officially commissioned a new plant in Saint Petersburg. At the disco in Landau, it is now providing a very special kind of aesthetic acoustic experience.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-319.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-331" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-331.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF develops a material for window profiles with high thermal insulation based on engineering plastic Ultradur®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-331.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 4, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF develops a material for window profiles with high thermal insulation based on engineering plastic Ultradur®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The construction industry is faced with major challenges in the coming years. In new buildings, restorations and interior construction, it will be essential to employ forward-looking and sustainable products. BASF has now developed an Ultradur® (PBT, polybutylene terephthalate), modified for co-extrusion with PVC, that replaces steel in PVC windows as the stiffening element. The outcome is impressive because the window is equally strong while being lighter and more cost-effective. Its insulation performance is also superior, with the Uf value being significantly reduced by 0.1 W/(mK).</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-331.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-326" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-326.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes transfer of leather chemicals business to Stahl Group||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/10/p-17-326.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 2, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes transfer of leather chemicals business to Stahl Group</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 2, 2017 – Following the approval of all relevant authorities, BASF has closed the previously announced transfer of its global leather chemicals business to the Stahl Group, with Stahl taking over the activities as of September 30, 2017.
