The goal is to strengthen BASF’s ability to compete in the challenging market environment of paper coating dispersions in the long term.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-318" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-318.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Two-layer tire system by BASF brings unparalleled safety and comfort to ofo shared bikes||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-318.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 26, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Two-layer tire system by BASF brings unparalleled safety and comfort to ofo shared bikes</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Beijing, China – September 26, 2017 – Bicycle-sharing commuters around the world will soon experience a more enjoyable ride: ofo, a leading China-based multinational bike sharing company, will make journeys safer and more comfortable thanks to a two-layer tire system made with BASF’s Elastopan® polyurethane (PU). Enabled by a unique dual density technology, the outer layer of the PU based tire system is hardy over rough surfaces, while the inner layer provides outstanding shock absorption as a result of the material’s high rebound performance. The inflation-free tire system also eliminates the annoyance of conventional inner-tube patching and repair.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-318.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-322" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-322.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF supports young spray painters as a global WorldSkills competition sponsor||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-322.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 25, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF supports young spray painters as a global WorldSkills competition sponsor</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The WorldSkills competition is a world championship of non-academic occupations. Since 1950, trainees and young skilled workers from all over the world have competed with each other in numerous categories and measured their skills in the individual occupations. The competition aims to motivate young people worldwide to take up a trade or technical occupation. They qualify for the biennial world championship in national and regional preliminary competitions. To support up-and-coming spray painters and young talent, BASF's Coatings division has signed on to be a global sponsor of the WorldSkills International umbrella association until at least 2019.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-322.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-323" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-323.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF further expands production capacity at specialty amines complex in Nanjing, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-323.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 25, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF further expands production capacity at specialty amines complex in Nanjing, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Shanghai, China – September 25, 2017 – BASF will build a new specialty amines plant at its existing wholly owned site in Nanjing Chemical Industry Park in China. The new multi-product plant can manufacture 21,000 metric tons per year and further extends BASF’s amines portfolio at the specialty amines complex in Nanjing. The plant is scheduled to come on stream in 2019 and will mainly produce 1,2-Propylenediamine (1,2-PDA), n-Octylamine (n-OA) and Polyetheramine (PEA).</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-323.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-312" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-312.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in third plant for specialty zeolites used for the production of mobile emissions catalysts||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P312_S17_0247_L900-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in third plant for specialty zeolites used for the production of mobile emissions catalysts</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in another production plant for specialty zeolites at its Ludwigshafen, Germany, headquarters site. These specialty zeolites will be used to produce state-of-the-art emissions catalysts for heavy duty and light duty diesel vehicles. Due to an increasingly high demand for these catalysts, BASF is investing in this new plant. Production is scheduled to begin in 2019. Another plant in Ludwigshafen started production in 2014. On September 20, the site celebrated a topping-out ceremony for the new plant. It will make BASF one of the largest producers of specialty zeolites worldwide.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-317" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-317.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Flip the switch safely – with engineering plastics from BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-317.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Flip the switch safely – with engineering plastics from BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now expanding its PA (PA: polyamide) range to include a new flame-retardant grade for use in the electronics and electrical engineering sectors. Ultramid® B3U31G4 impresses in the glow-wire test, is noted for its good mechanics and good processing properties and is particularly suitable for manufacturing circuit breakers for domestic use. BASF is rounding off the product range and thus offering plastics for both market segments: highly specialized circuit breakers for industrial and household applications.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-317.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-314" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-314.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF invests in high-tech company Applied Nano Surfaces Sweden||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-314.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 20, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF invests in high-tech company Applied Nano Surfaces Sweden</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Uppsala, Sweden, September 20, 2017 -- BASF Venture Capital GmbH is leading an investment round in the Swedish high-tech company Applied Nano Surfaces Sweden AB (ANS), headquartered in Uppsala, Sweden. ANS offers unique surface treatment technologies to reduce friction and wear in industrial and automotive applications. The investment is co-led by the existing investor Fouriertransform AB.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-314.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-311" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-311.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to acquire Solvay’s global polyamide business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 19, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to acquire Solvay’s global polyamide business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 19, 2017 – BASF and Solvay have signed an agreement related to the sale of Solvay’s integrated polyamide business to BASF. The purchase price on a cash and debt-free basis would be €1.6 billion. According to applicable laws, the intended transaction is subject to consultations with the relevant social bodies of Solvay, following which both companies will enter a binding purchase agreement. Solvay and BASF aim to close the transaction in the third quarter of 2018, after customary regulatory approvals have been obtained and the formal consent of a joint venture partner has been received. The partner has already committed to grant its consent subject to the delivery of definitive documents with BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-315" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-315.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF partners with space agencies to develop global UV radiation mapping tool for plastics||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-315.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 19, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF partners with space agencies to develop global UV radiation mapping tool for plastics</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 19, 2017 – BASF has partnered with the German Aerospace Center (DLR) and NASA Goddard Space Flight Center on a new tool to maximize the service life of plastic products by precisely matching plastic additives to the predicted intensity of ultraviolet (UV) radiation. At the two agencies, scientists have created an extensive set of global maps showing UV radiation levels in all regions of the world. With the help of these maps, the dosage of plastic additives can be optimized, resulting in a more robust final product perfectly adapted to the requirements of the region where it will be used.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-315.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-316" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-316.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||A new dimension for the furniture industry: BASF and Sonae Arauco win AVK Innovation Award 2017 for 3D moldable wood fiber composites||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-316.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 19, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">A new dimension for the furniture industry: BASF and Sonae Arauco win AVK Innovation Award 2017 for 3D moldable wood fiber composites</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Porto/Ludwigshafen, September 19, 2017 – At the International Composites Congress in Stuttgart, BASF and Sonae Arauco were jointly honored with the AVK (German Federation of Reinforced Plastics) Innovation Award 2017 for a new development in 3D moldable wood fiber components. The two companies ranked first in the category “Innovative products/components or applications” for providing the furniture industry with a storage stable composite that can be processed by hot molding.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-316.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-307" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-307.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Master Builders Solutions® at International SHCC4 Conference in Dresden||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-307.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 18, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® at International SHCC4 Conference in Dresden</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Dresden, Germany, September 18, 2017 – From September 18 to 20, 2017, BASF will present its technical know-how in the field of strain-hardening cement-based composites (SHCC) at the International SHCC4 Conference in Dresden. The main focus is on the innovative MasterFiber product series: especially with high-performance polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) fibers in the MasterFiber series, BASF offers an alternative reinforcement solution for strain-hardening cement-based composites. The high-performance durable rust-proof fibers allow the production of extremely intricate and durable components. Among other applications, the fibers are used for facade elements and delicate precast concrete elements. The synthetic fibers from Master Builders Solutions ensure solutions that are durable, economical and reliable</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-307.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-308" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-308.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Lights on and full speed ahead||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 14, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lights on and full speed ahead</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hotter, lighter, faster – headlight systems used in the automotive sector are subject to increasingly stringent and in some cases, conflicting requirements. Increased road safety, lower fuel consumption and resistance to high temperatures must be integrated thoughtfully into modern designs. Polyethersulfone (PESU) Ultrason® E from BASF can withstand continuous exposure to temperatures of 180°C and for a brief time, even up to 220°C. The material is lightweight and easily metallized – ideal for use in headlights.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-310" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-310.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF scores double win for functional coatings technology at the International Motor Show (IAA)||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-310.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 14, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF scores double win for functional coatings technology at the International Motor Show (IAA)</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At the Automotive Brand Contest 2017 international design competition, BASF's Coatings division's functional coatings technology for passive temperature management was honored in the “Innovation of the Year” and “Exterior Premium Brand” categories. Although applicable for all printing applications, the new product is particularly suitable for food contact and liquid packaging board. The low odor XSB binder is characterized by its minimal content of volatile organic compounds (VOCs). It complies with all relevant eco label and food contact requirements.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-305.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-284" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-284.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF listed in Dow Jones Sustainability World Index for 17th consecutive year||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-284.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 7, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF listed in Dow Jones Sustainability World Index for 17th consecutive year</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 7, 2017 – BASF has again been included in the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI World). This year, the chemicals group has been especially recognized for its comprehensive innovation management, environmental and social reporting as well as its focused materiality assessment. The DJSI World is one of the most renowned sustainability indices. It represents the top 10 percent of the largest 2,500 companies in the S&amp;P Global Broad Market IndexSM based on their sustainability performance.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-284.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-296" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-296.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF presents innovative solutions for the automotive industry at IAA 2017||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/09/p-17-296.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 7, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF presents innovative solutions for the automotive industry at IAA 2017</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At this year’s Internationale Automobil Ausstellung (IAA) in Frankfurt BASF presents innovative catalysts, battery materials and plastics to show how automotive manufacturers can reduce emissions, save weight and improve safety, comfort and design of their vehicles. September 2017 - As of now, BASF produces the chemical intermediate isopropylamine as a 70% solution at its Belgian Verbund site in Antwerp. Isopropylamine is also referred to as monoisopropylamine (MIPA). To date, the company has been manufacturing MIPA in pure form (100%) in Antwerp, with a boiling point of 32° Celsius. The 70% aqueous solution, on the other hand, only boils at 45° Celsius, which simplifies the handling of this product at higher outdoor temperatures for many customers. MIPA 100% and MIPA 70% are mainly used for the production of plant protection agents and pharmaceuticals.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more Consumers around the world are looking for products that will help protect their scalp against dehydration, while improving hair structure and shine. data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Proagrica sign agreement to offer interface for farm management systems </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Proagrica have signed a development and operation agreement to bring one of the first farm management system interfaces to market. Growers will benefit as they will be able to connect BASF’s digital offer Maglis® with different digital farming applications, including their preferred farm management system. Proagrica’s integration and connectivity solutions and expertise guarantee that the data shared between Maglis and growers is efficiently transferred and protected.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-292.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-293" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-293.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and bse Engineering sign development agreement to transform CO2 and excess current into methanol||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-293.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and bse Engineering sign development agreement to transform CO2 and excess current into methanol</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen and Leipzig, Germany, August 24, 2017 – BASF and bse Engineering today signed an exclusive joint development agreement for BASF to provide custom made catalysts for a new chemical energy storage process. This process will enable economically viable transformation of excess current and off-gas carbon dioxide (CO2) into the chemical energy storage methanol in small-scale, delocalized production units.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-293.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-291" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-291.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Ergon and BASF revolutionize the bicycle saddle||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-291.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 23, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ergon and BASF revolutionize the bicycle saddle</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With the ST Core Ultra, Ergon and technology partner BASF are propelling the development of the bicycle saddle to a new level. Using new materials and a groundbreaking design principle, crucial parameters such as ergonomics, comfort and dynamics are being redefined. The innovative saddle will be presented for the first time at the Eurobike 2017 exhibition in Friedrichshafen, at the RTI Sports stand in Hall B4, stand 102. Eurobike will be taking place from August 30 to September 2, 2017.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-291.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-289" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-289.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF becomes the first XPS manufacturer to obtain technical approvals (construction type) for products welded in a contactless process||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-289.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 22, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF becomes the first XPS manufacturer to obtain technical approvals (construction type) for products welded in a contactless process</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In mid-July 2017, BASF became the first XPS producer to receive a construction type approval for extruded foam boards welded in a contactless process. The general technical approvals Z-23.31-2083 and Z-23.33-2084 pertain to Styrodur® SQ in inverted roof and perimeter applications. Under the brand name Styrodur® 3000 SQ, products are sold with nominal thicknesses of 200, 240, and 300 mm, which are joined together in layers of three, four, or five to form a single board by means of contactless thermal welding applied across their whole surface.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-289.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-290" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-290.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF gains momentum for worldwide registration of Revysol® fungicide||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-290.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 22, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF gains momentum for worldwide registration of Revysol® fungicide</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, August 22, 2017 – BASF has reached the next milestone for its latest fungicide active ingredient Revysol®. The company has submitted the regulatory dossier for this strategic proprietary compound to registration authorities in the United States, Canada and Mexico. Revysol is an innovative and highly effective fungicide active ingredient from the triazole chemical class and will strengthen BASF’s leading position in fungicides. The worldwide registration initiative will continue in key markets across Asia later this year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-290.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-285" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-285.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF acquires filament producer Innofil3D||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-285.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 18, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF acquires filament producer Innofil3D</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF New Business has acquired 100% of the filament producer Innofil3D, headquartered in Emmen, Netherlands. Approval from antitrust authorities is not required. “With this acquisition, BASF is moving one step further along the value chain and can now provide not only plastic granulate for 3D printing but also the next processing level: the filaments,” said Volker Hammes, Managing Director at BASF New Business.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-285.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-287" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-287.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Smooth steering, safe control||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/08/p-17-287.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 17, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Smooth steering, safe control</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The automotive supplier Valeo has now developed a top column module made of the engineering plastics Ultramid® SI and Ultradur®. 3D printing||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-278.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 28, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF establishes new Group company to pursue business opportunities in 3D printing</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – July 28, 2017 – BASF SE plans to establish a new Group company, BASF 3D Printing Solutions GmbH, as of September 1, 2017. This wholly-owned subsidiary of BASF New Business GmbH will be headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, at the site of InnovationLab GmbH. It will focus on establishing and expanding the business with materials, system solutions, components and services in the field of 3D printing. The company will work closely with researchers and application engineers from BASF and external partners, such as universities and potential customers, in order to develop the right solutions for a wide array of requirements.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-278.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-270" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-270.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF: Considerable earnings growth in second quarter, 2017 outlook raised||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-270.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/A16_0008_2017:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 27, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF: Considerable earnings growth in second quarter, 2017 outlook raised</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“The positive demand trend continued in the second quarter of 2017. That’s what the creative minds behind start-up POMP asked themselves. Their vision: a car that automatically informs its owner about a low fuel tank and gets refilled on-site through mobile fuel service vehicles. With support of the fuel additives experts from BASF, this mobile gas station concept is now being developed further.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-277.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-273" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-273.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Lower emissions in car interiors with improved BASF polyether polyols||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-273.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lower emissions in car interiors with improved BASF polyether polyols</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has now improved the process for manufacturing Lupranol® (polyether polyol) so that car components which are made of BASF polyurethane systems emit an average of 20 percent less aldehyde. This allows automotive suppliers to meet the increasing requirements of car manufacturers and the law for lower emissions in vehicle interiors.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-273.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-275" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-275.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF concentrates production of XPS boards at its Verbund site in Ludwigshafen  ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-275.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF concentrates production of XPS boards at its Verbund site in Ludwigshafen  </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">By the end of 2017, BASF will concentrate the production of XPS boards (extruded polystyrene) at its Verbund site in Ludwigshafen, Germany, which will ensure the direct supply of raw materials, optimised logistics, and direct access to research and development facilities. In view of overcapacities and low margins, the company will discontinue the production of XPS at its Schwarzheide location in Germany in the fourth quarter of this year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-275.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-269" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-269.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice Half-Year Financial Report 1st Half 2017 Conference Call on July 27, 2017, at 9:00 a.m.||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/07/p-17-269.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 20, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice Half-Year Financial Report 1st Half 2017 Conference Call on July 27, 2017, at 9:00 a.m.</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">We will publish BASF’s Half-Year Financial Report 1st Half 2017 on July 27, 2017, at 7:00 a.m. (CEST). The partnership will help establish a sustainable certified and transparent supply chain of coconut oil in the Philippines and Indonesia.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-261.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-262" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-262.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Norilsk Nickel enter exclusive negotiations to cooperate on raw material supply for battery materials production in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-262.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 27, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Norilsk Nickel enter exclusive negotiations to cooperate on raw material supply for battery materials production in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Moscow, Russia, June 27, 2017 – BASF and PJSC MMC Norilsk Nickel (Nornickel) announced today that they have signed a Memorandum of Understanding and entered exclusive negotiations to cooperate on the supply of raw materials for future battery materials production for lithium-ion batteries in Europe. BASF intends to invest up to €400 million in a first step to build industry-leading production plants for cathode materials in Europe. Through the prospective agreement, BASF would receive the raw materials from the Nornickel metal refinery in Harjavalta, Finland. Nornickel would also provide a secure supply of nickel and cobalt feedstock from its Russian mines at market prices. Along with its leading raw materials position, Nornickel also brings significant metals refining and trading experience to the cooperation.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-262.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-250" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-250.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF puts expanded compounding plant for engineering plastics into operation||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-250.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF puts expanded compounding plant for engineering plastics into operation</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On June 21, 2017 BASF put the expanded compounding plant at BASF’s Schwarzheide site in Germany into operation. With the expansion of the plant up to 70,000 tons more Ultramid® and Ultradur® can be produced each year. With the expansion, Schwarzheide is the site with the biggest PA and PBT compounding capacity within BASF globally. About 50 new jobs will be created.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-250.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-251" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-251.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||The relationship to the digital world shapes BASF’s 2017/18 Automotive Color Trend predictions||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/06/p-17-251.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 14, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The relationship to the digital world shapes BASF’s 2017/18 Automotive Color Trend predictions</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">A desire for more simplicity and transparency in a digital world inspired the overarching theme of BASF’s Automotive Color Trends for 2017/18 – Translucid. The grant supports the establishment of an innovative value chain for bio-based raw materials as well as chemicals and materials based on polyethylenefuranoate (PEF). It includes the intended construction of a 50,000 tons FDCA reference plant, the main chemical building block for the production of PEF. data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-213" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-213.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Mobile air conditioner to wear||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-213.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P213_Laeuferpaar-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 23, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Mobile air conditioner to wear</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Humans are born runners. Evolution once gave us the ability to overcome the distance of many kilometers through the hot savannas of Africa. In addition to the upright posture of the body and head and the optimized mechanics of legs and feet, cooling by millions of sweat glands plays a key role. Under extreme stress, they can release about one liter of sweat per hour and cool down the body by evaporation.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-213.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-229" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-229.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Synvina receives interim approval from European PET Bottle Platform: PEF to be integrated in circular economy ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-229.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 22, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Synvina receives interim approval from European PET Bottle Platform: PEF to be integrated in circular economy </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The European PET Bottle Platform (EPBP) has given interim approval for the recyclability of polyethylenefuranoate (PEF), produced by Synvina C.V., Amsterdam, in the European bottle recycling market. Following EPBP’s assessment PEF bottles are expected to be disposable through existing recovery systems the same way as polyethylene terephthalate (PET), the conventional material for plastic bottles.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-229.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-224" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-224.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Master Builders Solutions® at the BIBM Congress in Madrid||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-224.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 17, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Master Builders Solutions® at the BIBM Congress in Madrid</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Madrid, Spain, May 17, 2017 – BASF will present its broad portfolio of concrete solutions at the BIBM Congress in Madrid – one of Europe`s most important meeting points for the precast industry. From May 17-19 the experts from Master Builders Solutions will meet the visitors on stand 83.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-224.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-225" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-225.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to divest its Micronal® PCM business to Microtek Laboratories||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-225.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 17, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to divest its Micronal® PCM business to Microtek Laboratories</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – May 17, 2017 – BASF has signed a contract to sell its Micronal® PCM business to Microtek Laboratories Inc. of Dayton, USA. Both companies have agreed not to disclose financial details of the transaction.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-225.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-214" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-214.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to increase prices for construction chemicals across Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-214.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 15, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to increase prices for construction chemicals across Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, May 15, 2017 – BASF’s Construction Chemicals division increased prices across Europe during the first quarter of 2017, resulting in effective prices 2 – 3% above prior year. For the second time, it will be completed by the Award for Applied Research. Starting today, scientists of excellence from all over the world may apply online at www.scienceaward.com. The website also ex-plains the participation conditions, procedure and selection process. Deadline for applications: August 18, 2017. Contributions submitted will be assessed by a jury comprising experts from BASF, Volkswagen and representatives from the scientific community. data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Water-based inks and adhesives as a valuable  contribution to sustainability in flexible packaging||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-210.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 4, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Water-based inks and adhesives as a valuable  contribution to sustainability in flexible packaging</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Die wasserbasierten Harze für Druckfarben und Klebstoffe in flexiblen Verpackungen sind eine wirtschaftlich lohnende und umweltfreundliche Alternative zu lösemittelbasierten Technologien. Dies ist das Ergebnis einer kürzlich abgeschlossenen Ökoeffizienz-Analyse der BASF, die durch eine 2009 durchgeführte Ökoeffizienz-Analyse wasserbasierter Druckfarben für flexible Verpackungen sowie durch die Ergebnisse einer 2016 erfolgten Ökoeffizienz-Analyse von Klebstoffen gestützt wird. In der Studie werden verschiedene Umweltkategorien des Endprodukts und seiner Rohstoffe (von der Wiege bis zur Bahre) wie z. B. Klimawandel, Ressourcenverknappung oder Überdüngung von Gewässern berücksichtigt.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-210.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-208" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-208.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF announces cooperation with HP Indigo||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-208.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 3, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announces cooperation with HP Indigo</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has recently entered a strategic collaboration with HP Indigo, the world’s leading manufacturer of digital printing presses. Both companies will collaborate to develop water-based adhesive solutions for flexible packaging that are specially tailored for the requirements of the HP Indigo ElectroInk process, a highly flexible and fast digital printing process.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-208.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-209" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-209.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands its offer for innovation projects with customers||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-209.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 3, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands its offer for innovation projects with customers</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will combine its competencies in design, trend research and simulation in the plastics division to improve its global offering for joint innovations with customers from industries, such as automotive, consumer goods and construction. Depending on the type of project, the company will offer the material consultancy of its designfabrik®, the simulation tool Ultrasim® and the trend research know-how in a one-stop-shop solution and also physically bundle these functions at one location per region. This allows the company to provide dedicated support for customer projects using innovative instruments. “This integrated, global concept and the bundling of competencies under one roof will improve support for the innovation process at our customers, from the first steps in product development to the development of virtual prototypes,” explained Raimar Jahn, President of BASF’s Performance Materials division.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/05/p-17-209.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-202" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-202.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF contributes to sustainable construction for the world's largest concentrated solar plant in Morocco||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-202.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 28, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF contributes to sustainable construction for the world's largest concentrated solar plant in Morocco</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ouarzazate, Morocco, April 28, 2017 – Stage one of the three-phase construction project of the Noor solar complex was set in motion in February 2016. Innovative solutions based on the BASF Construction Chemicals division's global knowledge and experience are used in the construction of the concentrated solar power system – a more complicated process to install than the widely used photovoltaic panels.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-202.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-207" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-207.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||All-rounder TPU: BASF presents textile variety at Techtextil 2017||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-207.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 28, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">All-rounder TPU: BASF presents textile variety at Techtextil 2017</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will present its competence with films, membranes, fabrics, fibers as well as melt adhesives – all based on Elastollan®, the company's thermoplastic polyurethane, from May 9-12, at the International Trade Fair for Technical Textiles and Nonwovens in Frankfurt. Umicore is now licensed to make, use, sell, offer to sell, distribute and import nickel-manganese-cobalt (NMC) cathode material for lithium ion batteries in the United States under BASF’s and Argonne’s U.S. Patent Nos. 6,677,082; 6,680,143; 7,135,252; and 7,468,223.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-204.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-198" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-198.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to acquire waterproofing systems provider THERMOTEK||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-198.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to acquire waterproofing systems provider THERMOTEK</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">MEXICO CITY, and MONTERREY, NL, MEXICO, April 24, 2017 – BASF has signed an agreement to acquire GRUPO THERMOTEK, a leading waterproofing systems supplier based in Monterrey, NL, Mexico. data-tracking-value="news||BASF Opts for Voluntary Product Certification for Styrodur Insulation Boards||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-185.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 18, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Opts for Voluntary Product Certification for Styrodur Insulation Boards</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In October 2016, the familiar Ü mark for harmonised building products was dropped (Judgement of the Court (Tenth Chamber) of 16 October 2014—European Commission v Federal Republic of Germany (Case C-100/13) (1)). In order for end users to obtain proof of high quality after the termination of the Ü mark, BASF has decided to use the KEYMARK as a voluntary product certification for insulation boards made of Styrodur® (XPS: extruded polystyrene). In the past, the Ü mark—alongside the CE mark—was the only verification that a building product was approved for use in Germany. The CE mark on its own, however, does not provide proof of quality, because no independent quality testing is carried out.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-185.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-191" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-191.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF named a General Motors Supplier of the Year for twelfth time||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-191.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 18, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF named a General Motors Supplier of the Year for twelfth time</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF was named a 2016 General Motors (GM) Supplier of the Year for the twelfth time since 2002. The award winners were chosen by a global team of GM purchasing, engineering, quality, manufacturing, and logistics executives. Winners were selected based on performance criteria in product purchasing, indirect purchasing, logistics, customer care and aftersales.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF saves €60 million globally from employee ideas ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-177.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 12, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF saves €60 million globally from employee ideas </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – April 12, 2017 – Valuable ideas: by implementing improvement proposals from employees, BASF was able to save nearly €60 million globally last year. A computer program for labeling samples, a concept for efficient distillation of a solvent, and a new approach to the energy-saving melting of waxes – these and 21,000 other improvement proposals were implemented in 2016, maintaining the high level of ideas of the previous year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-177.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-159" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-159.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Tiny worms slay slugs and snails||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-159.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P159_Nematoden-1:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Tiny worms slay slugs and snails</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF uses a variety of living organisms for targeted pest control: Harmless organisms kill or displace crop pests such as locusts, harmful insects, bacteria, molds and slugs that cause diseases and threaten harvests. Although these natural helpers can never fully replace chemical agents, biological pest control provides effective support.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-159.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-182" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-182.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to sell its Bleaching Clay and Mineral Adsorbents businesses to EP Minerals||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-182.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 7, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to sell its Bleaching Clay and Mineral Adsorbents businesses to EP Minerals</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">ISELIN, NJ, and RENO, NV, April 6, 2017 – BASF announced today that it has signed an agreement to sell its Bleaching Clay and Mineral Adsorbents businesses to EP Minerals, a worldwide leader in industrial minerals. The art work PSAD Synthetic Desert III manipulates sound in a specifically conceived chamber by using more than 1000 pyramids and wedges covering the exhibit’s floor, walls and ceiling and thus suppressing all but the lowest levels of ambient sound.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-180.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-168" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-168.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Landa partner to create revolutionary pigments for automotive coatings||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/04/p-17-168.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 4, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Landa partner to create revolutionary pigments for automotive coatings</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">NUREMBERG, GERMANY, April 4, 2017 – BASF and Landa Labs announced their strategic long-term partnership today at the European Coatings Show (ECS) in Nuremberg, Germany.
