It also highlights end customers' growing need for individuality expressed by special effects and a variety of colors.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-162.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-156" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-156.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches BorotecTM: Next innovative FCC catalyst using unique Boron-Based Technology platform||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-156.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 22, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches BorotecTM: Next innovative FCC catalyst using unique Boron-Based Technology platform</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF today announced the commercial launch of BorotecTM, the newest evolution of its resid oil Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) catalysts portfolio. Borotec is the latest innovation using BASF’s unique Boron-Based Technology (BBT) platform to provide mild- and moderate-resid feed FCC units more flexibility in crude selection, which results in increased yields of high-value products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-156.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-WH-170322" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-WH-170322.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Oil and gas production at record level||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-WH-170322.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 22, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Oil and gas production at record level</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Kassel. Wintershall is on a growth course and attained a historic level of production in 2016 of 165 million barrels of oil equivalent (BOE) despite the difficult conditions in the industry. This means the company has increased its oil and gas production in the last ten years by around 50 percent. During that time, Wintershall has doubled its commercially recoverable oil and gas reserves from 814 million BOE to 1.62 billion BOE.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-WH-170322.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-154" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-154.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands production capacity for herbicide dicamba in Beaumont, Texas||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-154.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 21, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands production capacity for herbicide dicamba in Beaumont, Texas</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">RESEARCH TRIANGLE PARK, N.C., March 21, 2017 – Today, BASF opened its expanded production facility for dicamba in Beaumont, Texas. Dicamba is the active ingredient in BASF’s newest herbicide product Engenia™, which was granted approval by the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) in December 2016. The expansion supports the company’s strategy to increase the production volumes of dicamba, ensuring growers have access to the latest technologies for better weed management programs. For the expansion, BASF invested more than $270 million, making it BASF’s largest investment ever in facilities for agricultural products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-154.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-152" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-152.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF selects HPE to build supercomputer for global chemical research ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-152.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 17, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF selects HPE to build supercomputer for global chemical research </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen (Germany), Palo Alto (USA) – March 17, 2017 – BASF SE and Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE: HPE) today announced that the companies will collaborate to develop one of the world’s largest supercomputers for industrial chemical research at BASF's Ludwigshafen headquarters this year. Based on the latest generation of HPE Apollo 6000 systems, the new supercomputer will drive the digitalization of BASF's worldwide research.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Hong Kong – March 14, 2017 – As announced in November 2016, BASF is investing more than €200 million globally to increase its production network for plastic additives. An important step is an investment to build a new plastic additives plant at its Caojing site in Shanghai, China. This world-scale plant, with an annual capacity of 42,000 tons, will produce antioxidants and associated forms and blends. Each “unit” comprises one senior, unsecured bond and one detachable senior, euro-denominated, unsecured cash-settled warrant. BASF will purchase cash-settled call options to hedge its economic exposure in case of exercise of the warrants. The warrants will be cash settled only and will thus not result in the creation of new shares or the delivery of existing shares of BASF SE upon exercise.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-146.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-147" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-147.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF places bonds with non-dilutive warrants||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-147.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 2, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF places bonds with non-dilutive warrants</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – March 2, 2017 – BASF has placed US$600 million bonds with non-dilutive warrants due 2023. Each “unit” comprises one senior, unsecured bond with a denomination of US$250,000 and one detachable senior, euro-denominated, unsecured cash-settled warrant. Since they will be cash-settled only, the warrants will not result in the creation of new shares or the delivery of existing shares of BASF SE upon exercise. BASF has hedged the economic exposure under the warrants through the purchase of corresponding cash-settled call options.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-147.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-142" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-142.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Martin Jung new head of BASF’s Global Business Unit Surface Treatment||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/03/p-17-142.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 1, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Martin Jung new head of BASF’s Global Business Unit Surface Treatment</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Dr. Martin Jung, Senior Vice President, has been appointed head of the global business unit Surface Treatment of BASF’s Coatings division which comprises the Chemetall business acquired from Albemarle in December 2016. The trial, designed by Maria Koch, Raphael Schilling and David Geray - three students from an agricultural high school in Ravensburg, Germany - left Kennedy Space Center in Florida on board the SpaceX rocket on February 19, 2017 at 9.39 am local time. To date, experiments conducted in zero gravity have only concentrated on the growth behavior of seeds. If cuttings can be used to propagate plants in space, it would be a significant advance in efforts to supply food for long space missions, such as to Mars.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/02/p-17-133.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 24, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF enters Indian crop protection market for rice</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Rice farmers in India will be able to boost productivity and income with the help of BASF crop protection solutions for rice, now available in the country for the first time. “Our aim is to support India’s rice growers to realize their full potential. We will dedicate BASF’s expertise in modern, sustainable farming to the needs of the Indian rice growing community,” said Markus Heldt, President of BASF’s Crop Protection division, at today’s launch event in Hyderabad, India. BASF is a worldwide leader in crop protection, with global sales of more than €5.8 billion in 2015.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-109.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-110" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-110.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||MDI capacity increases at BASF Verbund site in Antwerp, Belgium ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-110.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 23, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">MDI capacity increases at BASF Verbund site in Antwerp, Belgium </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 23, 2017. She succeeds Jennifer Moore-Braun (45) who will become Head of Channel Management, responsible for BASF’s corporate internet and intranet sites and social media platforms.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-100.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-102" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-102.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Cosmetagora 2017: BASF leads the way with new beauty routines, active ingredients and micro-proteins||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-102.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cosmetagora 2017: BASF leads the way with new beauty routines, active ingredients and micro-proteins</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Paris, France – January 10, 2017. At this year’s Cosmetagora (booth 132-135-136) BASF will be presenting its “Inspiring Beauty Rituals 2017” collection to the personal care industry. “We will launch three new routines inspired by life. They provide a foresight of tomorrow’s consumer expectations, including sensory experience, performances, recovery from external stresses and sustainable sourcing of ingredients”, said Valérie Pian-Parison, Senior Operative Marketing Manager for BASF’s Personal Care business in France. “Escape from urban life” targets consumers who wish to re-synchronize with nature. It introduces slow beauty and anti-pollutant cosmetics.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-102.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-103" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-103.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New active ingredient Dermagenist™ harnesses BASF’s findings on epigenetics to revitalize fibroblasts||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-103.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New active ingredient Dermagenist™ harnesses BASF’s findings on epigenetics to revitalize fibroblasts</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Paris, France – January 10, 2017. To further explore the field of epigenetics, BASF researchers have joined forces and established an interdisciplinary innovation platform. Together with experts from public and private research institutions they want to explore how changes to our genes caused by the chronological aging process or environmental factors can be mapped and precisely controlled. In the coming years, BASF intends to develop and market several active ingredients for cosmetic products that harness the innovation platform’s findings on epigenetics.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-103.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-104" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-104.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Relipidium™ helps to rebalance the skin’s ecosystem to restore the skin barrier and increase skin hydration||/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-104.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 10, 2017</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Relipidium™ helps to rebalance the skin’s ecosystem to restore the skin barrier and increase skin hydration</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Paris, France – January 10, 2017. At this year’s Cosmetagora, BASF is launching the first active ingredient for the personal care market that is able to rebalance the skin’s ecosystem: Relipidium™ reinforces the skin’s lipid barrier and defense by creating a favorable environment for a balanced skin microflora, which in return helps to preserve an optimal skin moisturization. To further explore the role of microbiota in a healthy skin barrier, researchers from BASF have established an interdisciplinary innovation platform. “We want to better understand the role of each micro-organism in skin beauty and build new skin models to study effects of active ingredients”, said David Herault, Head of Global Research and Development for Bio-Actives at BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2017/01/p-17-104.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Engenia™ herbicide from BASF approved for use in the USA||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 21, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Engenia™ herbicide from BASF approved for use in the USA</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 21st 2016 – BASF’s newest herbicide, Engenia™, was granted approval by the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Engenia is the most technologically advanced formulation of the active ingredient dicamba and will provide growers the control of more than 200 broadleaf weeds, including those resistant to glyphosate. Engenia’s introduction to the market marks an important addition to BASF’s herbicide growth strategy.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-404" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-404.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||International Trade Commission issues final determination that Umicore infringes BASF and Argonne National Laboratory patents||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-404.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 20, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">International Trade Commission issues final determination that Umicore infringes BASF and Argonne National Laboratory patents</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The full International Trade Commission (ITC) has made a final determination that Umicore has infringed on BASF and Argonne National Laboratory’s patents. The order bans in particular the import of Umicore’s infringing nickel-manganese-cobalt (NMC) cathode materials, confirms that lithium-ion batteries containing these materials are infringing, and finds that Umicore is contributing to and inducing its customers’ infringement.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-404.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-403" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-403.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Thomas Kloster new head of Automotive OEM Coatings Solutions Europe business unit||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-403.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 19, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Thomas Kloster new head of Automotive OEM Coatings Solutions Europe business unit</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Dr. Thomas Kloster took over the position as head of the Automotive OEM Coatings Solutions Europe business unit at BASF’s Coatings division effective December 1, 2016. In this position, he succeeds Dr. Martin Jung who oversees the integration of Chemetall after the successful acquisition of the business.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-403.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-401" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-401.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF broadens portfolio of UV resins to include standard epoxy acrylates ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-401.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 16, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF broadens portfolio of UV resins to include standard epoxy acrylates </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is broadening its portfolio of UV resins to include five new standard epoxy acrylates from the Laromer® EA product family. The binders are used for UV-curable coatings for the furniture and flooring industry as well as for overprint varnishes and printing inks. They are characterized by high reactivity and chemical resistance and make coatings and printing inks particularly durable.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-401.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-398" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-398.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF aims to open first plant in Myanmar to meet local demand for construction chemicals||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-398.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 15, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF aims to open first plant in Myanmar to meet local demand for construction chemicals</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany/ Yangon, Myanmar – December 15, 2016 – BASF is planning its first manufacturing plant in Myanmar in 2017. Subject to Myanmar regulatory approvals, the plant to be located in Myanmar’s commercial capital, Yangon, will be designed to produce tailor-made construction chemical solutions for the local building market from BASF’s Master Builders Solutions portfolio.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-398.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-399" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-399.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes sale of its industrial coatings businesses to AkzoNobel||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-399.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 15, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes sale of its industrial coatings businesses to AkzoNobel</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has completed the sale of its global industrial coatings businesses to AkzoNobel. The transaction includes technologies, patents and trademarks, as well as the transfer of dedicated production sites in Deeside, United Kingdom, and Vanderbijlpark, South Africa.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-399.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-400" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-400.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Changes in the Board of Executive Directors of BASF||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-400.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 15, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Changes in the Board of Executive Directors of BASF</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 15, 2016 – The Supervisory Board of BASF SE today appointed Saori Dubourg (45) and Dr. Markus Kamieth (46) to the Board of Executive Directors effective May 13, 2017. Two employees of the BASF fire department and an employee of a tanker which was anchored in the harbor died in the accident. Another employee of the BASF fire department who was severely injured in the explosion died on October 29. Seven people were seriously injured and another 22 suffered slight injuries. Four of the seriously injured have been released from the hospital.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-391.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-393" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-393.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives the German Federal Ecodesign Award for &quot;Cool Coatings&quot;||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/12/p-16-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 2, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives the German Federal Ecodesign Award for "Cool Coatings"</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF's Coatings division has won the German Federal Ecodesign Award. data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-380" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-380.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Conserving resources during automotive production with integrated paint process||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-380.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 23, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Conserving resources during automotive production with integrated paint process</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The BMW Group saves 12,000 tons of CO2 annually during automotive production at its Munich plant by eliminating one step from the paint process. This means that compared to a conventionally coated vehicle, a car coated with the shortened process can drive the first 420 kilometers with a net zero carbon footprint. In addition, the process saves as much energy as the amount needed by 250,000 Munich residents to wash one load of laundry every week.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-380.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-382" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-382.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Volkswagen and BASF present “Science Award Electrochemistry”  to Dr. William Chueh from Stanford University, California||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-382.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 22, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Volkswagen and BASF present “Science Award Electrochemistry”  to Dr. William Chueh from Stanford University, California</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Wolfsburg / Ludwigshafen, Germany, November 22, 2016 – The BASF and Volkswagen international “Science Award Electrochemistry 2016” goes to Dr. William Chueh from Stanford University, California. The jury of representatives from BASF, Volkswagen and from academia selected him for his outstanding research results in the area of energy storage and conversion.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-382.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-CI-161118" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-CI-161118.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to divest Inorganic Specialties business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-CI-161118.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 18, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to divest Inorganic Specialties business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">FLORHAM PARK, NJ, and CLEVELAND, OH, November 18, 2016 – BASF has entered into an agreement to sell its Inorganic Specialties business to Edgewater Capital Partners LP, Cleveland, OH. Inorganic Specialties includes the Evans City, Pennsylvania USA production site and the Specialty Alcoholates, Boranes and Alkali Metals product lines which are produced at the site.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-CI-161118.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-378" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-378.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to realign organizational structure of internal functional units||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-378.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 17, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to realign organizational structure of internal functional units</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – November 17, 2016 – BASF is realigning the organizational structure of selected functional units in order to become even more customer-oriented, agile and simpler. These include procurement; human resources; information services &amp; supply chain; environment, health &amp; safety and site services. The goal is to tailor processes more closely to customer and market needs and reduce internal interfaces.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-378.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-373" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-373.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF plans a stepwise capacity increase of its North American MDI production ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://www.basf.com/global/press-photos/en/highlights/Digitalization/standorte_nach_regionen/nordamerika/3299_View_of_BASF_Geismar_Verbund_Site_North_America.jpg.dynamic.200w113h.cf50c4edb21473010bff4859b56f1f0d999ee674.jpeg" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 16, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF plans a stepwise capacity increase of its North American MDI production </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany / Geismar, Louisiana – November 16, 2016 – BASF has started engineering for a stepwise capacity increase of its methylene diphenyl diisocyanate (MDI) production facilities at the company’s Verbund site in Geismar, Louisiana. Capacity will be increased incrementally from 300,000 metric tons per year to around 600,000 metric tons per year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-374" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-374.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF acknowledged as global leader in water management ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/11/p-16-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 15, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF acknowledged as global leader in water management </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen – November 15, 2016 – BASF is one of the world’s leading companies in sustainable water management and has been included in the “CDP Water A” list for the first time. materials to customers through the HP Multi Jet Fusion Open Platform. The HP Open Platform approach allows customers to select a material supplier, such as BASF, and engage with them directly to develop materials for specific 3D production applications. BASF and HP are now strengthening the collaboration to accelerate the learning cycle on requirements and specifications necessary to develop materials for large-scale production. BASF is committed to integrating the ideas generated from this exchange to speed the development of a variety of new materials for enhanced 3D printing products. On an even broader scope, the company is increasing its activities in developing new material solutions for the 3D printing industry.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 31, 2016 – As a consequence of the fire incident at the North Harbour at BASF SE in Ludwigshafen on October 17, 2016, BASF has to declare Force Majeure on deliveries of dispersions, dispersion powders and hotmelts on acrylic monomer basis (Acronal®, acResin®, Acrodur®, ACROSOL® E 20 D, AQAGloss®, Basonal®, Col.9®, Epotal® and Luhydran®) from class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 29, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Fire at the North Harbor in Ludwigshafen: Employee of BASF fire department dies due to injuries</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">This morning, October 29, 2016, an employee of the BASF fire department who was severely injured during the explosion that occurred at the North Harbor in Ludwigshafen on October 17, 2016, has died. “I am deeply saddened that another employee has passed away due to this tragic accident. Everyone at BASF is in mourning. Our thoughts are with the deceased colleagues, their families and friends,” says Kurt Bock, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-361.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-358" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-358.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Synthetic leather made with Elastollan® makes car seats more comfortable||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 28, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Synthetic leather made with Elastollan® makes car seats more comfortable</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) Elastollan can be extruded onto fabric directly with a non-solvent based technology. The ultra-soft synthetic leather is highly abrasion resistant and helps manufacturers meet the stringent volatile organic compound (VOC) standards for applications such as car seats and furniture.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-335" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-335.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF: Earnings and volumes increase in chemicals business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 27, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF: Earnings and volumes increase in chemicals business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 27, 2016 – In the third quarter of 2016, BASF increased its earnings and volumes in the chemicals business. “Demand from the automotive and construction industries in particular remained robust worldwide. In Europe, we saw moderate growth across all sectors. The summer lull in July and August was less pronounced than in prior years. In Asia, the upward trend continued in the third quarter. Growth in China was slightly higher than we had expected at the beginning of the year. Demand in North America developed modestly; however, we experienced continued positive momentum in the automotive and construction industries. Economic development in South America remained weak and business confidence low. Volumes decreased, especially in Brazil, our largest market in the region,” said Dr. Hans-Ulrich Engel, Chief Financial Officer of BASF SE.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-335.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-359" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-359.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Update: Fire at the North Harbor in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-359.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 27, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Update: Fire at the North Harbor in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On Monday, October 17, 2016, there was an explosion and subsequent fires at the North Harbor in Ludwigshafen. “We mourn two colleagues from the fire department and the seaman who died in the fire. Our deepest sympathy is with their families and friends. Many people were injured, some of them severely. Our thoughts are with them and their families and friends. We hope that they are on the way to recovery,” said Dr. Kurt Bock, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF at a press conference in Ludwigshafen, Germany.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-359.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-334" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-334.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2016 Press Conference on October 27, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-334.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 24, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice - Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2016 Press Conference on October 27, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will publish its Quarterly Statement 3rd Quarter 2016 on October 27, 2016 at 7:00 a.m. (CEST). data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 14, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Charge air duct made from the high-temperature polyamide Ultramid® Endure BM for blow molding</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Pipes between the turbocharger and the charge air cooler can best be manufactured by blow molding with the BASF high-temperature polyamide Ultramid® Endure D5G3 BM BM (=blow molding). This is demonstrated by the new charge air duct which MANN+HUMMEL has manufactured for the 2.0-liter four-cylinder turbo engine of the BMW Group. The turbocharger with integrated charge air cooler is used e.g. in the BMW 4, 5 and 7 series as well as in the X3, X4 and X5 models.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-326.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-333" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-333.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Hyundai Motor showcase RN30 Concept Car at K Fair||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-333.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 14, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Hyundai Motor showcase RN30 Concept Car at K Fair</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 14, 2016 – A new concept vehicle jointly developed by BASF and Hyundai Motor Company combines key solutions from the chemical industry with purposeful aerodynamic design and specialized high-performance technologies. Sales are €14.0 billion (third quarter 2015: €17.4 billion). Income from operations (EBIT) before special items in the third quarter of 2016 is €1.5 billion (third quarter 2015: €1.6 billion) and EBIT is €1.5 billion (third quarter 2015: €1.9 billion). Preliminary third-quarter earnings of BASF Group and all segments are higher than average analysts’ estimates.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF plans to build a new world-scale plant for vitamin A in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 4, 2016 – BASF has started planning for the construction of a new world-scale plant for vitamin A in Ludwigshafen, Germany. The new facility will increase BASF’s total annual production capacity of vitamin A by 1,500 metric tons. Reference value for this amount is vitamin A acetate with 2.8 million International Units.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/10/p-16-319.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-312" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-312.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Researchers want to produce formaldehyde from CO2||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 29, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Researchers want to produce formaldehyde from CO2</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 29, 2016 – The German Federal Ministry for Education and Research (BMBF) is sponsoring with around €1.5 million a joint research project of BASF SE, Heidelberg University, LMU Munich and hte GmbH as of October. The aim of the project, in which the “Catalysis Research Laboratory” (CaRLa) jointly operated by Heidelberg University and BASF SE will be involved, is to develop catalyst systems allowing the selective hydrogenation of CO2 to formaldehyde.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" CV-12.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-315.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-311" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-311.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to replace acetylene plant in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 28, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to replace acetylene plant in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is building a world-scale production plant for acetylene at its Ludwigshafen site. The plant will start up at the end of 2019 and replace the existing plant. The new facility will have the capacity to produce 90,000 metric tons of acetylene per year and will use the world’s most efficient production process. Around 20 production facilities at the Ludwigshafen site use acetylene as a starting material for many other products and value chains.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-308" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-308.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF inaugurates new PVP production facility in Shanghai, China ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 27, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF inaugurates new PVP production facility in Shanghai, China </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Shanghai, China – September 27, 2016 – BASF celebrated the opening of a new complex for the manufacturing of polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP) located at the BASF site in Shanghai, China. The new plant will produce PVP K30 powder, a polymer used as a base for several applications including pharma excipients, detergents, cosmetics and technical applications.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-304" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-304.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes acquisition of Guangdong Yinfan Chemistry||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-304.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 26, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes acquisition of Guangdong Yinfan Chemistry</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has completed the acquisition of the assets of Guangdong Yinfan Chemistry Co., Ltd. (“Yinfan”) in China. A new legal entity named “BASF Coatings (Guangdong) Co., Ltd.” has been established in Jiangmen, Guangdong Province, to take over and further develop Yinfan’s automotive refinish coatings business.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-304.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-306" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-306.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces Portable Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) Catalyst Addition System for Refinery Catalysts in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-306.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 26, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces Portable Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) Catalyst Addition System for Refinery Catalysts in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has introduced a new patented Portable Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) Catalyst Addition System for Refinery Catalysts. This new system allows refineries to conduct catalyst and Co-Catalyst trials, while minimizing the potential risks of changing to a new catalyst. The system is easy to use, requires only a small plot space, and does not require any special preparations to deliver reliable and precise additions.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-306.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-309" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-309.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF leverages growth opportunities in Asia Pacific||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-309.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 23, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF leverages growth opportunities in Asia Pacific</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">London – September 23, 2016 – At the BASF Roundtable Asia Pacific for investors and analysts in London today, the company presented details on how it aims to grow profitably in the region by building on its strengths. “We are well positioned in Asia Pacific, the world’s largest market for the production and consumption of chemicals. We are leveraging the growth opportunities of the region to contribute to the overall success of BASF Group,” said Sanjeev Gandhi, member of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE and responsible for Asia Pacific.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-309.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-301" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-301.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Aliphatic Elastollan® enables innovative overlays for demanding floor coverings||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-301.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 21, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Aliphatic Elastollan® enables innovative overlays for demanding floor coverings</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Aliphatic TPU Elastollan® from BASF provides the basis for a surface layer solution for manufacturing modular designer floors. The international packaging and paper company Mondi offers this newly developed surface material as a composite comprising a printed decorative support and a thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU) coating. For BASF, this means an expansion of the range of applications for its aliphatic Elastollan grades.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-301.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-302" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-302.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens new Application Technology Center to improve testing of crop protection products||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-302.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 21, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens new Application Technology Center to improve testing of crop protection products</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany – September 21, 2016 – BASF has recently opened a new Application Technology Center at its Crop Protection division headquarters in Limburgerhof, Germany. The facility offers a large-scale commercial sprayer set-up, capable of conducting controlled tests of new crop protection products under realistic farming conditions. The new equipment strengthens BASF’s efforts to develop highly robust formulations and foster an easier, safer, and more efficient application of its products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-302.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-307" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-307.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF's Signature on Osman Gazi Bridge||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-307.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 21, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF's Signature on Osman Gazi Bridge</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Istanbul, Turkey, September 21, 2016 – Constructed in the scope of Gebze-İzmir Highway Project, the Osman Gazi Bridge was opened on July 1, 2016. Innovative solutions based on BASF Construction Chemicals division's global knowledge and experience were used in the construction of the bridge, which has the fourth longest central span in the world with 1,550 meters. Grout, structural repair mortar, adhesives, and injections mortar were provided to the Osman Gazi Bridge, spanning a total length of 2,682 meters.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-307.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-298" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-298.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF is the largest provider of ingredients for natural cosmetics||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-298.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 15, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is the largest provider of ingredients for natural cosmetics</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Düsseldorf, Germany – September 15, 2016 – The COSMOS standard (COSMetic Organic Standard) is one of the most important international standards for natural cosmetics. Until now, the standards of the national cosmetics associations in Europe also applied – above all BDIH (Germany) and Ecocert (France). When they are replaced by the uniform COSMOS standard starting in January 2017, BASF will be ready for the change: more than a 100 of the ingredients developed by BASF for cosmetic and body care products have already been registered with COSMOS</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-298.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-296" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-296.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF intends to acquire Henkel’s professional Western European Building Material Business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-296.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 14, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF intends to acquire Henkel’s professional Western European Building Material Business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen / Düsseldorf, Germany, September 14, 2016 – BASF and Henkel have signed an agreement under which BASF intends to acquire Henkel’s professional Western European flooring, tiling and waterproofing business in order to strengthen its portfolio in Construction Chemicals. The transaction includes Henkel’s flooring business sold under the Thomsit brand and the Thomsit trademark globally. Also part of the transaction is Henkel’s flooring, tiling and waterproofing business in Western Europe, currently sold by specialized retailers or under the Ceresit brand.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-296.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-292" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-292.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF again listed in Dow Jones Sustainability Index||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-292.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 12, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF again listed in Dow Jones Sustainability Index</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 12, 2016 – BASF has again been included in the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI World). This year the company has been especially recognized for its engagement in the areas of materiality assessment, climate strategy and product stewardship. The DJSI World is one of the most renowned sustainability indices. It represents the top 10 percent of the largest 2,500 companies in the S&amp;P Global Broad Market IndexSM based on their sustainability performance.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-292.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-293" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-293.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF realigns caprolactam production in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-293.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 12, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF realigns caprolactam production in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 12, 2016 – BASF is realigning its caprolactam production in Europe and will gradually reduce capacity by 100,000 metric tons to 400,000 metric tons over the next 18 months. In Ludwigshafen, parts of the caprolactam production as well as plants producing the precursors anolone and oleum will be closed.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-293.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-291" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-291.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands global production capacity of Ultrason®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/09/p-16-291.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 8, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands global production capacity of Ultrason®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Yeosu, Korea – September 8, 2016 – BASF will set up an additional production line for Ultrason® polyarylsulfone at its site in Yeosu, Korea.
