data-tracking-value="news||Tablets are more than just active ingredients||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-149.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 21, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Tablets are more than just active ingredients</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Each year the pharmaceutical industry produces more than 1.3 trillion tablets. These do not only consist of the actual active ingredient, but also of various excipients. They are necessary to ensure that the active ingredient can be absorbed by the body in the right place and at the right time. Depending on requirements they must be formulated and selected. One challenge is the bioavailability.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-149.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/P-IR-basf-completes-capacity-increase-in-geismar" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/P-IR-basf-completes-capacity-increase-in-geismar.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes capacity increase for 1,4-butanediol in Geismar, Louisiana||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/P-IR-basf-completes-capacity-increase-in-geismar.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 18, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes capacity increase for 1,4-butanediol in Geismar, Louisiana</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">FLORHAM PARK, NJ, March 18, 2016 -- BASF completed its two-step capacity expansion for the chemical intermediate 1,4-butanediol (BDO) by approximately 20 percent at its Verbund site in Geismar, Louisiana during the first quarter of 2016. The double-digit million-dollar investment increased production capacity by implementing measures to boost efficiency and improve infrastructure.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/P-IR-basf-completes-capacity-increase-in-geismar.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-157" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-157.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Lumar collaborate in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-157.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 18, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Lumar collaborate in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Carrières sur Seine, France – March 18, 2016 – BASF and Lumar have started an exclusive collaboration in the marketing of specialty amines for the cooling lubricants and metalworking fluids industry in Europe. Lumar will initially market the BASF specialty chemicals for the countries of France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Spain, Italy and Portugal. The products are used in various types of metal processing applications in the industrial sector.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-157.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-151" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-151.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF reaches major milestone in the global  development of its new fungicide Revysol®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-151.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 17, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF reaches major milestone in the global  development of its new fungicide Revysol®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany – March 17, 2016 – BASF has submitted the regulatory dossier for a new active ingredient, Revysol®, to the European Union (EU). The proprietary compound is expected to be the company’s new blockbuster fungicide from the chemical class of triazoles (SBI). Extensive research has shown its outstanding biological performance against a range of difficult to control pathogens. Revysol’s submission for registration in the EU marks a key milestone towards the compound’s global registration in row and specialty crops.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-151.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-155" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-155.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||From biomass to dispersions: For the first time BASF produces binders for interior paints based on the mass balance process||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-155.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 17, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">From biomass to dispersions: For the first time BASF produces binders for interior paints based on the mass balance process</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">For the first time ever BASF is producing dispersions for interior paints based on the mass balance approach. To manufacture the binders of the Acronal® brand, the company replaces one hundred percent of the fossil resources used at the beginning of the production process with renewable raw materials. The paint producer DAW from Ober-Ramstadt (in Hesse, Germany) is already using one of these dispersions for its premium paints.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-155.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-158" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-158.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF supports Pflüger TOB GmbH to develop new window and door installation ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-158.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 17, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF supports Pflüger TOB GmbH to develop new window and door installation </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The company Pflüger TOB GmbH, which is based in Obersteinach, Germany, offers a new generation of windowsill connection profiles, substructure insulation profiles and frame extensions, made with BASF’s structural foam Kerdyn® Green FST. The polyamide grades are extremely pure, which means they have hardly any electrically active or corrosion-generating contents and are resistant to heat aging.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-143.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-142" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-142.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Optimal combination of lightweight construction, mass production and cost-effectiveness||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-142.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://dynamicassets.basf.com/is/image/basf/P142_Cavus_Elastolit:16x9?dpr=off&amp;fmt=webp-alpha&amp;fit=crop%2C1&amp;wid=200&amp;hei=113" height="0" width="0" class="rendition ls-is-cached lazyloaded" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 7, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Optimal combination of lightweight construction, mass production and cost-effectiveness</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">This year’s winner in the RTM category at the JEC World Innovation Awards shows how hollow parts can be mass-produced in an automated process at competitive prices. This trade fair is considered one of the world's most important exhibitions for specialty materials.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/03/p-16-139.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-138" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-138.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New semiconductor inks for printed electronics in  LCD and OLED displays||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-138.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 29, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New semiconductor inks for printed electronics in  LCD and OLED displays</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Printed electronic circuits will become more efficient in future with new semiconductor inks from BASF. Researchers at BASF have succeeded in improving the composition of the individual semiconductor ink components to double the mobility of the charge carriers in the printed circuits. This allows to further reduce the structures in size and to produce high resolution LCD or OLED screens on plastic substrates.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-138.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-117" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-117.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF: Market environment remains volatile and challenging||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-117.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 26, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF: Market environment remains volatile and challenging</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – February 26, 2016 – The market environment continued to be volatile and challenging. Growth rates for the global economy, industrial production and the chemical industry in 2015 all lagged considerably behind the company’s expectations. “Over the course of the year, global economic growth slowed significantly. In this economic environment, we have taken decisive measures:</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-117.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-136" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-136.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Crop Protection pipeline valued at €3 billion||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-136.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 26, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Crop Protection pipeline valued at €3 billion</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany – February 26, 2016 – BASF now projects its crop protection pipeline to achieve peak sales of €3 billion for products launched between 2015 and 2025. Following its strategy to bring comprehensive solutions to farmers, the company will launch new products for all crop protection indications in row and specialty crops. This promising pipeline is the result of continuous investments in research and development. In 2015 alone, BASF spent €514 million on R&amp;D in the Crop Protection division.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" February 25, 2016 – As part of its regular portfolio review, BASF is refocusing its plant biotechnology research portfolio and will restructure its Plant Science operations. The company will adjust the site footprint of its plant biotechnology research and development network in North America and Europe and intends to reduce approximately 350 positions, thereof 140 positions in North America and 180 in Europe. Currently approximately 700 employees work in plant biotechnology R&amp;D.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-134.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-116" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-116.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Advance Notice Annual Press Conference on February 26, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-116.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 22, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Advance Notice Annual Press Conference on February 26, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On Friday, February 26, 2016, the Annual Press Conference of BASF SE will be held in Ludwigshafen, Germany. The French textile and rubber company Joubert Productions, Ambert, is for the first time putting snow chains on the market whose chain links are made entirely from plastic. This has become possible with Elastollan®, the thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU) from BASF, and BASF’s support in optimizing the component geometry and production.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-129.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-130" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-130.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF intends to sell its global industrial coatings business to AkzoNobel||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-130.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 17, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF intends to sell its global industrial coatings business to AkzoNobel</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany - February 17, 2016 – BASF and AkzoNobel have reached a general agreement on the sale of the industrial coatings business of BASF’s Coatings division to AkzoNobel for €475 million. Existing contractual obligations with customers will not be affected.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-120.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-115" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-115.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF celebrates 125th anniversary of Leather Chemicals business||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-115.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 1, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF celebrates 125th anniversary of Leather Chemicals business</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Singapore – February 1, 2016 – At the India International Leather Fair in Chennai, BASF will celebrate the 125th anniversary of its leather chemicals business. At the show, BASF will mark 125 years of innovation in leather while exhibiting products to help tanneries lower their carbon footprint, as well as their water and energy usage.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/02/p-16-115.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/20160129" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/20160129.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Markor inaugurate new production plant for butanediol in Xinjiang, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/20160129.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 29, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Markor inaugurate new production plant for butanediol in Xinjiang, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – January 29, 2016 – Today BASF and Xinjiang Markor Chemical Industry Co., Ltd. (“Markor”) inaugurated a new butanediol (BDO) plant in Korla, Xinjiang Uygur autonomous region, in Northwest China. The plant, which has an annual capacity of 100,000 tons, is operated by a joint venture between Markor and BASF registered under the name of Markor Meiou Chemical (Xinjiang) Co., Ltd.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/20160129.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-105" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-105.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Flat screens show their true colors ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-105.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 28, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Flat screens show their true colors </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The red color particles of the Irgaphor® Red product suite ensure an excellent image quality of liquid crystal displays. They are used in color filters for notebook, computer and television screens. BASF has succeeded in manufacturing the latest generation with a particle size of less than 40 nanometers. The tiny particles enable considerably less scattering of light in the color filter. This leads to a sharp, pure-colored, high-contrast and thus brilliant image.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-105.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-112" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-112.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF publishes report about 2015's most popular automotive colors||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 28, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF publishes report about 2015's most popular automotive colors</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In BASF's European Color Report for Automotive OEM Coating, BASF's Coatings division has presented the color distribution for 2015. BASF, Europe's market leader for color development for automotive OEM coating, provides detailed evidence for the consumers' favorite colors. For example, the report shows that there are distinct differences between the individual automotive segments with respect to color. The smaller the car, the wider the color range, while larger cars more frequently feature special effects.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-111" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-111.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Lower price forecasts for oil and gas lead to impairments in EBIT of BASF Group in 2015||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-111.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 27, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lower price forecasts for oil and gas lead to impairments in EBIT of BASF Group in 2015</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 27, 2016 – BASF herewith announces preliminary, non-audited figures for 2015. As forecast by BASF, sales and income from operations (EBIT) before special items for the full year 2015 are slightly below the level of the previous year. Sales decline by 5% to €70.4 billion (2014: €74.3 billion). EBIT before special items in 2015 is expected to be €6.7 billion (2014: €7.4 billion). For the full year 2015, EBIT of BASF Group is expected to be €6.2 billion. This significant decline compared with the level of the previous year (2014: €7.6 billion) is mainly due to impairments in the Oil &amp; Gas segment. The company had previously expected only slightly lower EBIT in the full year 2015. The reason for the impairments in the Oil &amp; Gas segment is the strong decline in oil and gas prices in the past months.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-111.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" Since 2005, three ingredients from the program have been commercialized: an organic and fair-trade certified oil (Lipofructyl™ Argan), a skin-tightening protein extract from oil cakes (Argatensyl™), and an anti-aging extract from the leaves of the argan tree that protects the skin from environmental factors (Arganyl™).</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-103.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-104" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-104.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF drives innovative design through high- performance materials at CHINAPLAS 2016||/global/en/media/news-releases/2016/01/p-16-104.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 11, 2016</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF drives innovative design through high- performance materials at CHINAPLAS 2016</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – January 11, 2016 – At CHINAPLAS 2016, BASF will exclusively co-host the “Design x Innovation” event, showcasing innovations that demonstrate the power of high-performance materials to enable high-performance design. class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 17, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF building products in new office building D 105 at Ludwigshafen site </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The office building D 105 in Ludwigshafen has a total area of around 35,000 m² over seven floors and offers work stations for about 1,300 staff plus a conference center with state-of-the-art event equipment. "A large number of BASF products were used on the new building, all of which meet the requirements of modern workspaces and have a number of different applications," says Cristobal Garrido Segura, architect and expert for construction systems at the European Construction Competence Center of BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-431.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-430" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-430.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives “Design for Asia Awards 2015” for coatings color trend book||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-430.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives “Design for Asia Awards 2015” for coatings color trend book</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 16, 2015 – BASF has been recognized at the “Design for Asia Awards 2015” for the latest edition of its annual color trend book, “RAW”. The book, published by BASF’s coatings division, makes color trends and colors tangible for automotive designers in the region and around the world.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-430.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-426" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-426.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF strengthens business with wood binders||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-426.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 11, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF strengthens business with wood binders</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">On January 1, 2016, BASF will combine the marketing and development of its wood binders of the Kaurit®, Kauramin®, and Lupranat® brands. This is in response to the needs of the wood-working industry. BASF customers will benefit from a single source for all adhesive systems. BASF is the only supplier in the world to offer both amino resin-based and isocyanate-based wood binders. Previously, customers have had to deal with two separate sales units.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-426.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-423" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-423.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to sell its masterbatch subsidiary company Magenta Master Fibers to PolyOne||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-423.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 9, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to sell its masterbatch subsidiary company Magenta Master Fibers to PolyOne</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 9, 2015 – BASF has signed a contract to divest its subsidiary company Magenta Master Fibers s.r.l. (MMF) located in Magenta, Italy, including MMF’s wholly owned subsidiary in Shanghai, China (Magenta Master Fibers Co., Ltd.), to PolyOne Corporation, a leading global provider of specialized polymer materials, services and solutions based in Cleveland, Ohio. The transaction was closed today.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-423.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-420" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-420.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF strengthening global network for pigment production ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-420.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 7, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF strengthening global network for pigment production </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is strengthening its global production network for pigments with two new investments. At the site in Nanjing, China, the company has increased its production capacities for high-performance diketopyrrolopyrrole pigments (DPP). In Ludwigshafen, BASF is going to expand its capacities for the production of versatile alpha blue pigments, which are particularly characterized by their excellent fastness properties, by the fall of 2016.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-420.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-421" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-421.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to transfer the operation of its data centers to Hewlett Packard Enterprise||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/12/p-15-421.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">December 7, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to transfer the operation of its data centers to Hewlett Packard Enterprise</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – December 7, 2015 – BASF is transferring the operation of its two data centers at the Ludwigshafen site as well as its hub locations and on-site server rooms worldwide to Hewlett Packard Enterprise. This aims to ensure that the services are provided competitively in an environment that is characterized by rapid technological changes. BASF SE and Hewlett-Packard GmbH, a German subsidiary of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, signed a corresponding contract today (December 7, 2015). Hewlett Packard Enterprise is a global provider of IT products and services.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" Wintershall has a 15 percent share.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-WH-15-1130.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-407" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-407.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF auctions “MySetta” classic car for €26,099 ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-407.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 27, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF auctions “MySetta” classic car for €26,099 </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF’s concept car MySetta was handed over today to its new owner. The historic BMW microcar was purchased for €26,099 in an eBay auction. BASF is rounding up this figure to €30,000 and donating the entire sum to the child rights organization Save the Children, which has partnered with BASF on various projects. The project partnership was agreed upon at the Creator Space tour stop in Mumbai. The Creator Space tour is a cornerstone of BASF’s anniversary celebrations.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-407.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-413" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-413.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to expand compounding capacities for engineering plastics in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-413.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 27, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to expand compounding capacities for engineering plastics in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is expanding the compounding capacities for engineering plastics in Europe. Presumably from 2017 it will be possible to additionally produce up to 70,000 metric tons per year of Ultramid® (PA: polyamide) and Ultradur® (PBT: polybutylene terephthalate) at the Schwarzheide site, Germany. Around 50 new jobs will be created. This is another step in the capacity expansions which BASF is undertaking because of the increasing demand for engineering plastics around the world.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-413.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-410" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-410.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF announces winners of the open innovation contest on energy storage ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-410.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 24, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF announces winners of the open innovation contest on energy storage </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – November 24, 2015 – The winners of the BASF Energy Contest were announced today at the “Creator SpaceTM Summit” in Ludwigshafen. From 122 applications submitted on the online platform NineSights, a jury of BASF experts and external specialists chose the four best proposals which will be funded with €100.000 each.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-410.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-411" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-411.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF promotes the first Farm Network conference to discuss and exchange best practices for sustainable farming ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-411.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 24, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF promotes the first Farm Network conference to discuss and exchange best practices for sustainable farming </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Limburgerhof, Germany – November 24, 2015 – Today, BASF gathered experts from six European countries to advance the knowledge of best farming practices and spread them across key stakeholder groups. ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-392.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 9, 2015</span></div><h3 Ludwigshafen, Germany – November 9, 2015 – BASF is participating with $4 million through BASF Venture Capital in the U.S. technology firm QD Vision Inc., Lexington, Massachusetts. QD Vision is a technology leader for quantum dots, a class of nanomaterials with unique electro-optical properties and a wide range of applications in display, lighting, photo-voltaic, sensors, and diagnostics. QD Vision has developed and commercialized performance and cost-leading quantum dot-based components that enable a significantly improved color gamut of Liquid Crystal Displays (LCD) at minimal incremental cost.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-392.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-398" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-398.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands scope of innovation in Asia Pacific ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-398.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 9, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands scope of innovation in Asia Pacific </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – November 9, 2015 – BASF is substantially expanding the scope of its research and development (R&amp;D) capabilities in Asia Pacific, with a series of initiatives to bring innovation closer to customers in the region. Overall, BASF aims to locate around a quarter of its global R&amp;D activities in Asia Pacific.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-398.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-390" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-390.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||High-quality and safe: New Elastollan® grades for food contact applications||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-390.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 5, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">High-quality and safe: New Elastollan® grades for food contact applications</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is expanding its Elastollan® portfolio (TPU, thermoplastic polyurethane) to include special Food Contact (FC) grades which are suitable for use in applications involving contact with food. The new Elastollan portfolio, which is produced using the GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) system of quality assurance, comprises numerous ether- and ester-based grades. They can be used in a wide range of injection-molding and extrusion applications – from conveyor belts, films and fabrics through to hoses.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-390.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-393" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-393.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF starts up production plant for specialty amines in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 5, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF starts up production plant for specialty amines in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, November 5, 2015 – BASF in Ludwigshafen has started up a world-scale plant for the production of specialty amines. The multi-product plant can manufacture approximately 12,000 metric tons per year of a product range of about 15 amines for different applications. Owing to its high flexibility, the plant can also be used for the production of new specialty amines. The major applications are currently in the construction, automotive, crop protection and pharmaceutical industries. With the new facility, BASF expands its global production network for amines with plants in Ludwigshafen and Schwarzheide in Germany; Antwerp, Belgium; Geismar, North America; and Nanjing, China.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-393.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-395" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-395.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||MasterSeal® M 689 – new waterproofing solutions for the chemical and pharmaceutical industries ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 5, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">MasterSeal® M 689 – new waterproofing solutions for the chemical and pharmaceutical industries </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – November 05, 2015 – In chemical and pharmaceutical industries, environmentally hazardous chemicals and liquids are frequently an indispensable part of the production process. They require special measures for safe storage and handling. Additionally – in order to prevent pollution of soil and water – secondary containment is required by national laws to control eventual liquid spillages to protect the environment. Especially for this purpose Master Builders Solutions by BASF offers waterproofing solutions also for complex industrial structures.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-395.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-394" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-394.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF leading in climate protection reporting worldwide||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-394.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 4, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF leading in climate protection reporting worldwide</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">According to CDP, an international organization that compiles climate relevant information from companies, BASF is among the leading companies in climate protection reporting worldwide. With the maximally achievable transparency rating, the company achieved a leading position among German DAX companies and in the sector Energy &amp; Materials. BASF is listed in the Climate Disclosure Leadership Index (CDLI) for the eleventh time.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-394.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-356" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-356.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes divestiture of paper hydrous kaolin business to Imerys||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-356.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">November 2, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes divestiture of paper hydrous kaolin business to Imerys</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany/Gordon, Georgia – November 2, 2015 – BASF has closed the previously announced transaction to divest its global paper hydrous kaolin (PHK) business to Imerys, a producer of mineral-based specialty solutions for industry, based in Paris, France. Under a tolling agreement of limited duration, BASF will continue to manufacture and supply PHK products to Imerys to enable a smooth transition for customers. Included in the transaction is a kaolin milling facility in Wilkinson County, Georgia referred to as the “Gibraltar mill”.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/11/p-15-356.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-385" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-385.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Palusol® fire-protection panels with new epoxy resin coating||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-385.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 29, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Palusol® fire-protection panels with new epoxy resin coating</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has developed a new epoxy resin which improves the properties of the Palusol® fire-protection panels. EBITDA increased by €358 million to €2.9 billion, mainly due to higher depreciation. In contrast, income from operations (EBIT) before special items declined by €171 million to €1.6 billion. In the Chemicals segment, EBIT before special items rose slightly, while it increased sharply in the Functional Materials &amp; Solutions segment. In the remaining segments, earnings declined significantly.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-369.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-383" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-383.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF presents its “Inspirations for Leather – Edition Tirreno” Spring/Summer 2017 color trends ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-383.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 26, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF presents its “Inspirations for Leather – Edition Tirreno” Spring/Summer 2017 color trends </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Singapore – October 26, 2015 – BASF presents its new “Inspirations for Leather” brochure outlining four leather trends for the Spring/Summer 2017 season, under the name “Edition Tirreno”. The meeting provides space for co-creation and innovation, sparking reflection and knowledge about this topic. From October 27 to 30, visitors to Hall 5, Stand K32 can see just how BASF‘s PU/TPU solutions offer greater comfort in safety shoes.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-379.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-381" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-381.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New site agreement for BASF SE||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-381.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 21, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New site agreement for BASF SE</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 21, 2015 – Company and employee representatives at BASF SE in Ludwigshafen signed a new site agreement today. The agreement, titled “Meeting the challenges of constant change together,” applies to the approximately 36,000 employees of BASF SE at the site. It will run for five years (from January 1, 2016 until December 31, 2020) and follows on from the existing site agreement, which expires at the end of 2015.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-381.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-377" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-377.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands its range of specialty amines||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 20, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands its range of specialty amines</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has strengthened its comprehensive range of amines with a new product: the cycloaliphatic diamine Methylcyclohexyldiamine (MCDA), which the company markets under the brand name Baxxodur® EC210. Used as an aminic hardener in epoxy resin-based systems (epoxy systems), Baxxodur EC210 improves, for example, the manufacturing of rotor blades for wind power plants and coatings for industrial floors and bridges. BASF is currently researching additional application areas of Baxxodur EC210.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-377.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-374" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-374.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF opens construction chemicals production facility in Lagos, Nigeria||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 15, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF opens construction chemicals production facility in Lagos, Nigeria</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lagos, Nigeria – October 15, 2015 – BASF yesterday inaugurated its new production plant for concrete admixtures in Lagos, Nigeria. The production site is BASF’s answer to the increasing demand for construction chemicals in western Africa.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-374.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-373" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-373.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||SEPAWA 2015: BASF Presents New Solutions for Resource-efficient Detergents and Cleaners as well as Personal Care Products||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 14, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">SEPAWA 2015: BASF Presents New Solutions for Resource-efficient Detergents and Cleaners as well as Personal Care Products</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 14, 2015 – At the 62nd SEPAWA Congress in Fulda/Germany, BASF will present its latest solutions for applications in the Home Care and Industrial &amp; Institutional Cleaning (I&amp;I) and Personal Care markets from October 14 to 16. The chemical company will share booths 200-202 and 250-254 with its European sales company BTC. In the year of BASF’s 150th anniversary, the focus is on new products and concepts that contribute to more sustainable detergents and cleaners as well as personal care products, in line with the corporate mission “We create chemistry for a sustainable future.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-373.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-375" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-375.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Presents New Types of the Readily Biodegradable Chelating Agent Trilon® M ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-375.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 14, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Presents New Types of the Readily Biodegradable Chelating Agent Trilon® M </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 14, 2015 – At the SEPAWA Congress 2015, BASF will present new types of the readily biodegradable chelating agent Trilon® M, which has established itself in the market as the high-performance phosphate alternative for automatic dishwashing detergents. EU regulations stipulate that phosphate will be virtually prohibited for this application in Europe from 2017. In the US, 16 states have already banned phosphate in this application since 2010.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-375.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-372" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-372.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Distinguished at the IAA: Special effect paint by BASF succeeds at the Automotive Brand Contest||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-372.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 13, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Distinguished at the IAA: Special effect paint by BASF succeeds at the Automotive Brand Contest</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">When carmakers present their latest models, particular value is placed on perfect gloss and a gleaming shine. The color designers adjust the color palette according to the respective model range or develop individual color concepts.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-372.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-CI-15-1013" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-CI-15-1013.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF presents extensive portfolio of ingredients and solutions for the pharmaceutical and consumer health industries at CPhI worldwide||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-CI-15-1013.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 13, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF presents extensive portfolio of ingredients and solutions for the pharmaceutical and consumer health industries at CPhI worldwide</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF creates chemistry for a sustainable future offering intelligent solutions to the pharmaceutical and consumer health industries. The Volkswagen Group is using the front end carrier made from the BASF plastic Ultramid® in the new Passat and Sharan models – after the integration in the Golf VII where in 2013 a polypropylene/steel hybrid part was replaced with an all-plastic part made from Ultramid® B3WG8. In this way, the front end carriers are considerably lighter than the previous models.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-320.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-361" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-361.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and SINOPEC inaugurate world-scale isononanol plant in Maoming, China ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-361.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 12, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and SINOPEC inaugurate world-scale isononanol plant in Maoming, China </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Maoming, China – October 12, 2015 – BASF and China Petroleum &amp; Chemical Corporation (SINOPEC) today inaugurated their world-scale isononanol (INA) plant in Maoming Hi-tech Industrial Development Zone, Maoming, China. The plant will be run by BASF MPCC Company Limited (BMC), which is a 50-50 joint venture between BASF and SINOPEC. It has an annual capacity of 180,000 metric tons. This is the first INA plant in China and will serve the growing demand for next-generation plasticizers.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-361.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-364" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-364.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF/Wintershall and Gazprom celebrate 25-year partnership||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-364.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 12, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF/Wintershall and Gazprom celebrate 25-year partnership</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF/Wintershall and Gazprom have already been cooperating successfully for a quarter of a century: The two companies laid the foundations for their cooperation in autumn 1990 with a long-term agreement to market Russian natural gas in Germany.
