From October 13-17, 2015, stand 4306 in hall B4 will be totally dedicated to engineering plastics, polyurethanes and master batch preparations.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-352.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-353" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-353.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes sale of custom synthesis business and parts of its API business to Siegfried Holding AG||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-353.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 1, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes sale of custom synthesis business and parts of its API business to Siegfried Holding AG</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – October 1, 2015 – BASF has completed the previously announced sale of its pharma custom synthesis business and parts of its active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) business to Siegfried Holding AG. The relevant merger control approvals have already been granted. Effective October 1, 2015, Siegfried Holding AG takes over the operational management of the businesses.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-353.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-358" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-358.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands production capacities of innovative biological solutions for agriculture and horticulture||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">October 1, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands production capacities of innovative biological solutions for agriculture and horticulture</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Littlehampton, United Kingdom – October 1, 2015 – With the opening of its expanded Littlehampton, UK production site, BASF is strengthening its ability to sustainably meet the growing global demand for biological solutions for agriculture and horticulture. At this site, BASF increases its production volumes of beneficial nematodes and inoculants, moving ahead with its strategy to develop solutions beyond conventional crop protection.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/10/p-15-358.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-351" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-351.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF sets global goals for diversity in leadership team ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-351.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 30, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF sets global goals for diversity in leadership team </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has set itself global goals for the promotion of diversity in its management team. By 2021, the company aims to raise the overall proportion of women in positions with disciplinary leadership responsibilities from today’s 19% to 22%–24% globally, a share that reflects the percentage of women in BASF’s global workforce. In light of the relatively low turnover rate in the BASF Group’s leadership team, this is an ambitious goal.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 18, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Where electricity and cars meet</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is expanding its range of engineering plastics for the dynamic market of electric and hybrid vehicles. Tailor-made Ultramid® and Ultradur® materials are now available globally for high-voltage plug-in connectors like the ones which TE Connectivity has developed from various Ultramid® grades for numerous automotive companies with BASF. They save on weight and installation space around the battery and at the same time help to improve safety in e-mobility.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-318.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-342" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-342.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Cooperation for greater cybersecurity in Germany||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-342.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 18, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cooperation for greater cybersecurity in Germany</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Industry and policymakers are planning closer cooperation in the future in order to improve cybersecurity. To this end, Volkswagen, Allianz, BASF and Bayer intend to establish the “DCSO Deutsche Cyber-Sicherheitsorganisation GmbH” (German Cybersecurity Organization). This competence center is to operate as the preferred cybersecurity service provider for companies in Germany.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-342.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-337" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-337.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Energized: SEMIKRON manufactures power semiconductor modules from Ultradur®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-337.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Energized: SEMIKRON manufactures power semiconductor modules from Ultradur®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Since the beginning of 2015, the flame-retardant polybutylene terephthalate (PBT) Ultradur® B4450 G5 from BASF has been used in the mass production of the MiniSKiiP Dual power semiconductor modules from the company SEMIKRON. The flame retardant system used in the PBT contains no halogen and complies with the Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS). Application examples of power semiconductor modules (or DC/AC converters) are in industrial drive technology, solar inverters, or in the powertrain of electric vehicles. Developing heat is dissipated from the modules by metallic heat sinks. This prevents any rise in temperature and helps to ensure an optimum operating temperature. The power semiconductors are protected from external influences such as moisture, dirt, and fluctuations in temperature by a housing made from the thermoplastic Ultradur®.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-337.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-338" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-339" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-339.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF holds global Science Symposium in Shanghai to explore future urban living||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-339.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF holds global Science Symposium in Shanghai to explore future urban living</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – September 16, 2015 – By 2050, more than 70% of the world population will live in cities. This has created the pressing need for new solutions for daily life. Leading scientists and urban planning experts will gather at BASF’s Creator Space™ Science Symposium on November 10 and 11, 2015, in Shanghai, China to provide latest insights into the area of sustainable urban living.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-339.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-340" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-340.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Basotect® reduces the noise in modern, high speed elevators||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-340.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Basotect® reduces the noise in modern, high speed elevators</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Basotect® melamine foam, which is widely known as a lightweight acoustic insulation material in automotive and interior construction applications, is expanding its application range into the acoustic treatment of elevators. In a recent project with ThyssenKrupp Elevator and National Elevator Cab and Door, the melamine foam was used to reduce the noise levels in elevator cabins of a high rise building in New York City. Despite the very high speed of the elevators (up to 23 miles/hour), the noise level inside the cabin is lower than 50dB, which is quieter than a conversation between two people.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-340.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/capacit-expansion-tba-nanjing" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/capacit-expansion-tba-nanjing.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes capacity expansion for tertiary Butylamine in Nanjing, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/capacit-expansion-tba-nanjing.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 14, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes capacity expansion for tertiary Butylamine in Nanjing, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Nanjing, China – September 14, 2015 – BASF has completed a major capacity expansion at its tertiary Butylamine (tBA) plant at Nanjing Chemical Industry Park in China. The tBA plant now has an annual production capacity of 16,000 tons, representing an increase of 60 percent from its initial annual capacity of 10,000 tons. The expansion enables BASF to meet the growing demand of tire additives in China and Asia Pacific. It further strengthens BASF’s leading position as a global supplier to the rubber and tire industry. In addition to the plant in Nanjing, BASF produces tBA in Geismar, Louisiana, United States, and in Antwerp, Belgium.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/capacit-expansion-tba-nanjing.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-332" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-332.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and top universities jointly develop new process improving the bioavailability of active ingredients||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-332.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 14, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and top universities jointly develop new process improving the bioavailability of active ingredients</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 14, 2015 – In collaboration with researchers from the renowned universities Harvard, EPFL (Switzerland), and Yale, BASF scientists developed a new process that makes amorphous nanoparticles with increased solubility. This improves the efficient uptake of drugs, for example, in the human body. Without such processing drug molecules would arrange in the form of crystals, which are difficult to dissolve. Due to poor solubility in many cases the development of innovative drugs has been discontinued.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-332.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-317" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-317.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||World's first top mount with polyurethane bearing and polyamide housing||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-317.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 10, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">World's first top mount with polyurethane bearing and polyamide housing</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is now expanding its expertise in top mounts to enable car manufacturers an optimum combination of weight savings, pleasant acoustics and vibration damping. The unique solution is made possible by combining two of BASF's plastic specialties: the polyurethane elastomer Cellasto® and the polyamide Ultramid® A3WG10 CR. The top mount with the Cellasto® element and the Ultramid® housing is around 25 percent lighter than conventional aluminum die-cast versions with rubber.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-317.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-336" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-336.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF again listed in Dow Jones Sustainability Index||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 10, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF again listed in Dow Jones Sustainability Index</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – September 10, 2015 – BASF was today again included in the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI World). The company has been especially recognized for its engagement in the areas of innovation management, environmental and social reporting, product stewardship and human capital development. The DJSI World is one of the most renowned sustainability indices and represents the top 10 percent of the largest 2,500 companies included in the Dow Jones Global Index.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-336.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-330" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-330.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Gazprom agree to complete asset swap||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-330.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 4, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Gazprom agree to complete asset swap</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Moscow, Russia – September 4, 2015 – BASF and Gazprom have agreed to complete the swap of assets with equivalent value signed in December 2013 and originally intended to be completed by the end of 2014. With the swap, BASF will further expand its production of oil and gas and will exit the gas trading and storage business. The completion of the asset swap is expected by the end of 2015 and, as agreed upon in December 2013, will be financially retroactive to April 1, 2013. The swap was already approved by the European Commission at the beginning of December 2013.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-330.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-334" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-334.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Gazprom, BASF, E.ON, ENGIE, OMV and Shell sign Shareholders’ Agreement on the Nord Stream 2 project||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-334.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 4, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Gazprom, BASF, E.ON, ENGIE, OMV and Shell sign Shareholders’ Agreement on the Nord Stream 2 project</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Today at the Eastern Economic Forum in Vladivostok, Alexey Miller, Chairman of the Gazprom Management Committee, Kurt Bock, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE, Klaus Schäfer, Member of the Board of Management, E.ON SE, Pierre Chareyre, Executive vice-president of ENGIE, Rainer Seele, Chairman of the Executive Board of OMV and Ben van Beurden, Chief Executive Officer of Royal Dutch Shell signed a Shareholders’ Agreement on implementation of the Nord Stream 2 pipeline project to enhance supply of natural gas to the European Union’s market. The project will be developed by the new project company New European Pipeline AG. According to the document, Gazprom will own a 51 per cent share in the project company. E.ON, Shell, OMV and BASF/Wintershall will each own ten per cent and ENGIE will hold nine per cent.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-15-334.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-WH-15-0904" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-WH-15-0904.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Plan for Development and Operation for Maria approved||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/09/p-WH-15-0904.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">September 4, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Plan for Development and Operation for Maria approved</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Oslo. Wintershall and its partners Petoro and Centrica have today received approval by the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy for the plan for development and operation (PDO) for the Maria development, offshore Norway. Germany’s largest internationally active crude oil and natural gas producer submitted the PDO to the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy on May 5. The approved development solution for the Maria field involves two subsea templates located on the ocean floor tied back to several host installations in the area.</div><div Various different fluids are also essential for a smooth driving experience. Many of these fluids contain BASF products. They lessen the effects of wear and tear, reduce costs of running and maintenance and increase driving safety.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-312.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-321" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-321.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF features its desalination portfolio for sustainable water treatment at IDA World Congress 2015||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-321.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 19, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF features its desalination portfolio for sustainable water treatment at IDA World Congress 2015</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – August 19, 2015 – At booth 1341, BASF is showcasing its comprehensive range of sustainable water treatment solutions dedicated to the desalination industry at the World Congress of the International Desalination Association (IDA) being held in San Diego, California, USA, August 30 - September 4, 2015.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-321.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-308" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-308.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle food waste and crop losses||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 17, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle food waste and crop losses</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">São Paulo, Brazil, August 17, 2015 – BASF is hosting a week-long program in São Paulo, Brazil, to address one of the world’s most pressing future challenges: how to reduce food waste and crop losses to feed an ever-growing world population. Each year, roughly one-third of the food produced for human consumption gets lost or wasted globally – this amounts to about 1.3 billion metric tons. To identify sustainable and innovative solutions to tackle this challenge, thought leaders, scientists, industry experts, students and citizens are participating in the Creator Space™ tour stop in São Paulo. The program will take place at the Brazilian Museum of Sculpture (MuBE). It is the fourth stop of BASF’s Creator Space tour – a year-long, global event series launched by BASF in its 150th anniversary year.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-308.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-311" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-311.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF with know-how for sustainable mobility at the IAA Cars 2015||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 14, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF with know-how for sustainable mobility at the IAA Cars 2015</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">At this year’s IAA Cars, Germany, BASF shows how automotive manufacturers can save weight and reduce emissions as well as improve safety, comfort and fuel efficiency with innovative plastics, catalysts and battery materials. From September 15 to 18, trade show visitors have the possibility to see for themselves in hall 4.1 the variety of functional materials and solutions for the mobility of the present and the future by means of showcase components for chassis, powertrain, interior and exterior.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-311.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-313" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-313.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Honeycomb on the car roof||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 12, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Honeycomb on the car roof</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With the polyurethane foam system Elastoflex® E from BASF it is possible for the first time to mass-produce an exterior car part featuring a honeycomb sandwich structure with a class-A film. The roof module in the new smart fortwo consists of a paper honeycomb and two surrounding glass fiber mats. These are sprayed with Elastoflex® E 3532 and pressed together with a solid-colored class-A film. A single operation thus produces a roof module which is around 30 percent lighter than the standard roof on the previous model.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-313.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-316" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-316.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF inaugurates new resin plant in Shanghai, China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-316.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 12, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF inaugurates new resin plant in Shanghai, China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF today (12 August 2015) inaugurated its new resin and electrocoat plant at the Shanghai Chemical Industry Park (SCIP) in Shanghai. In line with BASF’s approach to stay close to customers worldwide, this new plant will further strengthen BASF’s local manufacturing footprint in Asia Pacific and create close to 70 new jobs at the site.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-316.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-306" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-306.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF increases production capacity for chelating agents in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-306.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 11, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF increases production capacity for chelating agents in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – August 11, 2015 – BASF is investing in the expansion and flexibilization of its production facilities to manufacture chelating agents at its site in Ludwigshafen. By increasing the production capacity, the company is responding to the rapidly growing global demand for its chelating agents, such as the readily biodegradable Trilon® M (methylglycinediacetic acid) for use in detergents and cleaners. The project is scheduled for completion by the end of 2016.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-306.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-304" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-304.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Neopolen® P reFLAM meets fire safety requirements of the aviation industry for applications in aircraft||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-304.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 5, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Neopolen® P reFLAM meets fire safety requirements of the aviation industry for applications in aircraft</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The expanded polypropylene foam Neopolen® P reFLAM was tested in an institution certified by the aviation industry, in accordance with the specification CS25.853, and is approved for molding densities from 36g/l to 75g/l in accordance with applicable requirements. The certification allows Neopolen® P reFLAM to be used in numerous applications with the highest fire safety requirements, particularly those found in the aviation sector.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-304.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-305" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-305.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF color designers present automotive color trends for the coming years||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/08/p-15-305.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">August 5, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF color designers present automotive color trends for the coming years</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF's new trend collection is entitled RAW. The title aims to convey the designers' expectation to do more than create new automotive colors. The designers at BASF's Coatings division set out to design essential color concepts. The 2015-2016 BASF collection features approaches for the display of social trends and translates them into distinctive colors. He will report to Sanjeev Gandhi, member of the Board of BASF SE responsible for the region Asia Pacific. Meier succeeds Christian Schubert (51), who will become head of BASF’s Berlin office as of November 1, 2015, following a three-month sabbatical. Schubert will report to Elisabeth Schick, Senior Vice President, Communications &amp; Government Relations BASF Group. The current head of the Berlin office, Wolfgang Niedermark (50), has decided to leave the company effective September 30, 2015.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-301.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-300" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-300.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Yara and BASF break ground on new ammonia plant in Freeport, Texas||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-300.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 27, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Yara and BASF break ground on new ammonia plant in Freeport, Texas</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">OSLO, NORWAY, and FLORHAM PARK/NEW JERSEY, July 27, 2015 -- Yara International ASA and BASF broke ground today on a world scale ammonia plant at the BASF site in Freeport, Texas. Total capital investment for the plant – which is expected to come online in 2017 – is estimated at $600 million. As part of the project, Yara will build an ammonia tank at the BASF terminal and BASF will upgrade its current terminal and pipeline assets for the export of ammonia from the new plant.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-300.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-290" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-290.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF increases sales and earnings slightly in the second quarter||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-290.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 24, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF increases sales and earnings slightly in the second quarter</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – July 24, 2015 – “In the second quarter of 2015, we improved our sales and earnings despite lower growth in some markets and continuing volatile raw material prices. data-tracking-value="news||BASF inaugurates new research building in Ludwigshafen||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-284.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF inaugurates new research building in Ludwigshafen</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – July 16, 2015 – BASF today inaugurated a new research building in Ludwigshafen after two years of construction. The building in the south of the Ludwigshafen site accommodates around 200 employees of the research division Advanced Materials &amp; Systems Research who have so far worked in different buildings in Ludwigshafen. The laboratories and offices in the seven-storey building account for a total surface area of approximately 11,000 square meters, the construction costs amount to around €50 million.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-284.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-287" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-287.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Created by color experts for automotive designers: BASF Coatings' Global Trend Book||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-287.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Created by color experts for automotive designers: BASF Coatings' Global Trend Book</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Inspiration and information: Every year, BASF Coatings' Global Trend Book presents 65 new trend colors for automotive OEM coating. In addition to original color samples from the new paint collection, it also offers the carmakers' designers in-depth background information about the trends and their developments.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-287.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-279" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-279.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF commissions one of Europe’s most advanced production plants for form release agents||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-279.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 14, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF commissions one of Europe’s most advanced production plants for form release agents</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Staßfurt, Germany, July 14, 2015 – Supporting the increasing demand for ecologically sound and user friendly products, BASF commissioned a new production plant for form release agents that is among the most advanced and most efficient in Europe. Opened at the company’s in Staßfurt site in May 2015, the new facility produces release agents based on renewable raw materials as well as emulsions from renewable and non renewable raw materials. Successful trial operation was completed in early July 2015, and the plant has since commenced regular production.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-279.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-281" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-281.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Poietis sign a research and development agreement on 3D bioprinting technology for advanced skin care applications||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-281.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 10, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Poietis sign a research and development agreement on 3D bioprinting technology for advanced skin care applications</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany / Pessac, France – July 10, 2015 – BASF and Poietis, the first company in the world for 3D laser-assisted bioprinting, have signed an agreement on research and development in cosmetics. Based on the combined expertise of both companies in tissue engineering and bioprinting, the agreement aims to apply the bioprinting technology of Poietis to improve BASF’s skin equivalent model Mimeskin™. The terms and conditions of this agreement were not disclosed.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-281.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-277" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-277.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF Recognized for Excellence by Texas Instruments||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-277.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 7, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF Recognized for Excellence by Texas Instruments</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – July 7, 2015 – BASF received the Texas Instruments (TI) 2014 Supplier Excellence Award during a ceremony held in Ludwigshafen. The award honors companies whose dedication and commitment in supplying products and services meet TI’s high standards for excellence. BASF, receiving the award in the Chemicals category, was recognized by TI for its exemplary performance in the areas of Environmental &amp; Social Responsibility, Technology, Responsiveness, Assurance of Supply, and Quality.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-277.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-276" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-276.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Brilliant appearance: automotive coating by BASF honored with design award||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-276.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 3, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Brilliant appearance: automotive coating by BASF honored with design award</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">For many car owners, the color of their car is still the most important individualization factor. They are calling for more depth and dimensions. When it comes to automotive finishes, special effects can achieve subtle contrasts that lend the color a sophisticated vitality. With XSpark®, BASF’s Coatings division has developed a color effect that has now been honored in one of the world’s most prestigious design competitions: the Red Dot Award: Product Design.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-276.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-270" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-270.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||World’s first rear axle transmission crossbeam made of plastic in the S-Class from Mercedes-Benz||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-270.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 2, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">World’s first rear axle transmission crossbeam made of plastic in the S-Class from Mercedes-Benz</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">The world’s first plastic transmission crossbeam in the rear axle subframe has been developed by ContiTech Vibration Control and BASF for the S-Class from Mercedes-Benz. It is made from the engineering plastic Ultramid® A3WG10 CR, a specialty polyamide from BASF which is particularly reinforced and optimized to withstand high mechanical loads. Compared to the previous beam made from die-cast aluminum, this highly durable component offers a weight saving of 25%.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-270.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-273" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-273.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to sell stake in SolVin to Solvay||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-273.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 1, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to sell stake in SolVin to Solvay</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – July 1, 2015 – BASF is selling its 25% share in the joint venture SolVin to Solvay. The transaction will take place on July 1, 2015. Financial details were not disclosed.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-273.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-274" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-274.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF completes divestiture of textile chemicals business to Archroma ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-274.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">July 1, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF completes divestiture of textile chemicals business to Archroma </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Singapore – July 1, 2015 – BASF has closed the previously announced transaction to divest its global textile chemicals business to Archroma, a supplier of specialty chemicals to the textile, paper and emulsions industries. BASF will continue to manufacture and supply textile chemical products to Archroma.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/07/p-15-274.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-272" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-272.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Fraunhofer IPMS-CNT jointly develop electronic materials||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-272.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 30, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Fraunhofer IPMS-CNT jointly develop electronic materials</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Dresden (Germany) – June 30, 2015 – BASF and Fraunhofer IPMS-CNT announced today that they have joined forces to develop innovative solutions for the semiconductor industry. BASF has installed a modern tool for electrochemical metal deposition at the Fraunhofer IPMS Center for Nanoelectronic Technologies (CNT) in Dresden.</div><div class="search-result__actions" EO-based products in the portfolio of Care Chemicals as of July 10, 2015</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – June 29, 2015 – BASF will lift Force Majeure declared on May 21 for ethylene oxide (EO)-based products produced in Europe in the portfolio of Home Care and Industrial and Institutional Cleaning, Formulation Technologies, AgChem Additives data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-262" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-262.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Application process for the fourth “Science Award for Electrochemistry” of BASF and Volkswagen starts now||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-262.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 25, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Application process for the fourth “Science Award for Electrochemistry” of BASF and Volkswagen starts now</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen and Wolfsburg/Germany, June 25, 2015 – The international “Science Award for Electrochemistry” of BASF and Volkswagen is set to be awarded for the fourth time. Outstanding scientists from all over the world are now able to submit applications online at www.science-award.com. The website also explains the conditions and the selection process. The closing date for entries is July 24, 2015. The entries submitted will be judged by a jury made up of experts from BASF and Volkswagen and representatives from academia. The awards ceremony will take place on October 28, 2015, in Tokyo, Japan.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-262.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-264" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-264.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF licenses valureTM technology to  EM.tec design GmbH||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-264.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 23, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF licenses valureTM technology to  EM.tec design GmbH</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – June 23, 2015 – BASF SE has entered into a technology license agreement with EM.tec design GmbH for the production of valure™. The new production plant, located in Bingen, Germany, will have an annual capacity of about 1.5 million square meters of surface finished material. With this BASF has extended the availability of valure™ globally, complementing the existing production facility in India, which started up last year. BASF supports its licensing partners with the chemistry, technology know-how, and joint development with customers as well as application-oriented services.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-264.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-265" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-265.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF commissions pilot plant for the production of novel PU-aerogel insulating panels||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-265.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 23, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF commissions pilot plant for the production of novel PU-aerogel insulating panels</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In April, BASF commissioned the pilot plant for the manufacturing of SLENTITE®, its new high-performance product. The large-sized insulating panels will initially serve the optimization of the performance profile and will subsequently be supplied to selected cooperation partners. This high-performance insulating material based on a polyurethane aerogel is thus the first to be available in the form of a heavy-duty panel. SLENTITE® combines all the key properties of a forward-looking insulating material for both new construction projects and renovation.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-265.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-266" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-266.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle the challenges of sustainable food in Chicago||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-266.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 23, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle the challenges of sustainable food in Chicago</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 23, 2015 – BASF is hosting a Science Symposium in Chicago to address one of the world’s pressing future challenges: sustainable food. Under the banner of “Sustainable Food Chain – From Field to Table,” eminent scientists, academics, and thought leaders from a variety of disciplines are meeting to discuss how food production can be more sustainable along the complete supply chain necessary to feed a growing world population. These are the first plants for acrylic acid and superabsorbent polymers in South America. The complex has a capacity of 160,000 tons of acrylic acid per year. The investment of more than €500 million is the largest in BASF’s more than century-long history in South America.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-260.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-256" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-256.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF declares Force Majeure for Polyamide 66 Compounds||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-256.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 18, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF declares Force Majeure for Polyamide 66 Compounds</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Due to production problems in the Hexamethylenediamine (HMD)-plant in Seal Sands (UK), BASF has declared Force Majeure for Hexamethylenediamine (HMD), AH salt and Polyamide 66 polymer on Tuesday, June 16th, 2015. They have established the world’s first certified production of copra, the dried coconut flesh needed to process coconut oil. portfolio management method to thinkstep</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 3, 2015 – BASF and thinkstep today announced their intention to collaborate in the marketing of the Sustainable Solution Steering method developed by BASF for sustainable portfolio management. In pursuit of this aim, the two organizations have signed a licensing agreement that extends their existing alliance. thinkstep is specialized in the development and marketing of sustainability software and has many years of experience as a sustainability assessment consultant. The aim of the licensing is to support BASF customers and other organizations in assessing and steering their product portfolio in line with sustainability criteria. The Sustainable Solution Steering method will be integrated in the thinkstep.one sustainability platform for that purpose.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-243.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-236" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-236.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF presents broad portfolio of surfactants at CESIO Congress in Istanbul||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/06/p-15-236.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">June 1, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF presents broad portfolio of surfactants at CESIO Congress in Istanbul</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Istanbul, Turkey – June 1, 2015 – BASF is participating in the 10th CESIO World Surfactant Congress at the Haliç Congress Center in Istanbul, Turkey, from June 1 to 3, 2015. This new research and development (R&amp;D) center will focus on global agricultural research on herbicides, fungicides, and insecticides, as well as on solutions that go beyond classical crop protection.
