To answer this question, three twelfth-grade students from the agricultural program at the Edith Stein School in Ravensburg, Germany, set up a research project to examine how crops can be cultivated in the microgravity of space. The research trial is scheduled for take-off to the International Space Station (ISS) by the end of 2015, and will have the scientific and financial sponsorship of BASF.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-232.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-234" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-234.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle the challenges of urban living in New York City||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-234.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 26, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle the challenges of urban living in New York City</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Florham Park/New Jersey, United States, May 26, 2015 – BASF is hosting a week-long program in New York City to address one of the world’s pressing future challenges: urban development to meet our growing population. Thought leaders, scientists, students and citizens are participating in a series of events to identify sustainable solutions. Red Hook, Brooklyn, is serving as the case study on how public-private partnerships can help resolve the evolving needs of global cities.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-234.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-230" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-230.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF declares Force Majeure for a range of EO-based products in the portfolio of Care Chemicals||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-230.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 21, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF declares Force Majeure for a range of EO-based products in the portfolio of Care Chemicals</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – May 21, 2015 – BASF’s European production sites for ethylene oxide have experienced significant technical problems leading to a Force Majeure declaration on ethylene oxide on May 19, 2015. Due to the ethylene oxide (EO) shortage BASF has subsequently to declare Force Majeure for EO-based products produced in Europe in the portfolio of Home Care and Industrial &amp; Institutional Cleaning, Formulation Technologies, AgChem Additives and certain EO-based products in the portfolio of Personal Care.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-230.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-WH-15-18" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-WH-15-18.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Wintershall ceases activities in Qatar||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-WH-15-18.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 20, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Wintershall ceases activities in Qatar</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Doha / Kassel. Wintershall is ceasing its activities in Qatar and is returning Block 4 North near the North Field off the Qatari coast on 25 May 2015. Wintershall’s office in Doha will be closed. In 2013, Wintershall made the “Al Radeef” gas discovery off the cost of Qatar.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-WH-15-18.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-225" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-225.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Lumina® Royal effect pigments provide new design options for the plastics industry||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-225.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 13, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Lumina® Royal effect pigments provide new design options for the plastics industry</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF now offers all five effect pigments of its Lumina® Royal product series for plastics applications. This will enable producers of plastics all over the world to create attractive design options in blue and copper color shades. Already in 2010, BASF introduced the effect pigment Lumina Royal Blue for plastics applications into the market.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-225.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-224" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-224.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF acquires intellectual property for a new manufacturing process of high molecular weight polyisobutene (HM PIB) from LANXESS||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-224.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 11, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF acquires intellectual property for a new manufacturing process of high molecular weight polyisobutene (HM PIB) from LANXESS</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen/Köln, Germany – May 11, 2015: BASF and LANXESS have signed an agreement on BASF’s purchase of the polyisobutene business consisting mainly of intellectual property for a new, innovative technology to produce high molecular weight polyisobutene (HM PIB). On behalf of BASF, LANXESS will exclusively manufacture the new HM PIB for BASF in existing assets under a long term toll manufacturing agreement. BASF will market the products under the product name Oppanol® N.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-224.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-208" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-208.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to focus pharmaceutical ingredients business on its core expertise ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-208.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 7, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to focus pharmaceutical ingredients business on its core expertise </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – May 7, 2015 – BASF plans to focus its pharmaceutical ingredients &amp; services business within the Nutrition &amp; Health division on its core expertise in pharmaceutical excipients. To implement this decision, BASF intends to divest its custom synthesis business and parts of its current active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) business to Siegfried Holding AG.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-208.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-222" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-222.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF inaugurates new plant for high performance Ultramid® in China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/05/p-15-222.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">May 6, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF inaugurates new plant for high performance Ultramid® in China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – May 6, 2015 – BASF today inaugurated its new Ultramid® (polyamide 6 and 6/6.6) polymerization plant at the Shanghai Chemical Industry Park in Shanghai, China. data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 23, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">“We create chemistry – yesterday, today and tomorrow” BASF celebrates its 150th anniversary with over 1,000 guests</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – April 23, 2015 – BASF celebrated its 150th anniversary today in the Feierabendhaus in Ludwigshafen. “150 years is a special company anniversary – an opportunity to look back and reflect, but also to look forward,” said Dr. Kurt Bock, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE. German Chancellor Dr. Angela Merkel and Malu Dreyer, Minister-President of the State of Rhineland-Palatinate also congratulated BASF in front of an audience of more than 1,000 guests from government, business, science and society.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-213.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-201" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-201.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF introduces new anti-fake technology to tackle counterfeit crop protection products in China ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-201.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 20, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF introduces new anti-fake technology to tackle counterfeit crop protection products in China </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – April 20, 2015 – BASF is leading the fight against counterfeiting in the crop protection market by investing in brand new anti-fake technology. In China the company is introducing an innovative product label that features an identification system developed by BASF and a local partner in exclusive collaboration. This technology will ensure that farmers in China can buy genuine BASF crop protection products.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-201.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-203" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-203.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF and Grolman collaborate in Europe||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-203.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 17, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Grolman collaborate in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 17, 2015 – Effective immediately, BASF and Neuss/Germany-based Gustav Grolman GmbH &amp; Co. KG will start an exclusive collaboration in the marketing of amine-based curing agents of the Baxxodur® brand in Europe. Grolman will initially market the BASF specialty chemicals for the countries of Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, Ireland and Great Britain, specifically for use in epoxy resin based applications. Examples are thermosetting laminates, highly resistant floor coatings, corrosion protection varnish and composite materials. The products are used in the construction industry as well as in the automotive, marine, aerospace and industrial applications manufacturing.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-203.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-205" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-205.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF signs manufacturing agreement with Guangdong Yinfan Chemistry Co., Ltd. on automotive refinish coatings||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-205.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">April 17, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF signs manufacturing agreement with Guangdong Yinfan Chemistry Co., Ltd. on automotive refinish coatings</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – BASF’s Coatings Division has entered into a manufacturing agreement with Guangdong Yinfan Chemistry Co., Ltd. (“Yinfan”). Yinfan has recently opened its new production plant in Jiangmen City, Guangdong Province, China. Under the agreement with BASF, Yinfan will manufacture automotive refinish coatings, targeting the non-premium segment, for BASF at this new plant using BASF formulas and technologies.</div><div Polyamide 6 base polymers and Caprolactam in Europe</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will increase the prices for all Polyamide 6 base polymer grades (for film, The opening ceremony took place in the presence of Ralf Spettmann, President of BASF´s Construction Chemicals Division, and Dr. Markus Kamieth, President of BASF´s Coatings Division.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/04/p-15-195.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-ir-15-03-30" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-ir-15-03-30.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Chemical Collective Wage Agreement 2015||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-ir-15-03-30.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 30, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Chemical Collective Wage Agreement 2015</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">After nine regional and three central rounds of negotiation, BAVC and IG BCE have reached an accord in the wage dispute: remuneration for the 550,000 employees at the 1,900 plants of the chemical and pharmaceutical industries will rise 2.8 percent after a one-month wage freeze. The wage increase shown in the table applies starting in the second month, but if a company is having particular economic difficulties, it can be postponed for two more months. The agreement will run for 17 months. Moreover, the current demography fund for 2016 will be increased to EUR 550 per employee under a collective agreement, and to EUR 750 starting in 2017.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-ir-15-03-30.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-189" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-189.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Mario Mehren to head BASF subsidiary Wintershall||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-189.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 27, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Mario Mehren to head BASF subsidiary Wintershall</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – March 27, 2015 – Mario Mehren, currently a member of the Board of Executive Directors of Wintershall responsible for Exploration &amp; Production Russia, North Africa and South America, has been named President of BASF’s Oil &amp; Gas division effective July 1, 2015, and in this function will be head of BASF’s subsidiary Wintershall. He succeeds Dr. Rainer Seele, who has been named CEO of OMV Aktiengesellschaft, Vienna, Austria, effective July 1, 2015. Seele has been head of Wintershall since 2009.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-189.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-182" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-182.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands production capacity and color range for Paliocrom® products ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-182.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 26, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands production capacity and color range for Paliocrom® products </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – March 26, 2015 – BASF will expand its capacity for the production of Paliocrom® effect pigments by more than 20 percent by 2017 in Ludwigshafen, Germany. The investment will enable the company to accommodate for the growing demand of its aluminum-based effect pigments in the automotive coatings sector. With an investment of approximately €10 million, BASF aims to strengthen its position in this fast-growing market.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-182.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-187" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-187.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||New lightweight and solar powered electric scooter a boost to sustainable urban mobility||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-187.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 26, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">New lightweight and solar powered electric scooter a boost to sustainable urban mobility</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF and Floatility have partnered for the development of an ultra-lightweight and solar-powered electric scooter. Project participants will make use of an online Model Predictive Control (MPC) of complex batch processes for the production of emulsion polymers, steel and silicon through the application of new sensor technologies, process models and automation tools.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-172.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-179" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-179.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Partners sign new agreement for joint catalysis laboratory “CaRLa” in Heidelberg||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-179.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 25, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Partners sign new agreement for joint catalysis laboratory “CaRLa” in Heidelberg</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – March 25, 2015 – BASF and Heidelberg University have signed a new agreement for their joint catalysis laboratory “Catalysis Research Laboratory” (CaRLa). data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-175" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-175.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||fabriktage 2015: BASF opens “Wunderkammer“ in Milan||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-175.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 20, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">fabriktage 2015: BASF opens “Wunderkammer“ in Milan</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">In the year of its 150th anniversary, BASF and its consultation center designfabrik® are exhibiting at the Milan Furniture Fair. The exhibition is being held in the old “La Posteria” customs hall in the historic quarter of Brera. In these atmospheric surroundings, BASF, with the support of the design trio DING3000, will be exhibiting materials and projects in a cabinet that will amaze with optical tricks and ideas. With this inspiring installation, BASF’s designfabrik® seeks to build practical associations between the achievements of the age when the company was founded, in 1865, and modern, high-tech materials. Meanwhile, experts will also be on hand to advise customers on suitable material choices. The exhibition in Milan thus takes up the threads of fabriktag, the successful customer event first hosted by designfabrik at Ludwigshafen in January 2014, for over 100 guests.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-175.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-178" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-178.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF expands its rice product portfolio with tailor-made, innovative fungicide formulation Seltima®||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-178.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 20, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF expands its rice product portfolio with tailor-made, innovative fungicide formulation Seltima®</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">East Java, Indonesia, March 20, 2015 – BASF has officially launched Seltima®, a fungicide designed to support farmers to produce high quality rice more efficiently. The special innovation aspect is its encapsulation technology that ensures a controlled release of the active ingredient. This allows a higher and long lasting product performance and better protection of the environment surrounding the plant. Available now in Indonesia, Seltima will be launched in other key rice producing countries in the near future.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-178.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-180" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-180.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle challenges of urban living||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-180.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 20, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF creates chemistry with stakeholders to tackle challenges of urban living</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – March 20, 2015 – BASF will connect people and ideas in six locations worldwide at the Creator Space™ tour, a year-long, global event series aiming to address the challenges of smart energy, food and urban living. The second stop, will take place in Shanghai, China, from March 20 to 27, 2015, with a focus on tackling the challenges brought about by increased urbanization.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-180.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-176" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-176.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF continues to evaluate natural gas-based investment on the U.S. Gulf Coast ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-176.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><img src="https://www.basf.com/global/press-photos/en/highlights/Digitalization/standorte_nach_regionen/nordamerika/506_Freeport_Texas_Verbund_site.jpg.dynamic.200w113h.c3cf36976005cec1990829d017974d4f1cb19378.jpeg" height="0" width="0" class="lazyload rendition" alt="" title="" data-v-b75ef9ba=""></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 19, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF continues to evaluate natural gas-based investment on the U.S. Gulf Coast </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – March 19, 2015 – BASF has made progress in its plans to build a world-scale methane-to-propylene complex on the U.S. Gulf Coast. The company has selected Freeport, Texas, as the potential site. It will use Air Liquide’s proprietary Lurgi MegaMethanol and Methanol-to-Propylene (MTP) technologies. BASF has contracted Air Liquide to provide basic engineering services for this gas-to-propylene complex.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-176.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-WH-15-03-19" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-WH-15-03-19.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Wintershall with stable income||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-WH-15-03-19.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 19, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Wintershall with stable income</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Kassel. Wintershall made a profit of more than one billion euros in 2014, for the fourth year in a row. The net income after taxes and minority interests was 1.464 billion euros (2013: 1.730). “Despite the low oil price, especially in the fourth quarter, in 2014 we achieved the second-best result in the company’s history,” says the Wintershall Chairman of the Executive Board, Rainer Seele. The income from operations before special items (EBIT) remained at a high level of 1.795 billion euros (2013: 1.856). Despite several months of interruptions to production in Libya, Wintershall managed to increase the oil and gas production to 136 million boe (2013: 132). The higher volumes, especially in Russia and Norway, were only partially able, however, to compensate for the lower prices.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-WH-15-03-19.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-160" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-160.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Engine covering made from flexible PU integral foam with the one-shot process||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-160.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 18, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Engine covering made from flexible PU integral foam with the one-shot process</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF has now developed a flexible polyurethane integral foam that can be used to produce lightweight engine coverings with the one-shot process. That is approximately €3 million more than in 2013. BASF will present the new product at its booth at the EWEA Offshore 2015 fair in Copenhagen, Denmark, from March 10 to 12.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-152.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-157" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-157.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches new Acrodur® binder for automotive lightweight composites||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-157.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">March 2, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches new Acrodur® binder for automotive lightweight composites</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – March 2, 2015 – BASF is launching a new binder – Acrodur® Power 2750 X. The product is designed for the production of natural fiber composites for automotive lightweight applications such as interior car door panels or shelves. As a low-emission alternative to formaldehyde-based reactive resins, Acrodur Power 2750 X gives natural fiber composites high mechanical stability. At the same time, the product offers thermoplastic processability and, unlike traditional thermoplastic binders based on polypropylene, it allows the use of up to 75 percent natural fibers in lightweight components.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/03/p-15-157.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-127" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-127.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF increases earnings in the 4th quarter and full year 2014||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-127.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 27, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF increases earnings in the 4th quarter and full year 2014</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – February 27, 2015 – “We achieved our goal for 2014: We increased earnings – despite the disappointing economic development in Europe. We grew profitably. We further strengthened our chemicals business and in turn improved our margins. We have our costs firmly under control. This is an outstanding achievement of the entire BASF team,” said Dr. Kurt Bock, Chairman of the Board of Executive Directors of BASF SE, at the Annual Press Conference in Ludwigshafen.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-127.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-150" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-150.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Anniversary bonus for BASF Group employees||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-150.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 27, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Anniversary bonus for BASF Group employees</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – February 27, 2015 – For the 150th anniversary, BASF Group employees around the world will receive a bonus of €100 million. Before feeding biogas to the gas grid, however, it needs to be cleaned. Raw biogas consists of only about 50 percent of methane – the actual energy carrier.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-144.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-145" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-145.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF at SIMAC 2015 in Milan: Polyurethane innovations for the footwear industry||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-145.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 18, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF at SIMAC 2015 in Milan: Polyurethane innovations for the footwear industry</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">This year the chemical company BASF presents its updated polyurethane portfolio and experience in footwear materials and processing at the SIMAC International Exhibition of Machines and Technologies for Footwear and Leathergoods Industries in Milan (Rho). The construction of this plant, which will be the first of its kind in the ASEAN region, is expected to commence in Q2 of 2015. The plant, with a total annual capacity of 30,000 metric tons of 2-EHAcid, is expected to start production in the fourth quarter of 2016. The new plant will benefit from backward integration into the site, allowing high delivery reliability and maximizing efficient use of energy and feedstock.</div><div class="search-result__actions" class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 10, Germany – February 9, 2015 The Open Innovation Contest BASF is starting today aims to find ideas to store energy from renewable energy sources. The contest calls for sustainable technologies which are capable of storing power from the grid and feeding it back into it. Together with companies, scientists, start-ups and inventors, BASF is looking for efficient solutions to store electricity on a long-term basis, which are financially viable, for example through lower investment costs. Innovative chemistry should play a central role in the submitted proposals.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-125.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-136" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-136.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF receives Excellent Supplier: Leading Technology Award from Shanghai General Motors in China||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-136.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 9, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF receives Excellent Supplier: Leading Technology Award from Shanghai General Motors in China</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Shanghai, China – February 9, 2015 – BASF offers its customers individual coatings solutions as the automotive industry focuses on sustainable manufacturing processes. The additional capacities will be available as of 2017. Bismuth vanadate pigments are yellow pigments with a special greenish color tone, that BASF markets under the Sicopal® and Paliotan® brand names. Customers use them for the formulation of paints, coatings and plastic coatings.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-130.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-133" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-133.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Largest BASF site for cosmetic ingredients obtains GMP certification ||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-133.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">February 5, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Largest BASF site for cosmetic ingredients obtains GMP certification </h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Dusseldorf-Holthausen, Germany – February 5, 2015 – BASF has obtained another Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certification for cosmetic ingredients in accordance with the requirements of the European Federation for Cosmetic Ingredients (EFfCI). Now BASF’s largest site worldwide for the production of ingredients for the personal care industry in Dusseldorf-Holthausen, has also successfully passed the audit.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/02/p-15-133.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-01-29" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-01-29.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF starts up new polymer dispersions plant in Pasir Gudang, Malaysia||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-01-29.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 29, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF starts up new polymer dispersions plant in Pasir Gudang, Malaysia</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Pasir Gudang, Malaysia – January 29, 2015 – BASF is further strengthening its production footprint in Asia Pacific with the start-up of its first production plant for polymer dispersions in Pasir Gudang, Malaysia. This production plant is built at the existing BASF production site, located in the Pasir Gudang Industrial Park of the Johor Free Trade Zone. The plant is BASF’s third polymer dispersions plant in ASEAN, complementing the existing dispersions plants in Jakarta and Merak, Indonesia.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-01-29.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-121" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-121.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF increases production capacity of vitamin A||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-121.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 26, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF increases production capacity of vitamin A</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 26, 2015 – BASF increases its production capacities for vitamin A by 25 %. With this capacity extension, BASF reacted to the rising demand for its high-quality vitamin A products, as well as to the global market growth.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-121.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-123" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-123.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||European production and competence center for flooring and waterproofing systems starts operations||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-123.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 26, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">European production and competence center for flooring and waterproofing systems starts operations</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Since January 2015, BASF’s new European competence center for flooring and waterproofing systems at Oldenburg, Germany, has been fully operational. Manufacture of the Masters Builders Solutions products has been relocated from Schaffhausen, Switzerland. This relocation was the key step in the continuing development of business following the sale of the CONICA Sports Surfaces business and the Schaffhausen, Switzerland, facility in July 2013.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-123.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-120" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-120.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF plans worldwide expansion of PVP production||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-120.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 22, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF plans worldwide expansion of PVP production</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany – January 22, 2015 – BASF plans to invest up to €56 million in the expansion of its Polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP) value chain over the next four years. PVP is a polymer which is used in diverse industries, for example the pharmaceutical or the personal and home care sector, mainly due to its binding properties. Through revamping existing plants in Ludwigshafen, Germany and Geismar, Louisiana and introducing the PVP technology at BASF’s site in Shanghai, China, the company will increase its global PVP production capacities by up to 6.000 metric tons. All plants will operate under the highest possible quality standards (current Good Manufacturing Practice). BASF is the inventor and one of the market leaders for PVP.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-120.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-118" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-118.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||With MasterSeal® 6100 FX BASF offers a high-performance lightweight waterproofing slurry||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-118.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 21, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">With MasterSeal® 6100 FX BASF offers a high-performance lightweight waterproofing slurry</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Mannheim, Germany – January 21, 2015 – Two years after having been launched in the European markets, MasterSeal 6100 FX has become a reality used in several European countries and in the most complex and demanding waterproofing projects. MasterSeal 6100 FX is a highly flexible and elastic one-component membrane, with low consumption and rapid-curing. Its main advantages derive from its highly advanced technology that combines the most powerful binding systems with the addition of powdery polymers. The product is part of the Master Builders Solutions product range under which BASF bundles its advanced chemical solutions for new construction, maintenance, repair and renovation of structures.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-118.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-119" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-119.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF to increase capacity for butanediol at its Geismar site||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-119.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 21, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF to increase capacity for butanediol at its Geismar site</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF will increase its production capacities for the chemical intermediate 1,4-butanediol (BDO) by 10% at its site in Geismar/Louisiana as of 2016. The company will then have a global capacity of BDO of 670,000 metric tons per year. Additionally, BASF looks into further measures to strengthen and to expand its BDO value chain at the Geismar site. To increase the capacities of BDO according to the steadily growing customer demand, BASF continuously implements measures to boost efficiency and improve infrastructure at all its sites.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-119.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-113" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-113.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||One value – many strengths: BASF launches new Styrodur® on the market||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-113.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 19, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">One value – many strengths: BASF launches new Styrodur® on the market</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF is enlarging its product range of extruded polystyrene rigid foam panels (XPS) with the brand name Styrodur® to include a new product: Styrodur® 3000 CS has the same thermal conductivity of 33 mW/mK across all panel thicknesses from 30 to 240 mm. The MAAS Profile / BEMO Systems GmbH company group has teamed up with BASF in developing the first bracket for ventilated façades made of the thermoplastic Ultramid® to be awarded a DIBt (Deutsches Institut für Bautechnik) national technical approval. The plastic, an extra high-strength polyamide compound, is already in successful use in the automotive industry, e.g. for engines mounts, and is now being launched as an innovative material for ventilated façades in the construction sector. Similar materials have already been performing impeccably in the thermal separators of aluminum façades and windows for decades.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-117.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-112" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-112.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches year-long, global tour to boost  co-creation||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-112.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 16, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches year-long, global tour to boost  co-creation</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Mumbai, India – January 16, 2015 –BASF will connect people and ideas in six locations worldwide at the Creator Space™ tour, a year-long, global event series aiming to address the challenges of smart energy, food and urban living. 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Cosmetagora 2015: BASF presents trend-driven skin and color care solutions inspired by life</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Having a clear insight into consumers’ needs and anticipating future trends are crucial for creating successful personal care products. At this year’s Cosmetagora exhibition, BASF showcases two new personal care solutions inspired by life: the anti-aging face care concept “Beautiful Faces” and “Color Trends 2016” – a trend-driven collection of effect pigments (booth 120-121).</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-105.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-106" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-106.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches “Beautiful Faces” – a needs-based formulation concept for anti-aging face care solutions||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-106.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 13, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches “Beautiful Faces” – a needs-based formulation concept for anti-aging face care solutions</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Probably everyone wishes for a smooth, rosy skin, firm and without any wrinkles into old age. However, as of the age of 25 the texture and structure of the skin begins to change. This is where “Beautiful Faces” comes into play – a new anti-aging face care concept developed by BASF: “Our new formulation concept and the solutions we propose cater for a substantial anti-aging effect”, said Stéphane Lacoutière, Marketing Manager Personal Care Europe. “What is more, ‘Beautiful Faces’ provides manufacturers with great inspiration for targeting specific consumer needs, based on consumer research and a validated typology system.”</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-106.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-107" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-107.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||BASF launches “Color Trends 2016”||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-107.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 13, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">BASF launches “Color Trends 2016”</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">What is coming next? And what will stick around? Like the fashion industry, cosmetics manufacturers keep a watchful eye far in advance on up-and-coming color trends. To help them bring the latest hues of lipstick, eyeliner and other products onto their shelves, BASF is offering its customers an extensive portfolio of effect pigments already for the cutting-edge colors of the future.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-107.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-1" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-1.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Monsanto and BASF announce progress in annual collaboration pipeline update||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-1.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 7, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Monsanto and BASF announce progress in annual collaboration pipeline update</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">ST. LOUIS / LUDWIGSHAFEN, Jan. 7, 2015 – Monsanto Company’s (NYSE: MON) annual research and development (R&amp;D) update published today highlights project advancements across the company’s six research and development platforms, including: breeding, biotechnology, crop protection, ag microbials, ag biologicals, and precision agriculture, all aimed at sustainably maximizing farmer productivity while utilizing resources like water and land more efficiently.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-ir-15-1.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div><div class="news-result search-result" data-component-single-link="/content/basf/www/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-100" data-url-component-single-link="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-100.html" data-tracking-type="navigation" data-tracking-category="link" data-tracking-action="click news-link" data-tracking-value="news||Premiere of cutting-edge cooling appliance at CES 2015||/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-100.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="" data-v-c959c6c8=""><div class="search-result__teaser" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="picture-container" data-v-b75ef9ba="" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--></div></div><div class="search-result__content" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><div class="search-result__header" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><!--v-if--><!--v-if--><span class="news-result__date" data-v-5db4dc0c="">January 6, 2015</span></div><h3 class="search-result__title" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Premiere of cutting-edge cooling appliance at CES 2015</h3><div class="search-result__description" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Ludwigshafen, Germany and Las Vegas, Nevada, January 6, 2015. Haier, a leading global manufacturer of household appliances, Astronautics Corporation of America, a global technology company, and BASF, the world’s leading chemical company, present at the International Consumer Electronics Show (CES, Jan. 6 - 9) in Las Vegas, Nevada, a proof‑of‑concept wine cooler refrigerated by a magnetocaloric heat pump.</div><div class="search-result__actions" data-v-5db4dc0c=""><a class="search-result__read-more basf:link-unstyled" href="/global/en/media/news-releases/2015/01/p-15-100.html" data-v-5db4dc0c="">Read More</a></div></div></div></div>
